subject: BMEG
title: Introduction to Biomedical Engineering
description: Foundational material spanning the four streams of the BMEG undergraduate program. Topics include: sensors and instrumentation; biosignals; physiological modeling; biomechanics; biomaterials; cellular engineering; regenerative medicine; and engineering design in these contexts. [3-0-2*] Prerequisite: APSC 100. Corequisite: BMEG 102.
prerequisite_raw: APSC 100. Corequisite: BMEG 102.
corequisite_raw: BMEG 102.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomedical Engineering Lab
description: Introduction to the breadth of laboratory and experimental techniques in biomedical engineering. Hydrogel design, genetic engineering of bacteria, bioinformatics pipeline construction, electrical instrumentation, and bioreactor design. Credit will only be granted for one of BMEG_V 102 and BMEG_V 200. [1-2-0] Prerequisite: One of PHYS 12, PHYS_V 100 Corequisite: BMEG_V 101. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of PHYS 12, PHYS_V 100 Corequisite: BMEG_V 101. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: BMEG_V 101. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Introduction to the breadth of laboratory and experimental techniques in biomedical engineering. Hydrogel design, genetic engineering of bacteria, bioinformatics pipeline construction, electrical instrumentation, and bioreactor design. Credit will only be granted for one of BMEG_V 102 and BMEG_V 200. [1-2-0] Prerequisite: One of PHYS 12, PHYS_V 100 Corequisite: BMEG_V 101. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomedical Engineering Bridge Module
description: Core concepts of biomedical engineering with a focus on advanced biological concepts that are inherent in biomechanics analysis, biomaterials signals and systems, bioinformatics and cellular bioengineering. Credit will only be granted for one of BMEG 102 and BMEG 200. Prerequisite: All of APSC 101, PHYS 159. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of APSC 101, PHYS 159. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Core concepts of biomedical engineering with a focus on advanced biological concepts that are inherent in biomechanics analysis, biomaterials signals and systems, bioinformatics and cellular bioengineering. Credit will only be granted for one of BMEG 102 and BMEG 200. Prerequisite: All of APSC 101, PHYS 159. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Technical Communication for Biomedical Engineers
description: Report preparation, business correspondence, and oral presentation in biomedical engineering specific cases and projects. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 201 or APSC 201. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of APSC 176, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121, WRDS 150. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of APSC 176, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121, WRDS 150. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Report preparation, business correspondence, and oral presentation in biomedical engineering specific cases and projects. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 201 or APSC 201. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of APSC 176, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121, WRDS 150. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Thermodynamics in Biomedical Engineering
description: Work, heat and energy; material and energy balances; the first law and second law of thermodynamics; entropy and process reversibility; availability (energy) analysis; Hess's Law; thermodynamic properties of fluids; and applications to biomedical systems. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: PHYS 157. CHEM 123 is recommended This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: PHYS 157. CHEM 123 is recommended This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Circuits and Electromagnetics with Application to Biomedical Engineering
description: Electromagnetic phenomena in the body; bioinstrumentation; electrostatic and electromagnetic fields, forces, capacitance and inductance; bio-effects of electromagnetic fields; and modelling electrical components of physiological and biomedical systems. [4-0-2*] Prerequisite: All of PHYS 158, MATH 253, MATH 256. Corequisite: MATH 264. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of PHYS 158, MATH 253, MATH 256. Corequisite: MATH 264. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MATH 264. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomechanics I
description: Integrating the study of two dimensional movement of animals and humans with the study of the manner in which forces on biomechanical structures such as bones, ligaments, tendons, muscles and joints cause motion. Techniques of solid mechanics and two dimensional rigid body dynamics. Students who have received credit for MECH 435 cannot also receive credit for BMEG 230 or BMEG 330. [4-2*-2*] Prerequisite: Either (a) all of BMEG 101, PHYS 170 or (b) all of APSC 101, BMEG 200, PHYS 170. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) all of BMEG 101, PHYS 170 or (b) all of APSC 101, BMEG 200, PHYS 170. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: The Fundamental Units of Life: From Cells To Systems
description: The structure and function of cells and how they are organized to generate tissues and organ systems [3-3*-0] Prerequisite: One of CHEM 12, CHEM 100. BIOL 12 strongly recommended
prerequisite_raw: One of CHEM 12, CHEM 100. BIOL 12 strongly recommended

subject: BMEG
title: Cellular Physiology and Biophysics
description: Cellular structure and mechanisms of membrane transport, signal transduction, muscle mechanochemistry and neurotransmission. Structure and hierarchical organization up to the level of tissues. Light and electron microscopy. [3-1-0] Prerequisite: All of BMEG 245, MATH 256. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of BMEG 245, MATH 256. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomedical Engineering Design I
description: Engineering design process for biomedical technologies. Practical skills in engineering design, computer aided design, electronic circuits, programming, and rapid prototyping in the context of biomedical technologies. Introduction to broader ethical and sustainability considerations for biomedical technology design. [2-4-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) all of BMEG 101, BMEG 102 or (b) all of APSC 101, BMEG 200, PHYS 159. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) all of BMEG 101, BMEG 102 or (b) all of APSC 101, BMEG 200, PHYS 159. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Introduction to Bioinformatics
description: Principles behind the methods of bioinformatics. The use of bioinformatics databases and tools for solving problems in genomics, proteomics, structural biology and evolutionary biology. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: BMEG 245 and one of CPEN 221, CPEN 223. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BMEG 245 and one of CPEN 221, CPEN 223. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Bioengineering Feedback Systems and Controls
description: Modelling, analysis and simulation of dynamic systems; system modelling by state space; linearization; feedback, stability and sensitivity; control system design. Examples from biological systems, assistive systems and biomedical equipment. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) BMEG 220 or (b) all of ELEC 221, ELEC 201, ELEC 202. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) BMEG 220 or (b) all of ELEC 221, ELEC 201, ELEC 202. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomedical Instrumentation
description: Fundamental working principles of medical instruments used for measurements of nervous, respiratory and circulatory systems with focus on biopotential signals. Other topics include medical imaging, as well as minimally invasive and robotic surgery. Credit will only be granted for one of BMEG 321, ELEC 371. [2-3-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) MATH 256 or (b) all of MATH 265, MATH 267; and either (a) BMEG 220 or (b) one of ELEC 211, PHYS 301 and one of ELEC 201, ELEC 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MATH 256 or (b) all of MATH 265, MATH 267; and either (a) BMEG 220 or (b) one of ELEC 211, PHYS 301 and one of ELEC 201, ELEC 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Fundamental working principles of medical instruments used for measurements of nervous, respiratory and circulatory systems with focus on biopotential signals. Other topics include medical imaging, as well as minimally invasive and robotic surgery. Credit will only be granted for one of BMEG 321, ELEC 371. [2-3-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) MATH 256 or (b) all of MATH 265, MATH 267; and either (a) BMEG 220 or (b) one of ELEC 211, PHYS 301 and one of ELEC 201, ELEC 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomechanics II
description: Principles and common elements of sports-, orthopaedic-, injury- and cellular length-biomechanics. Improving sports performance and preventing overuse injuries through sports biomechanics, designing orthopaedic implants through orthopaedic biomechanics, preventing injuries through injury biomechanics and identifying and filtering cancerous blood cells through cellular biomechanics. Students who have received credit for MECH 435 cannot also receive credit for BMEG 230 or BMEG 330. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: BMEG 230. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BMEG 230. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Human Structure/Function from Cells to Systems
description: Human anatomy, histology and physiology with examples from biomedical engineering. Anatomical compartmentation and function regulation; homeostatic control systems, sensors and effectors; intercellular communication strategies; and cellular and organ function assessment. [4-0-0] Prerequisite: All of BMEG 245, BMEG 250. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of BMEG 245, BMEG 250. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomedical Engineering Design II
description: Creating innovations in biomedical technologies. Supervised design process for clinical clients, involving the building, testing, and verification of prototypes with potential users. [3*-3*-0] Prerequisite: BMEG 257. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BMEG 257. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Transport Phenomena within Cells and Tissues
description: Fluid flow and mass transport analysis within healthy and diseased cells and tissues using mathematics. Drug delivery and tissue engineering. [3-0-2*] Prerequisite: One of MATH 253, MATH 217 and either (a) MATH 256 or (b) all of MATH 255, MATH 257. Equivalency: CHBE 470 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 253, MATH 217 and either (a) MATH 256 or (b) all of MATH 255, MATH 257. Equivalency: CHBE 470 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomedical Materials and Drug Delivery
description: Biomaterials science/engineering applied to design and synthesis of drug delivery systems. Biomaterial types, synthesis and testing; the use of biomaterials; biological response; biocompatibility and degradation; drug delivery systems; nanocarriers; modification of polymers; liposomes and micelles; nucleic acid, transdermal and oral delivery. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: All of BMEG 250, CHEM 123. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of BMEG 250, CHEM 123. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Microfluidics
description: Advantages and disadvantages of miniaturization of complex fluid flow processes. Manipulating liquid flow; electrophoretic velocity and mobility; serial dilution; capillary electrophoresis; integrated microfluidic platforms; and blood and the motility of bacteria. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Cellular Bioengineering: Laboratory & Design
description: Fundamental genetic, molecular, and tissue engineering techniques. Design of experiments and tools related to these essential cellular bioengineering techniques. [1-3-1] Prerequisite: BMEG 245. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BMEG 245. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Economics of Healthcare Solutions
description: Canadian and USA engineering economics in BME and healthcare systems. Economic equivalence, cost estimation, risk assessment, regulatory frameworks, economic optimization, intangible factors, ethics, sustainability, financial tools, commercialization and regulator regimes. [3-0-0]

subject: BMEG
title: Impact of Biomedical Engineering on Society, Sustainability and Environmental Stewardship
description: Impact of biomedical engineering on health, safety, and political, cultural, economical and environmental implications of biomedical engineering design. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomedical Equipment, Physiology, and Anatomy
description: Principles and operation of biomedical equipment for cardiovascular system, respiratory system, renal dialysis, endoscopy, surgery, and imaging. Functional relationships of biomedical equipment to physiology and anatomy of major body systems. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 410 or BMEG 510. [3-0-2*]
exclusion_raw: Principles and operation of biomedical equipment for cardiovascular system, respiratory system, renal dialysis, endoscopy, surgery, and imaging. Functional relationships of biomedical equipment to physiology and anatomy of major body systems. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 410 or BMEG 510. [3-0-2*]

subject: BMEG
title: Medical Imaging
description: Physical principles of ultrasound, magnetic resonance, computed tomography, X-ray projection imaging and molecular imaging in medical imaging for diagnostics, therapeutics and interventions. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of BMEG 220, BMEG 250 and one of BMEG 321, ELEC 371. Equivalency: ELEC 471
prerequisite_raw: One of BMEG 220, BMEG 250 and one of BMEG 321, ELEC 371. Equivalency: ELEC 471

subject: BMEG
title: Linear Systems in Optics
description: Linear system theory and Fourier Optics, applications in optics including wave propagation and image quality assessment. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 421 or BMEG 521. Prerequisite: ELEC 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: ELEC 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Linear system theory and Fourier Optics, applications in optics including wave propagation and image quality assessment. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 421 or BMEG 521. Prerequisite: ELEC 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Modern Biomedical Optical Imaging
description: Advanced multimodal optical imaging concepts, fundamental optics, optical OCT theories, advanced modern OCT technologies, and OCT application in clinical medicine and biomedical engineering. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 422 or BMEG 522. Prerequisite: BMEG 421. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BMEG 421. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Advanced multimodal optical imaging concepts, fundamental optics, optical OCT theories, advanced modern OCT technologies, and OCT application in clinical medicine and biomedical engineering. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 422 or BMEG 522. Prerequisite: BMEG 421. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Clinical Informatics
description: Fundamental concepts in clinical information systems, decision support, and mobile health. Application of information engineering to health care, including the management and use of patient health and well-being information. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 423 or BMEG 523. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Fundamental concepts in clinical information systems, decision support, and mobile health. Application of information engineering to health care, including the management and use of patient health and well-being information. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 423 or BMEG 523. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Genome Informatics
description: Principles and best practices in analyzing genomics data. Genome architecture, mappability, repeat elements, ChIP-seq, open chromatin, histone modifications, single cell technologies, genome wide association studies, statistical analyses, computational analysis, data processing. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 424 or BMEG 524. Prerequisite: BMEG 310. or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BMEG 310. or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Principles and best practices in analyzing genomics data. Genome architecture, mappability, repeat elements, ChIP-seq, open chromatin, histone modifications, single cell technologies, genome wide association studies, statistical analyses, computational analysis, data processing. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 424 or BMEG 524. Prerequisite: BMEG 310. or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomedical Robotics
description: Biomedical robotics, mathematical fundamentals of kinematics, dynamics and control of robots by human operators, and applications of biomedical robotics. Prerequisite: MATH 152 and one of BMEG 320, ELEC 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 152 and one of BMEG 320, ELEC 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Synthetic Biology Intensive
description: Core skills in DNA device engineering, molecular biology, mammalian cell culture, and data analysis through a self-led, real-world experimental and scientific reporting journey. Prerequisite: BMEG_V 245. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BMEG_V 245. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Professionalism and Ethics in Biomedical Engineering
description: Ethical, equity, and diversity issues and professionalism in Biomedical Engineering practice and design. Case studies and design projects will be used to expand on the foundation of biomedical engineering design, applying real-world ethical dilemmas including professional, medical, and research ethics. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Clinical and Industrial Biomedical Engineering
description: Principles of clinical practice, Canadian healthcare system, medical approach to diagnosis, ethics and regulations for clinical trials, medical technology management, medical device development and standards, biostatistics. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 257, BMEG 456, BMEG 556. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Principles of clinical practice, Canadian healthcare system, medical approach to diagnosis, ethics and regulations for clinical trials, medical technology management, medical device development and standards, biostatistics. Credit will be granted for only one of BMEG 257, BMEG 456, BMEG 556. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomedical Engineering Design Project
description: Capstone design and development of a practical biomedical device or system. Projects provided by local industry and engineering research laboratories. [1-3-1; 1-3-1] Prerequisite: All of BMEG 350, BMEG 357.
prerequisite_raw: All of BMEG 350, BMEG 357.

subject: BMEG
title: Cellular Responses to Forces and Biomaterials
description: Mechanical forces and biomaterials regulating cellular functions critical to tissue development, regeneration and repair. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: All of BMEG 245, BMEG 250, BMEG 350.
prerequisite_raw: All of BMEG 245, BMEG 250, BMEG 350.

subject: BMEG
title: Stem Cells and Regenerative Medicine
description: Biology and applications of stem cells in regenerative medicine. Modelling human biology and disease in vitro and in vivo. Regulatory and commercialization pathways for regenerative medicine innovations. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: All of BMEG 245, BMEG 250, BMEG 350. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of BMEG 245, BMEG 250, BMEG 350. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BMEG
title: Biomaterials
description: Engineered materials in medical applications with an emphasis on material properties, functionality, design, and material response in the biological environment. Credit will be granted for only one of MTRL 495 or BMEG 495. [2-0-2] Prerequisite: APSC 278. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: APSC 278. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Engineered materials in medical applications with an emphasis on material properties, functionality, design, and material response in the biological environment. Credit will be granted for only one of MTRL 495 or BMEG 495. [2-0-2] Prerequisite: APSC 278. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

title: Orientation to Clinical Environment
description: Operation of biomedical and clinical engineering facilities at hospitals. Daily activities of healthcare workers. Patients experience. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

title: Plant Molecular Biology Laboratory
description: Admission to the course is limited and requires recommendation from the Head of Botany or the Director of the Biotechnology Laboratory. Prerequisite: BIOL 335 is recommended as either a prerequisite or corequisite. Equivalency: PLNT540, FRST503 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BIOL 335 is recommended as either a prerequisite or corequisite. Equivalency: PLNT540, FRST503 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BOTA
title: M.Sc. Major Essay
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BOTA
title: Master's Thesis
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BOTA
title: Doctoral Dissertation
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Micro Foundations of Real Estate Economics
description: Basic principles of microeconomics and application to current economic problems.

subject: BUSI
title: Capital Markets and Real Estate
description: Basic principles of macroeconomics and application to current economic problems. Prerequisite: BUSI 100.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI 100.

subject: BUSI
title: British Columbia Real Estate Law and Real Estate Ethics
description: Canadian legal system and contract law and detailed aspects of real estate law as it applies in British Columbia.

subject: BUSI
title: Canadian Real Property Law and Real Estate Ethics
description: Canadian legal system and contract law and detailed aspects of real estate law as it applies across Canada.

subject: BUSI
title: Foundations of Real Estate Mathematics
description: Introduction to mathematics of real estate finance and statistical measures and methods and their application to practical real estate concepts.

subject: BUSI
title: Real Estate Finance in a Canadian Context
description: History, function and mechanics of Canadian mortgage markets. Prerequisite: [BUSI121]
prerequisite_raw: [BUSI121]

subject: BUSI
title: Introduction to Quantitative Decision Analysis
description: Introduction to decision models in business, including basic optimization, linear programming, probability, decision analysis, random variables, simulation, and solving decision problems using spreadsheet tools.

subject: BUSI
title: Application of Statistics in Business
description: Methods and applications of statistics in business; data analysis, descriptive regression; data generation; sampling distributions; hypothesis testing; confidence intervals; two sample problems; inference in regression. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Introductory Financial Accounting
description: Introduction to the construction and interpretation of financial reports prepared primarily for external use. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Introductory Management Accounting
description: Introduction to the development and use of accounting information for management planning and control, and the development of cost information for financial reports. Prerequisite: BUSI293 or equivalent. Corequisite: BUSI293 or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI293 or equivalent. Corequisite: BUSI293 or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: BUSI293 or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Business Economics
description: Introduction to microeconomics and macroeconomics principles with applications to accounting and business decision making. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Business Communications
description: Basic communication theory, communications in organizations. Includes written and oral practice in lab sessions.

subject: BUSI
title: Urban and Real Estate Economics
description: Comprehensive treatment of urban and real estate economics; introduction to study of cities and real estate market; analytical microeconomic principles. Prerequisite: All of BUSI_V 100, BUSI_V 101.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI_V 100, BUSI_V 101.

subject: BUSI
title: Principles of Organizational Behaviour
description: An introductory examination of work organizations and the behaviour of individuals within them. Phenomena to be studied include organizational structure, environments, group processes, motivation and leadership. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Foundations of Real Estate Appraisal
description: Introduction to concepts and techniques for appraising the value of real estate. Recommended pre-requisite: BUSI 121.

subject: BUSI
title: Real Estate Investment Analysis and Advanced Income Appraisal
description: Valuation techniques for income real estate, including income method of appraisal, tax consequences of real property ownership, and portfolio analysis methodology. Prerequisite: All of BUSI 121, BUSI 330.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI 121, BUSI 330.

subject: BUSI
title: Information Systems
description: Introduction to information technology related to business use: design, implementation, and application of information systems. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Statistical and Computer Applications in Valuation
description: Explores creative, practical uses of statistical and computer applications in determining and analyzing real estate value. Through case studies and hands-on computer work, students will learn the fundamentals of exploratory data analysis and appraisal valuation modelling.

subject: BUSI
title: Case Studies in Residential Valuation
description: Examines common issues that affect the practice of residential real estate valuation. Credit will be granted for only one of BUSI 352 or both BUSI 442 and BUSI 452. Prerequisite: BUSI 330. BUSI 121, BUSI 344 recommended.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI 330. BUSI 121, BUSI 344 recommended.
exclusion_raw: Examines common issues that affect the practice of residential real estate valuation. Credit will be granted for only one of BUSI 352 or both BUSI 442 and BUSI 452. Prerequisite: BUSI 330. BUSI 121, BUSI 344 recommended.

subject: BUSI
title: Intermediate Financial Accounting I
description: An examination of accounting as a means of measurement and as an information system for external reporting purposes. Prerequisite: BUSI293 or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI293 or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Cost Accounting
description: The provision and analysis of cost accounting information that will assist management in making operating decisions and in evaluating operational performance. Prerequisite: All of BUSI_V 294, BUSI_V 370. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI_V 294, BUSI_V 370. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Introduction to Income Tax
description: A study of income tax from the standpoint of the individual and business enterprise. Prerequisite: BUSI293 or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI293 or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Business Finance
description: An introduction to the basic principles of financial valuation and an examination of corporate enterprise decisions including working capital management; capital budgeting; capital structures and dividend policy. Prerequisite: BUSI293 or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI293 or equivalent. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Introduction to Management Information Systems
description: Overview of computer technology and terminology; use of computers as managerial and administrative tools; the management of computer resources and the influence of information technology within the organization. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Introduction to Business Law
description: Introduction to the law of contracts, with particular reference to contracts for sale of goods and related law of personal property, principles of agency, partnership, and company law. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Residential Property Guided Case Study
description: The residential property appraisal process, focusing both on valuation techniques as well as general research and report writing skills.

subject: BUSI
title: Logistics and Operations Management
description: The design and management of systems to make products, provide services and deliver them to the end user. Prerequisite: All of BUSI 290, BUSI 291. or equivalents. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI 290, BUSI 291. or equivalents. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Residential Property Analysis
description: Underlying theory and techniques used in design, construction, and inspection of residential properties.

subject: BUSI
title: Commercial Property Analysis
description: Underlying theory and techniques used in the design and construction of commercial properties.

subject: BUSI
title: Data Visualization and Business Analytics
description: Builds critical thinking and data skills by identifying statistical pitfalls, cleaning data with Power Query, creating financial models, and crafting impactful visualizations using Power BI and Excel to support decision-making through practical applications. Prerequisite: All of BUSI_V 291, BUSI_V 335. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI_V 291, BUSI_V 335. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Real Estate Business
description: General business skills for real estate practitioners.

subject: BUSI
title: Real Estate Management I
description: Examines the day-to-day issues which affect the practice of property management. Prerequisite: BUSI 330. BUSI 331 recommended.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI 330. BUSI 331 recommended.

subject: BUSI
title: Case Studies in Appraisal I
description: Examines the day-to day issues that affect the practice of real estate appraisal. Prerequisite: All of BUSI 121, BUSI 330, BUSI 331.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI 121, BUSI 330, BUSI 331.

subject: BUSI
title: Assessment Administration
description: Introduces the practice of real property assessment, including the nature of the techniques used, the required duties of assessors, and how an assessment office is administrated. Recommended pre-requisite: BUSI 330

subject: BUSI
title: Computer Aided Mass Property Assessment
description: This course develops and applies the major techniques for valuing real property. Recommended pre-requisites: all of BUSI 121, BUSI 330, BUSI 443.

subject: BUSI
title: Real Estate Development I
description: Real estate development process from the project idea to the cursory feasibility stage. Steps in development planning, including analysis, design and evaluation. Evaluating development potential, land acquisition, and site planning. Prerequisite: All of BUSI 330, BUSI 331.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI 330, BUSI 331.

subject: BUSI
title: Real Estate Development II
description: Analysis of real estate development process with an examination of economic feasibility studies, approval processes, project financing, construction, project management, and marketing phases. Prerequisite: BUSI445
prerequisite_raw: BUSI445

subject: BUSI
title: Applied Project Management
description: Project management methodology based on the practices defined by the Project Management Institute, including planning, execution, monitoring, control, and completion. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Intermediate Financial Accounting II
description: A continuation of the examination of accounting as a means of measurement and as an information system for external reporting purposes. Prerequisite: BUSI_V 370. Corequisite: BUSI_V 353. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI_V 370. Corequisite: BUSI_V 353. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: BUSI_V 353. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Real Estate Management II
description: Continuation of BUSI 441.

subject: BUSI
title: Case Studies in Appraisal II
description: Continuation of BUSI 442 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Advanced Financial Accounting
description: An examination of advanced financial accounting topics. Prerequisite: BUSI450 Corequisite: BUSI450 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI450 Corequisite: BUSI450 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: BUSI450 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Accounting for Management Control and Incentives
description: Design of accounting systems for facilitating and influencing management decisions, with emphasis on performance evaluation in organizations. Prerequisite: BUSI 294.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI 294.

subject: BUSI
title: Principles of Auditing
description: Principles of internal control; audit evidence; sampling and testing; audit reports; standards and responsibilities of the external audit. Prerequisite: All of BUSI 353, BUSI 450. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI 353, BUSI 450. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Critical Analysis and Forecasting in Real Estate
description: Delves into two quantitative decision-making methodologies--decision analysis and forecasting--and explores them using a problem-solving framework. Prerequisite: BUSI 121. BUSI 331 and BUSI 444 are also recommended.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI 121. BUSI 331 and BUSI 444 are also recommended.

subject: BUSI
title: Marketing Management
description: Basic considerations affecting the domestic and international marketing of goods and services. Prerequisite: All of BUSI 293, BUSI 295. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI 293, BUSI 295. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Financial Management
description: Prerequisite: One of BUSI 370, COMM 473. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of BUSI 370, COMM 473. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Taxes and Decision Making
description: Analysis of business and financial decisions in the presence of taxes. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Strategic Management in Business
description: A conceptual and practical introduction to the major areas of business strategy with an integrative perspective on managing a business. Includes the analysis of a business and its environment, the development and evaluation of strategic alternatives, and implementation of change. Prerequisite: All of BUSI 291, BUSI 293, BUSI 294, BUSI 295, BUSI 335, BUSI 353, BUSI 370, BUSI 393, BUSI 450. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI 291, BUSI 293, BUSI 294, BUSI 295, BUSI 335, BUSI 353, BUSI 370, BUSI 393, BUSI 450. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: BUSI
title: Guided Case Study in Agricultural Real Estate
description: An agriculturally-focused version of BUSI 499. Prerequisite: All of BUSI 330, BUSI 331, BUSI 442, BUSI 452.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI 330, BUSI 331, BUSI 442, BUSI 452.

subject: BUSI
title: International Business Management
description: Development of general environmental framework for international business studies by drawing on international and development economics, research into government-business relations and studies in comparative socio-cultural systems and political systems. Prerequisite: BUSI 293 and either(a) all of ECON 101, ECON 102 or (b) ECON 309. Corequisite: Two of BUSI 294, BUSI 329, BUSI 370, BUSI 465.
prerequisite_raw: BUSI 293 and either(a) all of ECON 101, ECON 102 or (b) ECON 309. Corequisite: Two of BUSI 294, BUSI 329, BUSI 370, BUSI 465.
corequisite_raw: Two of BUSI 294, BUSI 329, BUSI 370, BUSI 465.

subject: BUSI
title: Income Property Guided Case Study
description: The income property appraisal process, focusing both on valuation techniques as well as general research and report writing skills. Prerequisite: All of BUSI 330, BUSI 331, BUSI 442, BUSI 452.
prerequisite_raw: All of BUSI 330, BUSI 331, BUSI 442, BUSI 452.

subject: CAPS
title: Biomedical Research: Essential Skills and Concepts
description: Analysis of the underlying questions and assumptions, experimental approach, results and significance of work described in selected biomedical research presentations. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: BIOL 200. Limited to students in second year.
prerequisite_raw: BIOL 200. Limited to students in second year.

subject: CAPS
title: Fundamentals of Physiology in Human Health and Disease I
description: The principles of physiological regulation of neuromuscular, cardiovascular and blood systems in the human body with practical applications in health and disease. Credit will only be granted for one of CAPS_V 301 or CAPS_V 205. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: a) All of BIOL_V 112, CHEM_V 123, MATH_V 101, (or 103, 105, 121) and 100-level PHYS_V beyond PHYS_V 100 or b) SCIE_V 001.
prerequisite_raw: a) All of BIOL_V 112, CHEM_V 123, MATH_V 101, (or 103, 105, 121) and 100-level PHYS_V beyond PHYS_V 100 or b) SCIE_V 001.
exclusion_raw: The principles of physiological regulation of neuromuscular, cardiovascular and blood systems in the human body with practical applications in health and disease. Credit will only be granted for one of CAPS_V 301 or CAPS_V 205. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: a) All of BIOL_V 112, CHEM_V 123, MATH_V 101, (or 103, 105, 121) and 100-level PHYS_V beyond PHYS_V 100 or b) SCIE_V 001.

subject: CAPS
title: Fundamentals of Physiology in Human Health and Disease II
description: The principles of physiological regulation of respiratory, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrine and reproductive systems in the human body with practical applications in health and disease. Credit will only be granted for one of CAPS_V 301 or CAPS_V 206. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: a) All of BIOL_V 112, CHEM_V 123, MATH_V 101 (or 103, 105, 121), and 100-level PHYS_V beyond PHYS_V 100 or b) SCIE_V 001.
prerequisite_raw: a) All of BIOL_V 112, CHEM_V 123, MATH_V 101 (or 103, 105, 121), and 100-level PHYS_V beyond PHYS_V 100 or b) SCIE_V 001.
exclusion_raw: The principles of physiological regulation of respiratory, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrine and reproductive systems in the human body with practical applications in health and disease. Credit will only be granted for one of CAPS_V 301 or CAPS_V 206. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: a) All of BIOL_V 112, CHEM_V 123, MATH_V 101 (or 103, 105, 121), and 100-level PHYS_V beyond PHYS_V 100 or b) SCIE_V 001.

subject: CAPS
title: Human Health Literacy
description: An on-line course teaching students to research and understand relevant health diagnoses. Not for students with Biology 12, Anatomy and Physiology 12, or enrolled in the Faculties of Science, Land and Food Systems, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Applied Science or School of Kinesiology. [3-0-0]

subject: CAPS
title: Human Physiology
description: Organ systems function with particular reference to mammalian and human physiology. See credit exclusion list: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . Credit will only be granted for one of CAPS 301 or CAPS 205. Credit will only be granted for one of CAPS 301 or CAPS 206. [3-0-0;3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) SCIE 001 or (b) all of BIOL 112, BIOL 121 and one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121 and one of PHYS 100, PHYS 101, PHYS 107, PHYS 117, PHYS 131 and one of CHEM 203, CHEM 233, CHEM 260.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) SCIE 001 or (b) all of BIOL 112, BIOL 121 and one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121 and one of PHYS 100, PHYS 101, PHYS 107, PHYS 117, PHYS 131 and one of CHEM 203, CHEM 233, CHEM 260.
exclusion_raw: Organ systems function with particular reference to mammalian and human physiology. See credit exclusion list: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . Credit will only be granted for one of CAPS 301 or CAPS 205. Credit will only be granted for one of CAPS 301 or CAPS 206. [3-0-0;3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) SCIE 001 or (b) all of BIOL 112, BIOL 121 and one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121 and one of PHYS 100, PHYS 101, PHYS 107, PHYS 117, PHYS 131 and one of CHEM 203, CHEM 233, CHEM 260.

subject: CAPS
title: Human Physiology Laboratory
description: Physiological techniques and principles. Must be taken in conjunction with CAPS 301. Enrolment limited. Available only to students in the Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences. [0-3]

subject: CAPS
title: Laboratory in Human Physiology
description: Techniques and principles of human physiology. This course must be taken in conjunction with CAPS 301. Restricted to Cellular, Anatomical and Physiological Sciences and Pharmacology students. [1-4-0] Corequisite: One of CAPS 305, CAPS 301.
corequisite_raw: One of CAPS 305, CAPS 301.

subject: CAPS
title: Integrated Human Health and Disease
description: An integrated study of advanced physiological processes and the consequences of dysregulation in disease pathophysiology. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of CAPS 205, CAPS 206.
prerequisite_raw: One of CAPS 205, CAPS 206.

subject: CAPS
title: Molecular and Cellular Mechanisms of Human Health and Disease
description: A study of the molecular and cellular mechanisms of human health, disease and therapeutics. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: BIOL 234 and one of CAPS 205, CAPS 206, BIOL 200.
prerequisite_raw: BIOL 234 and one of CAPS 205, CAPS 206, BIOL 200.

subject: CAPS
title: Modern Biomedical Research Techniques and their Application
description: Core and advanced biomedical research techniques which have impacted our current understanding of health and disease. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 101, BIOL 112, BIOL 121 and one of BIOL 234, BIOL 335, BIOL 338. And PHYS 100-level beyond PHYS 100.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 101, BIOL 112, BIOL 121 and one of BIOL 234, BIOL 335, BIOL 338. And PHYS 100-level beyond PHYS 100.

subject: CAPS
title: Introduction to Microscopic Human Anatomy
description: Organ system development, structure and function at the microscopic level. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of BIOL 121, SCIE 001. BIOL 200 is recommended.
prerequisite_raw: One of BIOL 121, SCIE 001. BIOL 200 is recommended.

subject: CAPS
title: Introduction to Gross Human Anatomy
description: Structure and function of body regions at the macroscopic level. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of BIOL_V 121, SCIE_V 001, KIN_V 131 (or 190), KIN_V 132 (or 191).
prerequisite_raw: One of BIOL_V 121, SCIE_V 001, KIN_V 131 (or 190), KIN_V 132 (or 191).

subject: CAPS
title: Cooperative Work Placement
description: Approved and supervised relevant work experience in an industrial, academic, or government setting for a minimum of 13 weeks full-time. Work term report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-op Option in Cellular, Anatomical and Physiological Sciences (B.Sc.). Prerequisite: All of CAPS 205, CAPS 303 and one of CAPS 206, CAPS 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CAPS 205, CAPS 303 and one of CAPS 206, CAPS 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CAPS
title: Cooperative Work Placement II
description: Approved and supervised relevant work experience in an industrial, academic, or government setting for a minimum of 13 weeks full-time. Work term report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-op Option in Cellular, Anatomical and Physiological Sciences (B.Sc.). Prerequisite: CAPS 398. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: CAPS 398. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CAPS
title: Cell Biology and Human Disease
description: Outlines major discoveries and current advancements that are revolutionizing our understanding of subcellular structures and function in health and disease, such as cancer. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) all of CAPS 306, CAPS 310 or (b) one of CAPS 301, NSCI 300. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) all of CAPS 306, CAPS 310 or (b) one of CAPS 301, NSCI 300. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CAPS
title: Mammalian Cardiovascular and Respiratory Physiology
description: The control and integration of cardio-pulmonary function in mammals. Intended for Honours students in Cellular, Anatomical and Physiological Sciences or other life sciences. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: A cumulative average of 75% over at least 90 credits attempted in the first three years of a student's program and a minimum mark of 75% in CAPS 301 or PHYL 301 or its equivalent. Permission of the course director is also required.
prerequisite_raw: A cumulative average of 75% over at least 90 credits attempted in the first three years of a student's program and a minimum mark of 75% in CAPS 301 or PHYL 301 or its equivalent. Permission of the course director is also required.

subject: CAPS
title: Human Renal and Gastrointestinal Physiology
description: Control of human renal and gastrointestinal systems. Role in homeostasis in health and disease. Intended for students in Cellular, Anatomical and Physiological Sciences or other life sciences. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) all of CAPS 305, CAPS 306 or (b) CAPS 301.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) all of CAPS 305, CAPS 306 or (b) CAPS 301.

subject: CAPS
title: Mammalian Endocrinology
description: Hormonal control of homeostatic, metabolic and reproductive function. Intended for Honours students in Cellular, Anatomical and Physiological Sciences or other life sciences. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: A cumulative average of 75% over at least 90 credits attempted in the first three years of a student's program and a minimum mark of 75% in CAPS 301 or PHYL 301. Permission of the course director is also required.
prerequisite_raw: A cumulative average of 75% over at least 90 credits attempted in the first three years of a student's program and a minimum mark of 75% in CAPS 301 or PHYL 301. Permission of the course director is also required.

subject: CAPS
title: Nervous System Function in Human Health and Disease
description: An integrated study of the theory and experimental findings of neuronal synaptic plasticity, including underlying molecular mechanisms and their role in cellular systems, cognitive biology and disease. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of CAPS 305, CAPS 301, NSCI 300.
prerequisite_raw: One of CAPS 305, CAPS 301, NSCI 300.

subject: CAPS
title: Advanced Laboratory in Physiology
description: Methods, techniques, and use of instruments required for physiological investigation. CAPS 303 or PHYL 303 and the consent of the department are required and enrolment will be limited. [0-6]

subject: CAPS
title: Advanced Laboratory in the Physiology of Human Health and Disease
description: Techniques relevant to human genetics and physiology in the assessment of human health and disease. This course is restricted to CAPS students. [1-4-0] Prerequisite: CAPS 303.
prerequisite_raw: CAPS 303.

subject: CAPS
title: Graduating Essay
description: Written report and presentation on an independent investigation approved by the department head.

subject: CAPS
title: Cooperative Work Placement III
description: Approved and supervised relevant work experience in an industrial, academic, or government setting for a minimum of 13 weeks full time. Work term report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-op Option in Cellular, Anatomical and Physiological Sciences (B.Sc.). Prerequisite: CAPS 399. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: CAPS 399. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CAPS
title: Cooperative Work Placement IV
description: Approved and supervised relevant work experience in an industrial, academic, or government setting for a minimum of 13 weeks full time. Work term report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-op Option in Cellular, Anatomical and Physiological Sciences (B.Sc.). Prerequisite: CAPS 498. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: CAPS 498. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CAP
title: Introduction to Writing and Research in the Social Sciences and the Humanities
description: Analysis of and practice in academic research and writing in the social sciences and the humanities. Restricted to students in the Coordinated Arts Program. Credits count toward the Writing Component of the Faculty of Arts Writing and Research Requirement. Credit will be granted for only one of CAP 100 or ASTU 101. Equivalency: ASTU 101. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Analysis of and practice in academic research and writing in the social sciences and the humanities. Restricted to students in the Coordinated Arts Program. Credits count toward the Writing Component of the Faculty of Arts Writing and Research Requirement. Credit will be granted for only one of CAP 100 or ASTU 101. Equivalency: ASTU 101. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CCFI
title: Living Inquiry in Learning Communities
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CCFI
title: Theorizing Knowing in Education
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CCFI
title: Graduating Paper
description: Pass/Fail. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CCFI
title: Doctoral Dissertation
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CCST
title: Seminar in Interdisciplinary Frameworks in Museum and Curatorial Studies
description: Theoretical and historical foundations of visual representations and expressive culture. It explores the history of museums and galleries, and changes in the meaning of art and material culture as debates about cultural property intensify. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CCST
title: Seminar in Contemporary Contextual Issues for Museums and Curatorial Practice
description: An examination of broad social and political issues that confront curators and museum professionals who construct representations in museums, art galleries and other sites of public display. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CCST
title: Case Studies in Museum and Gallery Exhibitions
description: A case study approach to analyzing museum and gallery exhibitions that are historically significant either because they raised issues and stimulated public debate, or because of radical features that proved influential on subsequent exhibitions. Course not offered every year. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CCST
title: Graduate Practicum in Critical and Curatorial Studies
description: Practical on-site teamwork to produce exhibitions or other public displays in a museum, gallery, or alternative situation, offering opportunities for comparison, collaboration, and interdisciplinarity. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CCST
title: Major Paper in Critical and Curatorial Studies
description: To graduate, students must produce a major paper from the ideas and research which generate the exhibition in the practicum. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CEEN
title: Energy System Fundamentals
description: Thermodynamic analysis of energy conversion processes, power cycles and refrigeration cycles. Exergy analysis of conventional energy systems. Thermal conversion technologies. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CEEN
title: Alternative Energy Technologies
description: Factors affecting energy source adoption. Solar, wind, small-scale hydro, tidal, geothermal, electrochemical (batteries, capacitators, and fuel cells), and biochemical energy, electromechanical conversion processes. Energy storage, microgrids, interfacing with main transmissions grids. Techno-economic assessment of alternative energy technologies. Prerequisite: CEEN 501. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: CEEN 501. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CEEN
title: Sustainable Energy Systems
description: Planetary thermodynamics, energy system evolution, role of renewable energy sources. Alternative energy technologies. Solar, wind, small-scale hydro, tidal, geothermal, and biochemical energy, electromechanical conversion processes. Techno-economic assessment of alternative energy technologies. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CEEN
title: Energy Storage and Transmission
description: Analysis of energy transportation systems from resource extraction to energy services. Thermal, mechanical and electrochemical storage and transport components of electrical and thermal energy systems. Transmission and distribution systems. Distributed generation systems. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CEEN
title: Energy and the Environment
description: Energy/environment/society interactions; development of energy resources; energy demand and its determinants; policy dimension of energy and climate change; impacts on ecosystems; life cycle analysis; impact assessment and other tools for quantitative and qualitative evaluation of alternative energy sources. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CEEN
title: Energy Policy
description: Energy policy process and governance. Sustainable energy as a social and political challenge, formal government structures and process, actors in the policy, policy analysis, policy instrument, and energy planning and approval processes, including environmental assessment. Introduction to demand-side energy policy. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CEEN
title: Energy Efficiency and Conservation
description: Engineering concepts of demand side management (DSM), energy auditing, analysis of buildings and industrial equipment, measurement & verification, and system data analysis. Energy efficient technologies for green buildings and industrial processes. Behavior and energy use. DSM policy concepts. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CEEN
title: Project and Report
description: For M.Eng. students. Carry out a project and prepare an engineering report under the supervision of a faculty member. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CEEN
title: Seminar
description: Presentations and discussions of current topics in the area of Clean Energy Engineering. Pass/Fail. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CELL
title: Cell and Developmental Biology Research Literature
description: Development of written communication and critical thinking skills. Prerequisite: BIOL 530. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: BIOL 530. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CELL
title: M.Sc. Thesis
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CELL
title: Doctoral Dissertation
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CENS
title: Canadian Monuments to Central and Eastern European History
description: Structural monuments and sites dedicated to the history and immigration from Central and Eastern Europe in Canada and their influence on Canadian cultures of remembrance.

subject: CENS
title: Contrasts and Conflicts: The Cultures of Central, Eastern and Northern Europe (in English)
description: An introduction to the cultural history of the peoples of Central, Eastern and Northern Europe as reflected in their literature, art and music.

subject: CENS
title: Great Works of Literature from Central, Eastern and Northern Europe (in English).
description: Major works of Central, Eastern and Northern European literature from the eighteenth century to the present in their European context.

subject: CENS
title: Arctic Art and Activism
description: Examination of contemporary political and social conflicts in the arctic and circumpolar north, focusing on ways Indigenous people have used art, performance and activism as a tool for resistance and decolonization.

subject: CENS
title: Representations of the Holocaust: Ghetto
description: The Nazi Ghetto in film and literature from Central, Eastern, and Northern European Countries.

subject: CENS
title: Representations of the Holocaust: Auschwitz
description: Concentration camps in art, film and literature from Central, Eastern and Northern European countries.

subject: CENS
title: Witches: Myth and Reality
description: Examination of the cultural, social, and historical construction of the witch in central and northern Europe with comparisons to recent history, current events, and popular culture.

subject: CENS
title: Comics and Graphic Novels in Central, Eastern and Northern Europe
description: Political, cultural and social themes in European comics and graphic media.

subject: CENS
title: Becoming Multilingual: Experience, Aesthetics, Community
description: Practice, theory, history, aesthetics, and poetics of the multilingual experience in its diverse contexts in Central, Eastern, and Northern Europe.

subject: CENS
title: Language, Place and Power
description: Examines how languages have been disconnected from place, land, and environmental context through colonial settlement. Consequences and social effects, with emphasis on institutions and communities in British Columbia. Find out more at https://cenes.ubc.ca/courses/ .

subject: CENS
title: Gender and Nation: Women's State in Modern Central, Eastern and Northern European Literatures and Cultures
description: Cultural and social discourses of gender in literary works written in Central, Eastern and Northern Europe roughly between 1850 - 1930.

subject: CENS
title: Supernatural Folklore
description: Supernatural folklore and belief situated in Central, Eastern and Northern European cultures, with focus on its role in religion, health, and expressive culture, power structures and Indigenous contexts.

subject: CHBE
title: Integrated Technical Communication
description: Written and oral communication in chemical and biological engineering: business correspondence, laboratory reports, technical description, and poster presentations. Restricted to students in second year of the Chemical and Biological Engineering programs. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of APSC 176, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121, WRDS 150. Corequisite: CHBE 220. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of APSC 176, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121, WRDS 150. Corequisite: CHBE 220. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: CHBE 220. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Founding Principles in Chemical and Biological Engineering I
description: Introduction to Chemical and Biological Engineering profession and the physical sciences that form the founding principles of the discipline. Recommended Corequisite: CHBE 201. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: All of CHEM 154, MATH 101. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CHEM 154, MATH 101. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: CHBE 201. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: All of CHEM 154, MATH 101. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Founding Principles in Chemical and Biological Engineering II
description: Introduction to Chemical and Biological Engineering profession with emphasis on the biological sciences that form the founding principles of the discipline. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: CHBE 220. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: CHBE 220. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Computational Methods
description: Mathematical formulation of chemical and biological engineering problems; standard techniques of numerical analysis and their application to chemical, environmental and biotechnological systems; program development; use of commercial numerical analysis software. [2-0-2] Prerequisite: APSC 160. Corequisite: MATH 256. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: APSC 160. Corequisite: MATH 256. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MATH 256. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Material and Energy Balances
description: Introduction to Chemical and Biological Engineering; units; stoichiometry; phase equilibria; material balances; energy balances. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: All of CHEM 154, MATH 152. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CHEM 154, MATH 152. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Introduction to Chemical and Biological Engineering Process and Technology
description: Processes used in chemical and biological industries, which emphasize underlying physical, chemical, and biological principles. [1-0-1*] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Chemical and Biological Engineering Thermodynamics I
description: Energy and the first law; second law of thermodynamics; entropy; availability (energy) analysis; thermodynamic properties of fluids, application to power generation, refrigeration, and liquefaction, as well as biological, environmental, and electrochemical systems. [3-0-2*] Prerequisite: CHBE 241. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: CHBE 241. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Transport Phenomena I
description: Fluid Mechanics. Momentum-transfer in fluids in laminar and turbulent flow; microscopic and macroscopic material; momentum and energy balances; rheology; dimensional analysis; flow in conduits; pumps; fluid metering. [3-0-2*] Prerequisite: [PHYS170] Corequisite: One of MATH 255, MATH 256. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: [PHYS170] Corequisite: One of MATH 255, MATH 256. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 255, MATH 256. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Chemical Engineering and Applied Chemistry Laboratory
description: Experiments chosen to illustrate and use material presented in 200-level CHBE and CHEM courses. [0-4-0; 0-4-0] Corequisite: All of CHBE 201, CHBE 241, CHBE 251, CHEM 250, CHEM 251, CHEM 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of CHBE 201, CHBE 241, CHBE 251, CHEM 250, CHEM 251, CHEM 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Introduction to Chemical and Biological Engineering Laboratory Practice
description: Introduction to Chemical and Biological Engineering laboratory practice with topics in physical, inorganic and organic chemistry. [0-2-0] Corequisite: All of CHBE 220, CHBE 241, CHEM 250, CHEM 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of CHBE 220, CHBE 241, CHEM 250, CHEM 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Chemical and Biological Engineering Laboratory
description: Laboratory experiment in 2nd year Chemical and Biological Engineering [1-4-0] Prerequisite: CHBE 263. Corequisite: All of CHBE 244, CHBE 251. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: CHBE 263. Corequisite: All of CHBE 244, CHBE 251. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of CHBE 244, CHBE 251. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Introduction to Unit Operations
description: Foundational concepts and design equations for basic unit operations such as: comminution, screening, filtration, centrifugal separations, evaporation and crystallization. [3-0-2*] Prerequisite: Either (a) all of CHBE_V 241, CHBE_V 244 or (b) CIVL_V 215 or (c) third-year or higher standing in BASc. Not for credit for CHBE students. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) all of CHBE_V 241, CHBE_V 244 or (b) CIVL_V 215 or (c) third-year or higher standing in BASc. Not for credit for CHBE students. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Unit Operations
description: Stage-wise mass transfer operations; extraction and absorption; single and stage-wise binary and multi-component distillation; principles and equipment design for continuous contact mass transfer operations including absorption, binary distillation and others such as extraction, drying, and humidification. [4-0-2*] Prerequisite: All of CHBE 346, CHBE 352. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CHBE 346, CHBE 352. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Chemical and Biological Engineering Thermodynamics II
description: Volumetric and thermodynamic properties of fluids; equations of state; heat effects; ideal and non-ideal mixtures; fugacities and activity coefficients; vapor-liquid and liquid-liquid phase equilibrium; solubility of gases and solids in liquids; chemical reaction equilibrium; equilibrium partitioning of pollutants. Recommended prerequisite: MATH 256. [3-0-2*] Prerequisite: All of CHBE 220, CHBE 241, CHBE 244, MATH 253. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CHBE 220, CHBE 241, CHBE 244, MATH 253. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Mass Transfer Bridge Module
description: Mass transfer; molecular diffusion; convective transfer; analogies among heat, mass and momentum transfer; mass transfer coefficients; interphase mass transfer. Prerequisite: All of CHBE 251, CHBE 351, MATH 253. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CHBE 251, CHBE 351, MATH 253. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Transport Phenomena II
description: Heat and mass transfer; conduction and molecular diffusion; convective transfer; analogies among heat, mass and momentum transfer; heat exchanger design; mass transfer coefficients; interphase mass transfer. [4-0-2*] Prerequisite: One of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280 and MATH 256. or third-year standing in ENVE. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280 and MATH 256. or third-year standing in ENVE. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Kinetics and Reactor Design
description: Kinetics of homogeneous chemical and biological reactions, isothermal ideal reactor design, analysis of non-ideal reactors using residence time distribution and mixing models. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: All of CHBE 230, CHBE 346, CHBE 352. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CHBE 230, CHBE 346, CHBE 352. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Process Dynamics and Control
description: Introduction to modelling of chemical processes; transient response analysis; design of feedback control systems; stability analysis; frequency response analysis; process control applications; instrumentation; advanced control techniques; distributed control systems. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: MATH_V 255 or MATH_V 256. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MATH_V 255 or MATH_V 256. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Process Engineering Laboratory
description: Experiments to illustrate and use material presented in 200 and 300-level CHBE courses. Field trips may be required. [1-4-0] Prerequisite: All of CHBE 201, CHBE 230, CHBE 241, CHBE 251, CHBE 264. Corequisite: CHBE 352. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CHBE 201, CHBE 230, CHBE 241, CHBE 251, CHBE 264. Corequisite: CHBE 352. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: CHBE 352. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Environmental Engineering Laboratory
description: Laboratory experiments to illustrate key concepts and measurement techniques in environmental engineering as used by engineers. [1-4-0] Corequisite: One of CHBE 373, CIVL 406. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: One of CHBE 373, CIVL 406. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Biological Engineering Laboratory
description: Laboratory experiments to illustrate key concepts and measurement techniques in biotechnology as used by engineers. Field trips may be required. [1-4-0] Prerequisite: All of CHBE 201, CHBE 230, CHBE 241, CHBE 264, CHBE 221. Corequisite: CHBE 381. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CHBE 201, CHBE 230, CHBE 241, CHBE 264, CHBE 221. Corequisite: CHBE 381. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: CHBE 381. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Chemical Engineering Laboratory
description: Experiments to illustrate and use material presented in 300-level Chemical Engineering program courses. Field trips may be required. [1-4-0] Prerequisite: All of CHBE_V 201, CHBE_V 230, CHBE_V 241, CHBE_V 251, CHBE_V 264. Corequisite: All of CHBE_V 345, CHBE_V 356. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CHBE_V 201, CHBE_V 230, CHBE_V 241, CHBE_V 251, CHBE_V 264. Corequisite: All of CHBE_V 345, CHBE_V 356. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of CHBE_V 345, CHBE_V 356. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Fundamentals of Sustainable Engineering
description: Introduction to sustainable practice for Chemical and Biological Engineers. Pollution prevention, cleaner production, green chemistry and engineering, and sustainable design; environmental impact assessment including life-cycle assessment, total cost analysis and environmental systems analysis; applications in chemical and biological process industries. [3-0-2*] Prerequisite: All of CHBE 241, CHBE 244. or third-year standing in ENVE. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of CHBE 241, CHBE 244. or third-year standing in ENVE. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Water and Wastewater Technology and Engineering
description: Legal, environmental and physicochemical aspects of industrial water pollution and its abatement will be surveyed; techniques for design of wastewater treatment processes currently used in industry; case studies from chemical and process industries will be considered in detail. Credit will be granted for only one of CHBE_V 373 or CIVL_V 406. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: One of CHBE_V 251, CIVL_V 215, MECH_V 280, MTRL_V 263, or third-year or higher standing in ENVE. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of CHBE_V 251, CIVL_V 215, MECH_V 280, MTRL_V 263, or third-year or higher standing in ENVE. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Legal, environmental and physicochemical aspects of industrial water pollution and its abatement will be surveyed; techniques for design of wastewater treatment processes currently used in industry; case studies from chemical and process industries will be considered in detail. Credit will be granted for only one of CHBE_V 373 or CIVL_V 406. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: One of CHBE_V 251, CIVL_V 215, MECH_V 280, MTRL_V 263, or third-year or higher standing in ENVE. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Computer Flowsheeting and Unit Operation Design
description: Theory and practice of computer flowsheeting in chemical plant design; hands-on use of modern process simulators, prediction of thermodynamic properties of fluids; behaviour of single and multiphase systems. Design of unit operations. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: CHBE241 Corequisite: All of CHBE 345, CHBE 355 for students enrolled in CHBE or third-year standing in BASc. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: CHBE241 Corequisite: All of CHBE 345, CHBE 355 for students enrolled in CHBE or third-year standing in BASc. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of CHBE 345, CHBE 355 for students enrolled in CHBE or third-year standing in BASc. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Biological Engineering and Bio-Manufacturing I
description: Biological process engineering in the fields of biotechnology and biomedical engineering; enzymatic and cellular kinetics; cell culture, bioreactor mass transport and process development; bioreactor design and operation. Credit will be granted for only one of CHBE 381, CHBE 560. [3-0-2*] Prerequisite: One of CHBE_V 221, BMEG_V 245 and one of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 103, MATH_V 105 and third-year or higher standing. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of CHBE_V 221, BMEG_V 245 and one of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 103, MATH_V 105 and third-year or higher standing. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Biological process engineering in the fields of biotechnology and biomedical engineering; enzymatic and cellular kinetics; cell culture, bioreactor mass transport and process development; bioreactor design and operation. Credit will be granted for only one of CHBE 381, CHBE 560. [3-0-2*] Prerequisite: One of CHBE_V 221, BMEG_V 245 and one of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 103, MATH_V 105 and third-year or higher standing. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Mechanical Pulping and Papermaking
description: Process and unit operations in mechanical pulping and papermaking, emphasizing principles and practice of refining, screening, cleaning, papermaking and properties of paper products, key economic and environmental issues. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Biomass Fractionation Technology
description: Process and unit operations in the conversion of wood chips to pulp and green bio-products. Biorefinery concepts and emerging technologies for the production of biomaterials, biochemicals and bioenergy. Credit will be granted for only one of CHBE 402, CHBE 502 or GBPR 502. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Process and unit operations in the conversion of wood chips to pulp and green bio-products. Biorefinery concepts and emerging technologies for the production of biomaterials, biochemicals and bioenergy. Credit will be granted for only one of CHBE 402, CHBE 502 or GBPR 502. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Systems Biology and Metabolic Engineering
description: Foundational concepts, experimentation methodologies, research horizons, and industrial applications of microbial cell engineering. Topics of note include genome-scale modeling, genome editing, biological circuits, protein engineering and the design-build-test-learn (DBTL) workflow.  [3-0-0] Prerequisites: One of CHBE 381, CHBE 419 or BMEG 374 or Graduate student in CHBE or SBME. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Process Development: Bench to Full Scale
description: Industrial approaches and techniques for the development and scale-up of novel process technologies including: technology feasibility evaluations; techno-economic analyses; formulation of development programs; scale-up of equipment and processes; technical de-risking; translation of development results into full scale design packages. [3-0-0] Prerequisites: All of CHBE_V 241, CHBE_V 345 or equivalents. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CHBE
title: Industrial Biotechnology Laboratory
description: Modern bioreactor technology, upstream and downstream processing of biotechnology products. Restricted to students in the Joint Degree in Biotechnology. [1-4-0]

subject: CHBE
