description: An experiential course covering a broad range of business writing and communications. For Master of Management - Dual Degree Option students only. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Introduction to Capital Markets
description: Roles of capital market institutions and participants. Skill development for basic financial principles in the quantitative and qualitative evaluation of bond and stock investments. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Entrepreneurship
description: Entrepreneurial essentials from creating viable opportunities through building a founding team, strategic planning, going to market, fleshing out an organization and planning the future of the business. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 280 or COMR_V 280. Equivalency: COMR_V 280.
exclusion_raw: Entrepreneurial essentials from creating viable opportunities through building a founding team, strategic planning, going to market, fleshing out an organization and planning the future of the business. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 280 or COMR_V 280. Equivalency: COMR_V 280.

subject: COMM
title: Financial Accounting
description: Introduction to the construction and interpretation of financial reports prepared primarily for external use. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 293, COEC_V 293, or COMM_V 320. Prerequisite: One of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184. Equivalency: COEC_V 293. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184. Equivalency: COEC_V 293. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Introduction to the construction and interpretation of financial reports prepared primarily for external use. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 293, COEC_V 293, or COMM_V 320. Prerequisite: One of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184. Equivalency: COEC_V 293. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Managerial Accounting
description: Introduction to the development and use of accounting information for management planning and control and the development of cost information for financial reports. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 294 or COEC_V 294. Prerequisite: One of COEC_V 293, COMM_V 293. Equivalency: COEC_V 294, MGMT_O 202. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COEC_V 293, COMM_V 293. Equivalency: COEC_V 294, MGMT_O 202. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Introduction to the development and use of accounting information for management planning and control and the development of cost information for financial reports. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 294 or COEC_V 294. Prerequisite: One of COEC_V 293, COMM_V 293. Equivalency: COEC_V 294, MGMT_O 202. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Managerial Economics
description: Economic foundations of managerial decision-making. Demand theory, cost and production, market structure, competitive strategy, organization of the firm, welfare-economic foundations of business regulation. Credit will be granted for only one of ECON_V 201, ECON_V 206, ECON_V 301, ECON_V 304, FRE_V 295, or COMM_V 295. Prerequisite: Either (a) ECON_V 100 or (b) all of ECON_V 101, ECON_V 102. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) ECON_V 100 or (b) all of ECON_V 101, ECON_V 102. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Economic foundations of managerial decision-making. Demand theory, cost and production, market structure, competitive strategy, organization of the firm, welfare-economic foundations of business regulation. Credit will be granted for only one of ECON_V 201, ECON_V 206, ECON_V 301, ECON_V 304, FRE_V 295, or COMM_V 295. Prerequisite: Either (a) ECON_V 100 or (b) all of ECON_V 101, ECON_V 102. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Introduction to Marketing
description: Basic considerations affecting the domestic and international marketing of goods and services. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 296, COMM_V 420, COMM_V 465, or COMR_V 465. Corequisite: COMM_V 293 and one of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. Equivalency: MGMT_O 220. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: COMM_V 293 and one of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. Equivalency: MGMT_O 220. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Basic considerations affecting the domestic and international marketing of goods and services. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 296, COMM_V 420, COMM_V 465, or COMR_V 465. Corequisite: COMM_V 293 and one of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. Equivalency: MGMT_O 220. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Introduction to Finance
description: Introduces the basic principles of financial valuation, including the time-value of money and the risk/return tradeoff. Develops tools for the quantitative analysis of corporate and/or individual financing and saving decisions, and of capital budgeting decisions. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 298, COEC_V 298, COMM_V 421, COMM_V 473, or COMR_V 473. [3-0-0] Corequisite: COMM_V 293 and one of COMM_V 190, COMM_V 290. Equivalency: COEC_V 298, MGMT_O 310. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: COMM_V 293 and one of COMM_V 190, COMM_V 290. Equivalency: COEC_V 298, MGMT_O 310. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Introduces the basic principles of financial valuation, including the time-value of money and the risk/return tradeoff. Develops tools for the quantitative analysis of corporate and/or individual financing and saving decisions, and of capital budgeting decisions. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 298, COEC_V 298, COMM_V 421, COMM_V 473, or COMR_V 473. [3-0-0] Corequisite: COMM_V 293 and one of COMM_V 190, COMM_V 290. Equivalency: COEC_V 298, MGMT_O 310. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Urban Land Economics
description: Examines economic factors affecting the urban land market, with an emphasis on determinants of urban land values, the housing market, urban transportation, and land use policies. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Real Estate Investment
description: Evaluation of investment in real estate assets; proforma analysis, property and asset management, equity securitization, appraisal, and international real estate investment. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301 and one of COMM_V 297, COMM_V 298. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301 and one of COMM_V 297, COMM_V 298. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Simulation Models in Business Decision-Making
description: Computer simulation, simulation languages. Typical business applications in financial planning, waiting line problems and other operating problems. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 191, COMM_V 291.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 191, COMM_V 291.

subject: COMM
title: Research Theory for Commerce Scholars
description: Social science research: theory, research design, methods, and criticism. For students in the Commerce Scholars Program only. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Business Ethics Leadership
description: Skill Development for leading organizations while better managing for values. Recognizing organizational values, and developing concrete plans for better delivering on these values. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Strategies for Responsible Business
description: Tools to apply sustainable and responsible decision making through individual, organizational, and structural lenses. Topics include diversity and group think, the circular economy, and climate change adaptation. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Leading Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in Organizations
description: Topics in diversity related to identity, group categorization, stereotyping, explicit and implicit bias, microaggressions, and discrimination. Mitigation of institutional inequality and discrimination through inclusive leadership and critical analysis of organizational practices and policies. Prerequisite: COMM_V 203. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 203. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: People Analytics
description: Application of descriptive and inferential statistics to decisions in core Human Resources (HR) areas, including recruitment, selection, compensation, training, and performance management using organizations. HR data and human capital metrics. Machine learning and AI in strategic HR decision making. Prerequisite: All of COMM_V 191, COMM_V 203, COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of COMM_V 191, COMM_V 203, COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Information Systems Technology and Development
description: Introduction to information technology related to business use. Design, implementation and application of Information Systems. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 205, CPSC_V 210. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 205, CPSC_V 210. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Introduction to Digital Business
description: Business fundamentals in the digital economy: leveraging digitization and automation; data and analytics; platforms; crowdsourcing; understanding the impact of digital technologies on firms, markets, economies as well as individuals and society. Prerequisite: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Business Programming and Analytics
description: Introduction to object-oriented computer programming; computational thinking; program design; scripting; documentation techniques; file handling; database access; and web crawling techniques. Students will apply data structures and programming constructs to the development of business analytics and other related applications. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 337 and CPSC_V 103. Prerequisite: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Introduction to object-oriented computer programming; computational thinking; program design; scripting; documentation techniques; file handling; database access; and web crawling techniques. Students will apply data structures and programming constructs to the development of business analytics and other related applications. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 337 and CPSC_V 103. Prerequisite: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Management of Cybersecurity
description: Fundamentals of cybersecurity from managerial perspectives; Cyber risk management and governance; Security architecture and design; Capabilities to protect enterprise assets and respond to cyber incidents. Prerequisite: COMM_V 205 or CPSC_V 213 or CPEN_V 212. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 205 or CPSC_V 213 or CPEN_V 212. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Service Operations
description: This primarily case-based course will cover service operations in general (50%), health care operations (25%), and revenue management (25%). Applications of queuing models will be included in both services in general and healthcare. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 340 or COMM_V 443. Prerequisite: COMM_V 204. Equivalency: COMM_V 443. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 204. Equivalency: COMM_V 443. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: This primarily case-based course will cover service operations in general (50%), health care operations (25%), and revenue management (25%). Applications of queuing models will be included in both services in general and healthcare. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 340 or COMM_V 443. Prerequisite: COMM_V 204. Equivalency: COMM_V 443. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Supply Chain Management
description: Integrated management of production and logistics systems; management of inter-organizational relationships in the supply chain, including vendor selection, bidding and negotiation processes, partnering and performance measurement. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 341 or COMM_V 449. Prerequisite: COMM_V 204. Equivalency: COMM_V 449. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 204. Equivalency: COMM_V 449. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Integrated management of production and logistics systems; management of inter-organizational relationships in the supply chain, including vendor selection, bidding and negotiation processes, partnering and performance measurement. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 341 or COMM_V 449. Prerequisite: COMM_V 204. Equivalency: COMM_V 449. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Global Supply Chain & Logistics Management I - Study Abroad
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Global Supply Chain & Logistics Management II - Study Abroad
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Global Supply Chain & Logistics Management III - Study Abroad
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Global Supply Chain & Logistics Management IV - Study Abroad
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Logistics Services Management
description: Overview of the characteristics and commercial environment of logistics and transportation services; service operations planning and design, costing, pricing and quality management. Corequisite: One of COMM_V 204, COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 204, COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Financial Accounting: Intermediate I
description: An examination of accounting as a means of measurement and as an information system for external reporting purposes. Prerequisite: All of COMM_V 293, COMM_V 294. Corequisite: Either (a) all of COMM_V 297, COMM_V 397 or (b) COMM_V 298. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of COMM_V 293, COMM_V 294. Corequisite: Either (a) all of COMM_V 297, COMM_V 397 or (b) COMM_V 298. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: Either (a) all of COMM_V 297, COMM_V 397 or (b) COMM_V 298. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Cost Accounting
description: The provision and analysis of cost accounting information that will assist management in making operating decisions and in evaluating operational performance. The utilization of statistical analysis and linear models is included. Prerequisite: All of COMM_V 293, COMM_V 294 and one of COMM_V 190, COMM_V 290 and one of COMM_V 191, COMM_ 291. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of COMM_V 293, COMM_V 294 and one of COMM_V 190, COMM_V 290 and one of COMM_V 191, COMM_ 291. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Income Taxation
description: A study of income tax from the standpoint of the individual and of business enterprise. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 293, COMM_V 457. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 293, COMM_V 457. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Consumer Behaviour
description: The use of consumer research and theory in marketing and policy decisions. Psychological, sociological and economic theory and research relevant to consumer behaviour are considered. Prerequisite: COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Marketing Analysis
description: Analytical methods applicable to marketing management decision making; attention to strategic considerations linking analysis of consumer data, corporate data, environmental factors, and competitive response. The course makes extensive use of strategy simulations. Prerequisite: COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Market Research
description: The process of marketing research including topics such as problem/opportunity formulation, research objectives, data sources, research instrument design, sampling, data collection and processing and methods of data analysis. Prerequisite: COMM_V 296 and one of COMM_V 190, COMM_V 290 and one of COMM_V 191, COMM_V 291 and one of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. Corequisite: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 296 and one of COMM_V 190, COMM_V 290 and one of COMM_V 191, COMM_V 291 and one of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. Corequisite: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Corporate Finance
description: Examination of corporate enterprise decisions including capital budgeting; capital structure choice, and financial policies, tools, and valuation. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 370 or COEC_V 370. Prerequisite: COMM_V 298. Equivalency: COEC_V 370 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 298. Equivalency: COEC_V 370 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Examination of corporate enterprise decisions including capital budgeting; capital structure choice, and financial policies, tools, and valuation. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 370 or COEC_V 370. Prerequisite: COMM_V 298. Equivalency: COEC_V 370 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Investment Theory
description: Basic concepts of finance, including security valuation, security markets, and financial decisions concerning risk and return. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 371 or COEC_V 371. Prerequisite: COMM_V 298. Equivalency: COEC_V 371 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 298. Equivalency: COEC_V 371 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Basic concepts of finance, including security valuation, security markets, and financial decisions concerning risk and return. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 371 or COEC_V 371. Prerequisite: COMM_V 298. Equivalency: COEC_V 371 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Applied Financial Markets
description: Introduction to methodologies and evidence concerning the structure and operation of security markets and the valuation of financial securities including stocks, bonds, options and futures contracts; portfolio management, corporate finance and investment decisions. Prerequisite: All of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Behavioural Finance
description: The psychological processes that give rise to decision-making biases in investment settings and counter-strategies to minimize their negative effects on financial decisions. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Financial Institutions I
description: The roles and operation of financial institutions, including banks, and the financial systems and markets in which they function, including those involving payments processes and the creation and use of fiat and digital money including cryptocurrencies. Prerequisite: COMM_V 298. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 298. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: International Financial Markets and Institutions
description: Structure, nature and institutions of foreign exchange markets, including spot, forward, futures, options, and offshore currency markets. Factors affecting exchange rates are also discussed. Credit will be granted for only one of ECON_V 456, COMM_V 377, or COEC_V 377. Prerequisite: All of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 371. Equivalency: COEC_V 377 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 371. Equivalency: COEC_V 377 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Structure, nature and institutions of foreign exchange markets, including spot, forward, futures, options, and offshore currency markets. Factors affecting exchange rates are also discussed. Credit will be granted for only one of ECON_V 456, COMM_V 377, or COEC_V 377. Prerequisite: All of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 371. Equivalency: COEC_V 377 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Introduction to Pensions and Insurance
description: Financial dimensions and institutional structure of the pension and insurance industry; calculation of annuities and other aspects of actuarial science based on probability distributions and asset returns. Suitable for students in mathematics who have taken basic finance and for commerce students in finance, accounting and related areas. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Co-operative Work Placement I
description: Approved and supervised work experience for a minimum of 3.5 months. Normally taken during the winter term of the third year. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Commerce. Option-specific prerequisites apply. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Co-operative Work Placement II
description: Approved and supervised work experience for a minimum of 3.5 months. Normally taken during the summer term of the third year. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Commerce. Prerequisite: COMM_V 380 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 380 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Economics of Entrepreneurship and Innovation
description: Fundamental economic issues faced by entrepreneurs who want to commercialize innovations within start-ups and established firms. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 382 and COMR_V 382. Equivalency: COMR_V 382 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Fundamental economic issues faced by entrepreneurs who want to commercialize innovations within start-ups and established firms. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 382 and COMR_V 382. Equivalency: COMR_V 382 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Innovation Leadership
description: Social science frameworks useful for understanding organizational innovation processes and application of these frameworks to innovation. Diagnosing and solving a broad range of organizational innovation challenges from the perspective of an innovation leader. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Entrepreneurial Finance and Private Equity
description: Financial issues encountered by entrepreneurs and those active on the investing side of entrepreneurship, such as working for banks, venture capital firms, or corporate venture organizations, or anyone interacting with entrepreneurs and private equity investors. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 387, COEC_V 387, or COMR_V 387. Equivalency: COEC_V 387, COMR_V 387 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Financial issues encountered by entrepreneurs and those active on the investing side of entrepreneurship, such as working for banks, venture capital firms, or corporate venture organizations, or anyone interacting with entrepreneurs and private equity investors. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 387, COEC_V 387, or COMR_V 387. Equivalency: COEC_V 387, COMR_V 387 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Design Methods for Business Innovation
description: Studio-based experience in thinking strategies and design processes applied to business innovation in the private, public, and social sectors. Emphasis on problem solving, co-creation, and innovation for external clients in a collaborative environment. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 388 and COMR_V 388. Equivalency: COMR_V 388
exclusion_raw: Studio-based experience in thinking strategies and design processes applied to business innovation in the private, public, and social sectors. Emphasis on problem solving, co-creation, and innovation for external clients in a collaborative environment. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 388 and COMR_V 388. Equivalency: COMR_V 388

subject: COMM
title: Creativity in Business
description: The role and importance of creativity in developing successful business solutions. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 389 and COMR_V 389. Equivalency: COMR_V 389 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: The role and importance of creativity in developing successful business solutions. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 389 and COMR_V 389. Equivalency: COMR_V 389 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Commercial Law
description: Introduction to the law of contracts, with particular reference to contracts for sale of goods and related law of personal property; principles of agency, partnerships and company law. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Environment, Society, and Government
description: Roles of government and business in the Canadian economy, emphasizing interactions with the environment and society, including Indigenous communities. Ethical foundations of government, business and personal decision-making. Credit will be granted for only one of COEC_V 394 or COMM_V 394. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. Equivalency: COEC_V 394 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. Equivalency: COEC_V 394 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Roles of government and business in the Canadian economy, emphasizing interactions with the environment and society, including Indigenous communities. Ethical foundations of government, business and personal decision-making. Credit will be granted for only one of COEC_V 394 or COMM_V 394. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. Equivalency: COEC_V 394 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Business Communications
description: Understanding non-written communications in day-to-day business. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Business Communications II
description: An activity-focused course providing the opportunity to study and practice forms of written communication needed in business. Credit will be granted for only one COMM_V 396, COMM_V 390, COMM_V 220, or ENGL_V 301. Prerequisite: COMM_V 196. Equivalency: COMM_V 390 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 196. Equivalency: COMM_V 390 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Capstone Experience
description: Prepares students to transition to career and life after BCom. Integrates and leverages BCom learning towards meeting future challenges personally, at work and in society. Pass/Fail. Corequisite: COMM_V 491. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: COMM_V 491. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Real Estate Finance
description: The role of mortgage markets, mathematical analysis of return and valuation issue and methods of dealing with lender and borrower risk exposure. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 297, COMM_V 298. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 297, COMM_V 298. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Real Estate Economics
description: The economics of real estate markets. Topics include real estate cycles and bubbles, search models and vacancy, the relationship between real estate and the economy, housing demand, and models of housing supply. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Real Estate Development
description: The development process from theories of development, market analysis, site selection, project design, land use regulation and financial analysis. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 307, COMM_V 405. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 307, COMM_V 405. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Intermediate Business Statistics
description: Statistical techniques useful in business environments. Includes regression analysis, analysis of variance, forecasting, and logit and probit analysis. Credit may be obtained for only one of STAT_V 300, STAT_V 306, and COMM_V 411. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 191, COMM_V 291. Equivalency: STAT_V 300
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 191, COMM_V 291. Equivalency: STAT_V 300

subject: COMM
title: Negotiation
description: Negotiation simulations to provide experience and confidence in the negotiation process and to develop effective skills for achieving objectives. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Data Visualization and Business Analytics
description: Descriptive analytics including data analysis and visualization. Predictive analytics including forecasting and various statistical techniques. Predictive analytics including optimization, Monte Carlo simulation, decision trees, and discrete event simulation. Prerequisite: COMM_V 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Operations and Climate
description: Quantitative and qualitative evaluation of public policies and corporate strategies using statistical evaluation methods, cost benefit analysis, and other modelling tools, with a focus on the impacts of climate change on operations and vice versa. Industries including service provision, manufacturing, and infrastructure investment are assessed based on pricing, operating costs, emissions, and other environmental and societal impacts. Prerequisite: COMM_V 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Research Methods for Human Resource Management
description: Techniques for collection and analysis of data in organizations to support adoption and administration of human resource management. Prerequisite: COMM_V 327 and one of COMM_V 191, COMM_V 291 and one of COMM_V 192, COMM_V 292. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 327 and one of COMM_V 191, COMM_V 291 and one of COMM_V 192, COMM_V 292. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Selected Topics in Human Resource Management
description: Prerequisite: COMM_V 327, COMM_V 425 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 327, COMM_V 425 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Law of Business Organizations and Corporate Governance
description: Statutory provisions and case law that regulate the creation and governance of sole proprietorships, partnerships, corporations, joint ventures, and franchises in British Columbia. Fiduciary duties of partners, directors and officers are also examined. Prerequisite: COMM_V 393 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 393 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Land Law
description: Legal principles and concepts relating to real estate and land development. Prerequisite: COMM_V 393 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 393 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: CIO Strategies
description: Common issues faced by Chief Information Officers (CIO): Cost and value of information technology (IT), IT priorities, IT and the Board of Directors, Business-IT alignment, IT governance, IT talent management, standardization vs. innovation, project and vendor management/partnering, and managing security and risks. Prerequisite: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Information Systems Analysis and Design
description: The process of information systems development; modern techniques and tools for systems analysis and design. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 335, CPSC_V 310. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 335, CPSC_V 310. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Database Technology
description: Theory and technology of database management from an applications perspective; database design; database administration. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 437, COEC_V 437, CSPC_V 304 or CPSC_V 368. Prerequisite: COMM_V 335. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 335. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Theory and technology of database management from an applications perspective; database design; database administration. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 437, COEC_V 437, CSPC_V 304 or CPSC_V 368. Prerequisite: COMM_V 335. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Management of Information Systems
description: Managerial issues in the administration of computerized information systems. Prerequisite: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 205. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Business Data Communications
description: Basic data communications concepts and technology; local area, wide area, and enterprise networks; the Internet; wireless networking; network development life cycle; network security and management. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 439 or CPSC_V 317, and COMM_V 439 or CPSC_V 417. Prerequisite: COMM_V 335 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 335 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Basic data communications concepts and technology; local area, wide area, and enterprise networks; the Internet; wireless networking; network development life cycle; network security and management. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 439 or CPSC_V 317, and COMM_V 439 or CPSC_V 417. Prerequisite: COMM_V 335 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Advanced Business Logistics
description: Analysis of logistics systems within firms and across supply chains. The formulation of corporate logistics strategies. Corequisite: COMM_V 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: COMM_V 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Air Transportation
description: An integrative treatment of air transport management including: demand analysis, sales and marketing, globalization trends, aircraft selection and fleet planning; airport economics and management. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Maritime and International Transportation
description: The characteristics of shipping services and the role of shipping services in the design and management of international logistics systems. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Transportation Economics
description: Economic characteristics of passenger and freight transportation services; market structure of the transportation industry; economic impact of public regulation and promotion and the role of economic analysis in resolving problems of Canadian policy. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 446 or ECON_V 480. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301, ECON_V 206. Equivalency: ECON_V 480 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301, ECON_V 206. Equivalency: ECON_V 480 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Economic characteristics of passenger and freight transportation services; market structure of the transportation industry; economic impact of public regulation and promotion and the role of economic analysis in resolving problems of Canadian policy. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 446 or ECON_V 480. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 201, ECON_V 301, ECON_V 206. Equivalency: ECON_V 480 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Applied Project Management
description: Project management methodology based on the practices defined by the Project Management Institute, including planning, execution, monitoring, control, and completion. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 295, ECON_V 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Business Logistics and Logistics Services Management
description: General services management including warehousing, transportation, intermodal, order-fulfillment, dispatching, and more. Prerequisite: COMM_V 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Financial Accounting - Intermediate II
description: Intermediate II. Continuation of the examination of accounting as a means of measurement and as an information system for external reporting purposes. Prerequisite: COMM_V 353 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 353 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Taxes and Decision Making
description: Analysis of business and financial decisions in the presence of taxes. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Financial Accounting-Advanced
description: An examination of advanced financial accounting. Prerequisite: COMM_V 353, COMM_V 450 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 353, COMM_V 450 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Accounting for Management Control and Incentives
description: Design of accounting systems for facilitating and influencing management decisions, with emphasis on performance evaluation in organizations. Prerequisite: COMM_V 294 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 294 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Principles of Auditing
description: Principles of internal control, audit evidence, sampling and testing; audit reports; standards; responsibilities of the external auditor. Prerequisite: COMM_V 353. Corequisite: COMM_V 450. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 353. Corequisite: COMM_V 450. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: COMM_V 450. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Information Technology Risks, Protection and Audit
description: Business risks associated with the use of information technology. Controls for integrity, security safety, and privacy of hardware, software, data and communications. Methods for auditing information systems and their controls. Prerequisite: COMM_V 335 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 335 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Financial Statement Analysis
description: An examination of financial statement information from the perspective of decision makers external to the firm, e.g., investors and financial institutions. Prerequisite: COMM_V 293 and one of COMM_V 297, COMM_V 298 and one of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 397. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 293 and one of COMM_V 297, COMM_V 298 and one of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 397. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Social and Nonprofit Marketing
description: Examines the role, use, and application of marketing in government agencies and nonprofit institutions. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Business Development
description: Principles and practice of personal selling and leadership of teams: strategy, tactics, and implementation. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Integrated Marketing Communication
description: Marketing communication campaign strategy, conceptual framework, and practical application for integrated marketing communications, including advertising. Prerequisite: COMM_V 362 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 362 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Public Relations
description: Managing an organization's strategic communications and relationships with diverse publics to handle issues, strengthen reputation, fulfill social responsibilities, and build trust. Topics include stakeholder engagement, issues management, crisis communications, and events and sponsorship. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Digital Marketing
description: Investigation of Internet-based marketing, emphasizing customer-focused perspectives, competitive situations and analysis of the effectiveness of business websites using marketing principles and practices. Prerequisite: COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: New Venture Design
description: Teams comprising students in COMM_V 466 and APSC_V 486 propose a new product, produce a viable prototype, and develop a business plan for the marketplace. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 466, COMM_V 497, COEC_V 497, COMR_V 497, APSC_V 486, or APSC_V 496E. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Teams comprising students in COMM_V 466 and APSC_V 486 propose a new product, produce a viable prototype, and develop a business plan for the marketplace. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 466, COMM_V 497, COEC_V 497, COMR_V 497, APSC_V 486, or APSC_V 496E. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Brand Management
description: Issues and challenges commonly faced by brand managers, including: assessing brand meaning, evaluating brand health, assessing a brand's leverage potential, evaluating brand extensions, managing brands through a crisis, and assessing brand value. Prerequisite: COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Marketing Applications
description: A capstone marketing course where student teams develop comprehensive marketing plans for corporate clients by conducting industry analyses and crafting creative marketing strategies. Prerequisite: All of COMM_V 362, COMM_V 363, COMM_V 365. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of COMM_V 362, COMM_V 363, COMM_V 365. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: International Marketing
description: An analysis of the scope and significance of contemporary international business operations with particular reference to the marketing management problems encountered by firms with multinational branches and subsidiaries. Prerequisite: COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 296. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Venture Capital
description: Theory and evidence concerning venture capital markets. Contracting, fundraising, and financing choice covered in depth, with the aim of catering to students looking to raise money for entrepreneurial ventures or to invest in entrepreneurial ventures. Prerequisite: One of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 387. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 387. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Mergers and Acquisitions
description: Mergers and acquisitions as a focal point in making important corporate decisions deduced from careful study of relevant business cases. Prerequisite: COMM_V 370. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 370. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Fixed Income Markets and Management
description: Fixed income instruments and derivatives. Risk profiles and their use in establishing fixed income investment portfolios. Performance attribution techniques. Corequisite: COMM_V 374. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: COMM_V 374. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Investment Policy
description: The management of security portfolios for individual and institutional investors; relation of investment policy to money markets and business fluctuations. Prerequisite: COMM_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Advanced Topics in Investment Management
description: Applications of contemporary research, innovations, and technologies in the allocation of capital across asset classes, portfolios of assets, and individual securities. Empirical analyses of current market data using software and quantitative tools to implement potential investment and trading strategies. Prerequisite: All of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Risk Management and Financial Engineering
description: Principles of financial engineering and risk management. Use of derivatives in risk management. Valuation and hedging models for contingent claims. Prerequisite: COMM_V 374. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 374. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Advanced Topics on Corporate Finance
description: Corporate Finance is the process by which corporations raise money, allocate funds to real assets, and manage the flow of funds back to the investors. Topics will vary according to interests of students, instructors, and developments in the field. Corequisite: All of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of COMM_V 370, COMM_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Co-operative Work Placement III
description: Approved and supervised work experience for a minimum of 35 months. Normally taken during the summer term of the fourth year. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative. Education Program in Commerce. Prerequisite: COMM_V 381 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 381 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Co-operative Work Placement IV
description: Approved and supervised work experience for a minimum of 35 months. Normally taken during the fall term of the fourth year. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Commerce. Prerequisite: COMM_V 480 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: COMM_V 480 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: New Product Development
description: How new products are developed and the factors that influence success and failure throughout the various stages of development. Equivalency: COMR_V 482. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Leadership and General Management
description: Integration and application of business knowledge to make business decisions across disciplines; development of personal leadership ability and style. Case-based with guest speakers. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Sustainability Marketing
description: Role of marketing in creating social value. Integration of marketing fundamentals with core social, environmental, and economic principles of sustainability. Analysis of current sustainability trends. Development of strategic and practical marketing recommendations for for-profit enterprises. Potential and pitfalls of sustainability marketing. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Social Entrepreneurship
description: An applied course that examines the innovative, growing, and rapidly evolving field of social entrepreneurship, which tackles social and environmental challenges through business perspectives and methods. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 485 or COMR_V 485. Equivalency: COMR_V 485 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: An applied course that examines the innovative, growing, and rapidly evolving field of social entrepreneurship, which tackles social and environmental challenges through business perspectives and methods. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 485 or COMR_V 485. Equivalency: COMR_V 485 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Environmental Management
description: Explores corporate environmental strategy by introducing economic principles underlying environmental policy, law, and technologies for pollution prevention and abatement, environmental management systems, ISO-14001, energy systems, eco-marketing, and life-cycle analysis. Credit will be granted for only one of COEC_V 475, COMM_V 487, COMM_V 597, or ECON_V 371.
exclusion_raw: Explores corporate environmental strategy by introducing economic principles underlying environmental policy, law, and technologies for pollution prevention and abatement, environmental management systems, ISO-14001, energy systems, eco-marketing, and life-cycle analysis. Credit will be granted for only one of COEC_V 475, COMM_V 487, COMM_V 597, or ECON_V 371.

subject: COMM
title: Public Sector Management
description: This course focuses on some of the distinctive aspects of managing in the public sector. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Applied Methods in Technology Start-ups at CDL
description: Students work with the Creative Destruction Lab team to help start-ups that are focused on science and emerging technology. Students support real companies with market analysis, customer development, financial analysis, and will see how investors make decisions. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Strategic Management
description: Concepts and processes for the strategic management of private sector, single and multi-business unit enterprises are analysed using the case method. Methodologies which draw on economic and organizational theory are integrated to form the foundations for strategic analyses. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 491 or COEC_V 491. Prerequisite: Fourth-year standing. Either (a) all of COMM_V 390, COMM_V 395 or (b) COMM_V 396. Equivalency: COEC_V 491. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Fourth-year standing. Either (a) all of COMM_V 390, COMM_V 395 or (b) COMM_V 396. Equivalency: COEC_V 491. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Concepts and processes for the strategic management of private sector, single and multi-business unit enterprises are analysed using the case method. Methodologies which draw on economic and organizational theory are integrated to form the foundations for strategic analyses. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 491 or COEC_V 491. Prerequisite: Fourth-year standing. Either (a) all of COMM_V 390, COMM_V 395 or (b) COMM_V 396. Equivalency: COEC_V 491. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Management Simulation
description: Student teams manage hypothetical firms in a complex simulation, coordinating production, finance, marketing and strategic planning in competition with other teams. Prerequisite: Fourth-year standing. Either (a) COMM_V 390, COMM_V 395 or (b) COMM_V 396. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Fourth-year standing. Either (a) COMM_V 390, COMM_V 395 or (b) COMM_V 396. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: Business and Sustainable Development
description: An overview of environmental issues, focusing on corporate strategy, government policy and interactions between these two sectors of the economy. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: COMM
title: New Enterprise Development
description: The particular problems and experiences encountered in starting, developing and managing new enterprises. The course includes lectures, guest speakers, and case studies. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 497, COMM_V 466, COEC_V 497, COMR_V 497, APSC_V 486, or APSC_V 496E. Prerequisite: Fourth-year standing. Either (a) all of COMM_V 390, COMM_V 395 or (b) COMM_V 396. Equivalency: COEC_V 497, COMR_V 497. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Fourth-year standing. Either (a) all of COMM_V 390, COMM_V 395 or (b) COMM_V 396. Equivalency: COEC_V 497, COMR_V 497. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: The particular problems and experiences encountered in starting, developing and managing new enterprises. The course includes lectures, guest speakers, and case studies. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 497, COMM_V 466, COEC_V 497, COMR_V 497, APSC_V 486, or APSC_V 496E. Prerequisite: Fourth-year standing. Either (a) all of COMM_V 390, COMM_V 395 or (b) COMM_V 396. Equivalency: COEC_V 497, COMR_V 497. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

Credit will be granted for only one of COMM_V 498 or COEC_V 498. Prerequisite: Either (a) all of COMM_V 390, COMM_V 395 or (b) COMM_V 396. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
