subject: CRWR
title: Introduction to Creative Writing
description: Techniques of and practice in multiple genres of writing, including fiction, poetry, creative nonfiction, screenplay, stageplay, graphic forms, lyric forms, children's literature, and writing for new media. Manuscript submission is not required for admission.

subject: CRWR
title: Introduction to Writing Poetry
description: An exploration of and practice in the writing of poetry, focusing on how a writer employs the technical elements of the craft of poetry. Manuscript submission not required for admission.

subject: CRWR
title: Introduction to Writing for Children and Young Adults
description: Techniques of and practice in creating, developing and writing for children and young adults. Manuscript submission is not required for admission.

subject: CRWR
title: Introduction to Writing Creative Nonfiction
description: An exploration of and practice in the writing of creative nonfiction, focusing on how a writer employs the technical elements of the craft of creative nonfiction. Manuscript submission not required for admission.

subject: CRWR
title: Introduction to Writing for the Screen
description: Techniques of and practice in creating, developing, and writing a screenplay. Manuscript submission is not required for admission.

subject: CRWR
title: Introduction to Writing for Graphic Forms
description: Techniques of and practice in creating, developing, and writing the graphic novel, manga, and other forms of illustrated writing. The ability to draw is not required. Manuscript submission is not required for admission.

subject: CRWR
title: Introduction to Writing Fiction
description: An exploration of the writing of fiction, focusing on how a writer employs the technical elements of the craft of fiction. Manuscript submission not required for admission.

subject: CRWR
title: Introduction to Writing for the New Media
description: An exploration of and practice in writing for new media, including podcasting, blogging, and writing for websites, games, and online environments. Manuscript submission is not required for admission.

subject: CRWR
title: Short Screenplay Workshop
description: Restricted to B.F.A. Film Production students.

subject: CRWR
title: Introduction to Creative Writing with an Indigenous Focus
description: Covers three genres from fiction, poetry, creative nonfiction, radio drama, radio feature, or stageplay.

subject: CRWR
title: Introduction to Writing for Comedic Forms
description: An examination of and practice in creative writing in comedic forms, including stand-up, sketch, film, new media, and text. Manuscript submission not required for admission.

subject: CRWR
title: Intermediate Writing Poetry
description: The writing of poetry in various forms using a combination of workshopping and online modules. Manuscript submission not required for admission. Prerequisite: CRWR 201.
prerequisite_raw: CRWR 201.

subject: CRWR
title: Writing for Podcast
description: Exploration of and practice in writing for podcast.

subject: CRWR
title: Intermediate Writing for Children and Young Adults
description: The writing of work for children and young adults in various forms using a combination of workshopping and online modules. Manuscript submission not required for admission. Prerequisite: CRWR 203.
prerequisite_raw: CRWR 203.

subject: CRWR
title: Intermediate Writing of Creative Nonfiction
description: An exploration of and practice in the writing of creative non-fiction, covering four of the more basic forms of this genre: memoir, profile, commentary, and exposition. Manuscript submission is not required for admission. Prerequisite: CRWR 205.
prerequisite_raw: CRWR 205.

subject: CRWR
title: Intermediate Writing for the Screen
description: An exploration of and practice in writing for the screen, focusing on how a writer employs the technical elements of the craft of screenwriting. Manuscript submission is not required for admission. Prerequisite: CRWR 206.
prerequisite_raw: CRWR 206.

subject: CRWR
title: Intermediate Writing for the Stage
description: An exploration of practice in the writing of the one-act stage play, focusing on how a writer employs the technical elements of the craft of this genre. Manuscript submission is not required for admission. Prerequisite: CRWR 200.
prerequisite_raw: CRWR 200.

subject: CRWR
title: Intermediate Writing for Graphic Forms
description: The writing of graphica (comics, manga and graphic novels), using a combination of workshopping and online modules. Manuscript submission not required for admission. Prerequisite: CRWR 208.
prerequisite_raw: CRWR 208.

subject: CRWR
title: Intermediate Writing Fiction
description: An exploration of the writing of fiction, focusing on how a writer employs the technical elements of the craft of fiction. Manuscript submission not required for admission. Prerequisite: CRWR 209.
prerequisite_raw: CRWR 209.

subject: CRWR
title: Video Game Writing and Narrative
description: Narrative design and writing for video games. Prerequisite: CRWR 200.
prerequisite_raw: CRWR 200.

subject: CRWR
title: Intermediate Writing for Lyric Forms
description: Techniques of and practice in writing for lyric forms, including song lyrics, lyrical narratives, and libretti. Manuscript submission is not required for admission.

subject: CRWR
title: Interactive Storytelling
description: Origin, theory and practice of interactive story forms. Exploring structural links between interactive theatre, gaming, and extended (virtual, mixed, and augmented) reality. Prerequisite: One of CRWR 213 or B.M.S. student with 3rd year standing or higher.
prerequisite_raw: One of CRWR 213 or B.M.S. student with 3rd year standing or higher.

subject: CRWR
title: Intermediate Writing for Television
description: Elements of episodic and serialized comedic and dramatic television writing with writing practice applied to primary formats and genres. Prerequisite: CRWR 206.
prerequisite_raw: CRWR 206.

subject: CRWR
title: Writing Genre Fiction
description: Exploration and practice in writing major genres of genre fiction, including fantasy, science fiction, romance, crime, horror, and historical fiction. Prerequisite: All of CRWR 200, CRWR 209.
prerequisite_raw: All of CRWR 200, CRWR 209.

subject: CRWR
title: Intermediate Comedic Forms
description: Contemporary and historical comedic writing in a variety of forms. Emphasis on critical analysis and creative writing of comedic works, and changes in the comedic landscape. Recommended: CRWR 200 Prerequisite: CRWR 230.
prerequisite_raw: CRWR 230.

subject: CRWR
title: Video Game Writing
description: A workshop class on writing for video games. Restricted to Creative Writing majors.

subject: CRWR
title: Preparation for a Career in Writing
description: Pass/Fail. Credit will be granted for only one of CRWR 430 or CRWR 530. Restricted to Majors in Creative Writing. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Pass/Fail. Credit will be granted for only one of CRWR 430 or CRWR 530. Restricted to Majors in Creative Writing. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CRWR
title: Advanced Comedic Forms
description: A workshop class exploring comedic writing in varied forms including film and television, prose and poetry, non-fiction, and new media. This course is restricted to students in the CRWR BFA program.

subject: CRWR
title: Preparation for a Career in Writing
description: Pass/Fail. Credit will be granted for only one of CRWR 430 or CRWR 530. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Pass/Fail. Credit will be granted for only one of CRWR 430 or CRWR 530. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CRWR
title: Advanced Comedic Forms
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CRWR
title: Thesis
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CSIS
title: Critical Engagements in Sexuality Studies
description: Introductory survey to sexuality studies that emphasizes how sexuality intersects with race, gender, class, ability, and geography. Recommended pre-requisite: GRSJ 101.

subject: CSIS
title: Introduction to Trans* Studies
description: How race, citizenship, gender, sexuality, culture and dis/ability are materially and socially constructed together to give meaning to the category trans*. (Trans*: transgender, transsexual, gender variant and other articulations.) Recommended pre-requisite: GRSJ 101.

subject: CSPW
title: Coordinated Science Program Workshop
description: Students participate in activities related to their CSP courses, including hands-on work, discussion and analysis of scientific topics. Graded Pass/Fail. [0-0-2] Prerequisite: Registration in Coordinated Science Program This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Registration in Coordinated Science Program This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: CTLN
title: Beginners' Catalan
description: Catalan language. Aligned with CEFR level A1 objectives. Credit will be granted for only one of CTLN 101 or CTLN 301.
exclusion_raw: Catalan language. Aligned with CEFR level A1 objectives. Credit will be granted for only one of CTLN 101 or CTLN 301.

subject: DANI
title: Elementary Danish I
description: Students with native or near-native proficiency in a Scandinavian language (e.g. Danish, Norwegian, Swedish) cannot participate in the elementary Danish courses (DANI 100 and DANI 110), but are welcome to join the intermediate courses (DANI 200 and DANI 210).

subject: DANI
title: Elementary Danish II
description: Students with native or near-native proficiency in a Scandinavian language (e.g. Danish, Norwegian, Swedish) cannot participate in the elementary Danish courses (DANI 100 and DANI 110), but are welcome to join the intermediate courses (DANI 200 and DANI 210).

subject: DENT
title: Special Oral Care in the Community
description: Provision of special oral health services in community settings. Prerequisite: All of DHYG 405, DHYG 435. Prerequisites may be waived for non-program dental hygienists and others.
prerequisite_raw: All of DHYG 405, DHYG 435. Prerequisites may be waived for non-program dental hygienists and others.

subject: DENT
title: Dentistry I: Foundations of Clinical Dentistry
description: Fundamentals of human biology, body systems, diseases, and supporting basic oral health sciences. Learning in small groups, classroom, laboratory, and clinical settings utilizing technology. Professionalism, ethics, interprofessional education and the social contract, communication skills, and critical evaluation of the literature. Begin to apply foundation knowledge and skills to patient assessment and care. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DENT
title: Dentistry II: Basic Clinical Dentistry
description: Continued exposure to body systems and the supporting biomedical sciences with applications in dental clinical sciences, integrated into small group learning, classroom, laboratory, and community settings utilizing technology; continued engagement in professionalism, ethics and communication skills. Prerequisite: DENT 410. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: DENT 410. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DENT
title: Dentistry III: Intermediate Clinical Dentistry
description: A multi-disciplinary course integrating didactic, simulation, clinical, and community service learning. Students function as team members in clinical group practices with individual progression through the Clinical Clerkships. Prerequisite: DENT420
prerequisite_raw: DENT420

subject: DENT
title: Dentistry IV: Complex Clinical Dentistry
description: A continuing integrated, multi-disciplinary course with ongoing participation in clinical group practices and individual progression through the Clinical Clerkships and community service learning. Prerequisite: DENT430 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: DENT430 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DENT

subject: DES
title: Measured Architectural Drawing
description: Techniques applicable to analytic and technical drawing used in architecture, landscape architecture, and urban design with focus primarily on analog drawing techniques. Open to all UBC students regardless of prior experience. Credit will be granted for only one of ENDS 110 or DES 110.
exclusion_raw: Techniques applicable to analytic and technical drawing used in architecture, landscape architecture, and urban design with focus primarily on analog drawing techniques. Open to all UBC students regardless of prior experience. Credit will be granted for only one of ENDS 110 or DES 110.

subject: DES
title: Design, Culture and Ecology
description: Survey of the visual, cultural, ecological and spatial literacies in architectural and urban design.

subject: DES
title: Design Thinking
description: Design thinking through the analysis of architecture, landscape architecture and urban design and through hands-on design projects. This course is open to all UBC students, regardless of prior experience. Credit will granted for only one of ENDS 231 or DES 200. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Design Studio I - Context and Site
description: Design within the context of various analytical lenses including ecological, climatic, social, political, cultural and historical influences. Prerequisite: One of DES 110, VISA 180. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of DES 110, VISA 180. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Design Studio II - Form
description: Essential processes and methods for thinking in three-dimensional spatial terms. Prerequisite: A grade of 60% or better in DES_V 201. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: A grade of 60% or better in DES_V 201. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Design Media I
description: Techniques in architectural drawing, two-dimensional representation, three-dimensional representation and general visual literacy. Credit will be granted for only one of ENDS 320, ARCH 515 or DES 211. Prerequisite: One of DES 110, VISA 180. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of DES 110, VISA 180. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Techniques in architectural drawing, two-dimensional representation, three-dimensional representation and general visual literacy. Credit will be granted for only one of ENDS 320, ARCH 515 or DES 211. Prerequisite: One of DES 110, VISA 180. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Design Media II
description: Advanced techniques in architectural representation and discourse in digital representation and digital making. Credit will be granted for only one of ARCH 437, ARCH 517 or DES 212. Prerequisite: DES 211. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: DES 211. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Advanced techniques in architectural representation and discourse in digital representation and digital making. Credit will be granted for only one of ARCH 437, ARCH 517 or DES 212. Prerequisite: DES 211. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Architecture and Urbanism in Context: Vancouver and its Region
description: The unfolding architecture and urbanism of Metro Vancouver. Using Vancouver as a laboratory to examine the historical transformation of the built environment, and how this has affected particular activities, land uses, and social groups within the region. Open enrolment course. Credit will be granted for only one of ENDS 220 or DES 220.
exclusion_raw: The unfolding architecture and urbanism of Metro Vancouver. Using Vancouver as a laboratory to examine the historical transformation of the built environment, and how this has affected particular activities, land uses, and social groups within the region. Open enrolment course. Credit will be granted for only one of ENDS 220 or DES 220.

subject: DES
title: Sustainability by Design
description: Interactions between human and natural urban systems using local and international examples of successful sustainable community designs. This course is open to all UBC students, regardless of prior experience. Credit will be granted for only one of ENDS 221 or DES 230. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Interactions between human and natural urban systems using local and international examples of successful sustainable community designs. This course is open to all UBC students, regardless of prior experience. Credit will be granted for only one of ENDS 221 or DES 230. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Site Analysis and Planning
description: Analysis and planning of relatively complex sites, emphasizing storm water management design. Credit will be given for only one of DES 231, LARC 440, or LARC 540. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Material Culture
description: An investigation of building materials and associated design objectives, environmental conditions, historical context, regulatory controls, and economic constraints. Credit will be granted for only one of DES 232 or ARCH 411. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: An investigation of building materials and associated design objectives, environmental conditions, historical context, regulatory controls, and economic constraints. Credit will be granted for only one of DES 232 or ARCH 411. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Design Studio III - Building Scale Synthesis
description: Design at the architectural scale through the medium of program and site. Prerequisite: A grade of 60% or better in DES_V 202. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: A grade of 60% or better in DES_V 202. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Design Studio IV - Vancouver
description: Vancouver as a laboratory for design at the architectural and urban scale with a focused view into how design is implicated in the social, political, and environmental transformation of the city. Prerequisite: A grade of 60% or better in DES_V 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: A grade of 60% or better in DES_V 301. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: History of the Design of the Built Environment
description: A broad historical introduction to architectural and landscape architectural design within the context of politics, economics and culture. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Histories in Landscape Architecture
description: Landscapes from medieval times to the present studied synchronically across design elements as well as chronologically with the development of several key historical concepts. Prerequisite: DES 320. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: DES 320. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Structural Systems and Supports
description: Basic structural systems in the built world including wood, steel, concrete, composite systems and essential structural logics of soil retention systems and drainage. Prerequisite: All of DES 231, DES 232. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of DES 231, DES 232. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Co-operative Education Work Term I
description: Supervised, technical work- integrated learning experience in a public or private organization for a minimum of three months. Formal co-op assignments required. Restricted to undergraduate students meeting the requirements of the Bachelor of Design and the Co-operative Education Program. Prerequisite: APSC 107. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: APSC 107. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Design Build
description: Direct hands-on confrontation with the realities of design and construction, engaging in both conventional and unconventional building processes. Prerequisite: DES 302.
prerequisite_raw: DES 302.

subject: DES
title: Design Studio V - Urban Systems Scale Synthesis
description: Relationships between communities and environment, urban infrastructure and ecological systems. Prerequisite: A grade of 60% or better in DES_V 302. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: A grade of 60% or better in DES_V 302. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Design Studio VI - Away
description: A design project engaged with an international context and site. Emphasis placed on mapping, interpretation of the international context as well as methods of construction, notions of program, and policies, regulations and codes that relate to the site. Prerequisite: A grade of 60% or better in DES_V 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: A grade of 60% or better in DES_V 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Senior Design Project
description: Final design project in the Honours Option with an independently conceived methodology allowing a student the opportunity to pursue his/her own set of interests and concerns. Prerequisite: A sessional average of 80% or better in each of years 2 and 3 and a grade of 80% or better in each of DES 201, 202, 301, 302 and DES 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: A sessional average of 80% or better in each of years 2 and 3 and a grade of 80% or better in each of DES 201, 202, 301, 302 and DES 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Design Theory
description: Introduction to a broad range of theories in architecture and design as they relate to the built environment. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Urbanism by Design
description: A history of the planning, landscape architecture and urban design of cities, and of how ideas have influenced the design of the city. Prerequisite: One of DES 321, DES 322, DES 323. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of DES 321, DES 322, DES 323. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Environment, Urban Form, and Infrastructure
description: Relationships between, and integration of, the natural environment and the physical form, spatial structure, and infrastructure of livability of cities. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: DES
title: Co-operative Education Work Term II
description: Supervised, technical work- integrated learning experience in a public or private organization for a minimum of three months. Formal co-op assignments required. Restricted to undergraduate students meeting the requirements of the Bachelor of Design and the Co-operative Education Program. Prerequisite: DES 341. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: DES 341. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

prerequisite_raw: DES 443. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

description: Core business skills, building on students' design capabilities to pursue ethical and sustainable design-based business goals. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
