description: Intensive and extensive agriculture with a focus on water needs, water use, and impacts on water resources. Non-point sources of pollution, nutrient modelling, soil and land degradation, protection, and rehabilitation of watersheds including buffer zones, wetlands, and best management practices. Equivalency: SOIL520 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: LWS
title: Global Issues in Land and Water Systems
description: Historical framework of importance of water basins, legacy between water basins and human evolution, effects of agriculture, forestry, industry and urbanization. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: LWS
title: Major Project
description: Professional paper on topics focusing on emerging issues in water and land resources. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: LWS
title: Professional Communications Strategies
description: Communication strategies for natural resource management professionals, with an emphasis on written, oral and digital media communications in a multi-stakeholder context. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Technical Communication
description: Written and oral communication in business correspondence, engineering design methods, report preparation and oral presentations of technical material. Restricted to students in second year of the Manufacturing Engineering Program. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of APSC 176, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121, WRDS 150. Equivalency: APSC 201 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of APSC 176, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121, WRDS 150. Equivalency: APSC 201 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Manufacturing Engineering Laboratory
description: Theory, operational constraints, and problem solving in traditional manufacturing processes. Casting, heat treatment, bulk deformation (i.e. rolling, extrusion, drawing), machining, joining, and shaping of composites. Experiments in process and product characterization. [1-2-0; 1-2-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Thermodynamics
description: Thermodynamic system and properties, thermodynamic processes; work and heat interactions. Conservation of energy and First Law, internal energy and enthalpy, the Second Law and entropy, application to manufacturing processes. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: All of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 152, PHYS_V 157. Corequisite: MATH_V 255. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 152, PHYS_V 157. Corequisite: MATH_V 255. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MATH_V 255. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Machine Dynamics
description: Classifications of mechanisms, velocity, acceleration and force analysis, graphical and computer-oriented vector and matrix methods, balancing, flywheels, gears, gear trains, cams. [3-0-2*] Prerequisite: All of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 152, PHYS_V 170. Corequisite: MATH_V 255. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 152, PHYS_V 170. Corequisite: MATH_V 255. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MATH_V 255. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Production Systems Management I
description: Impact of operations in increasing productivity and reducing waste. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Manufacturing Engineering Project I
description: Project-based, multi-step manufacturing engineering design and problem solving. [1-4-0; 1-4-0] Prerequisite: MANU 230. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MANU 230. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Production Systems Management II
description: Functional area of production and operations management. Decision-making, capacity planning, aggregate planning, inventory management, distribution planning, materials requirements planning and quality control. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MANU 270. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MANU 270. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Engineering Materials II
description: Materials selection for different design criteria; importance of shape and processing variables; computer software in selection. Credit will be granted for only one of MTRL 280 or MANU 378. [2-0-3] Prerequisite: APSC 278. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: APSC 278. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Materials selection for different design criteria; importance of shape and processing variables; computer software in selection. Credit will be granted for only one of MTRL 280 or MANU 378. [2-0-3] Prerequisite: APSC 278. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Manufacturing Processes I
description: Correlation between material properties and processibility for practical engineering manufacturing routes. Calculations and design. Application of heat/mass/fluid transport, mechanics and thermodynamics to manufacturing processes. [2-0-3] Prerequisite: All of APSC_V 278, APSC_V 279, MTRL_V 264, MECH_V 260 and one of MECH_V 280, MTRL_V 263. Corequisite: MANU_V 261. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of APSC_V 278, APSC_V 279, MTRL_V 264, MECH_V 260 and one of MECH_V 280, MTRL_V 263. Corequisite: MANU_V 261. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MANU_V 261. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Industrial Automation
description: Principle components of manufacturing automation, modelling of sensors-actuators and control systems, robotic programming, programmable logical control (PLC) systems and development of PLC ladder diagrams. [2-3*-1] Prerequisite: All of MANU 265, MATH 255. Corequisite: MANU 330. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MANU 265, MATH 255. Corequisite: MANU 330. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MANU 330. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Manufacturing Design Capstone Project
description: Project-based, multi-step, multi-part Capstone design project involving manufacturing engineering design methods, problem solving. [1-4-0; 1-4-0] Prerequisite: MANU 330. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MANU 330. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Biomedical Manufacturing
description: Bulk and nanoscale manufacturing processes for biomedical devices, materials and therapeutics; drug delivery; host-tissue biomaterial interactions; surface modification of medical devices; sterilization techniques; good manufacturing processes; medical device regulation. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Third-year standing or higher.
prerequisite_raw: Third-year standing or higher.

subject: MANU
title: Additive Manufacturing Design
description: Design tools and methods for additive manufacturing, complex digital geometry creation, computer aided design tools, additive manufacturing workflow development, producibility analysis, analysis of 3D data sets for suitability to additive manufacturing processes. [2-2-0] Prerequisite: Third-year standing or greater. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Third-year standing or greater. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Factory Planning
description: Resources planning, layout and logistics. Modular production and cyber-physical manufacturing systems in laboratory scale, virtual manufacturing and factory automation. [2-2-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Manufacturing for Clean Energy
description: Manufacturing and the net-zero energy transition; renewable, low-carbon and sustainable energy and electricity generation; energy, electricity transport, storage and batteries; hydrogen economy; carbon capture utilization and storage (CCUS). [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Third-year standing or greater. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Third-year standing or greater. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: AI and Machine Learning Applications in Manufacturing
description: Artificial intelligence, machine learning techniques, Deep learning, Python libraries for machine learning, Basic signal processing techniques, Data Acquisition, Applications in Manufacturing, Use of sound to evaluate operation of CNC machinery, Use of AE sensor to evaluate metal 3D printing [3-0-1] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Manufacturing Processes II
description: Numerical modelling of manufacturing processes, linkage between material, process, properties and product geometry, heat/mass transport, thermodynamics and design principles applied to practical engineering processes. [2-0-3] Prerequisite: MANU 380. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MANU 380. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Manufacturing Processes III
description: Integrating concepts of primary (casting), secondary (deformation), and tertiary (machining and surface treatment) processes and economic and environmental assessment. [2-0-3] Prerequisite: MANU 380. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MANU 380. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Metal Cutting and Machine Tool Vibrations
description: Metal cutting and grinding mechanics; prediction of force-torque-power in turning, drilling, milling and grinding operations. Machine tool vibrations, forced and self-excited vibrations in machining, experimental modal testing of machine tools, chatter, and stability. Credit will be granted for only one of MANU 485 or MECH 592. [3-1*-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Metal cutting and grinding mechanics; prediction of force-torque-power in turning, drilling, milling and grinding operations. Machine tool vibrations, forced and self-excited vibrations in machining, experimental modal testing of machine tools, chatter, and stability. Credit will be granted for only one of MANU 485 or MECH 592. [3-1*-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MANU
title: Machine and Part Metrology
description: Laser interferometer measurement of volumetric accuracy; error mapping, modelling and compensation of errors, rotation metrology, spindle accuracy. Part dimension and surface metrology. Metrology instruments: Coordinate measurement machine, surface profile meter, laser interferometer and ball bar. [2-2-0] Prerequisite: All of MANU 265, MATH 255, MECH 368. Corequisite: MANU 430. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MANU 265, MATH 255, MECH 368. Corequisite: MANU 430. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MANU 430. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Differential Calculus with Applications
description: Derivatives of elementary functions. Applications and modelling: graphing, optimization. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: A score of 80% or higher in BC Pre-calculus 12. High school calculus is strongly recommended.
prerequisite_raw: A score of 80% or higher in BC Pre-calculus 12. High school calculus is strongly recommended.

subject: MATH
title: Integral Calculus with Applications
description: The definite integral, integration techniques, applications, modelling, infinite series. Equivalency: MATH_V 103, 105. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184.

subject: MATH
title: Differential Calculus with Applications to Life Sciences
description: Functions, derivatives, optimization, growth and decay, discrete probability. Equivalency: MATH_V 100, 104. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: High-school calculus and a score of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.
prerequisite_raw: High-school calculus and a score of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.

subject: MATH
title: Integral Calculus with Applications to Life Sciences
description: Antiderivatives and definite integrals, infinite series, applications to probability and dynamical systems. Equivalency: MATH_V 101, 105. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184.

subject: MATH
title: Differential Calculus with Applications to Commerce and Social Sciences
description: Derivatives and rates of change, exponential and trigonometric functions, Newton's method, Taylor polynomials, maxima and minima, and graphing. Equivalency: MATH_V 100, 102. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: High-school calculus and a score of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.
prerequisite_raw: High-school calculus and a score of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.

subject: MATH
title: Integral Calculus with Applications to Commerce and Social Sciences
description: Antiderivatives, the definite integral, techniques of integration, infinite series, partial derivatives, maxima and minima with constraints, discrete and continuous random variables. Equivalency: MATH_V 101, 103. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184.

subject: MATH
title: Differential Calculus
description: Topics as for MATH 100, but including relevant topics from algebra, geometry, functions, trigonometry, logarithms, and exponentials. [3-0-1.5; 3-0-1.5] Prerequisite: A grade of 65% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.
prerequisite_raw: A grade of 65% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.

subject: MATH
title: Matrix Algebra
description: Systems of linear equations, operations on matrices, determinants, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, diagonalization of symmetric matrices. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: Link. [3-0-0] Equivalency: MATH_V 221. Prerequisite: Either (a) one of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184 or (b) advanced credit for MATH_V 100, or (c) SCIE_V 001 as a co-requisite.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) one of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184 or (b) advanced credit for MATH_V 100, or (c) SCIE_V 001 as a co-requisite.

subject: MATH
title: Honours Differential Calculus
description: Limits, derivatives, Mean Value Theorem and applications, elementary functions, optimization, Taylor series, approximation. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [4-0-0] Prerequisite: High-school calculus and one of (a) a score of 95% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12; or (b) permission from the Mathematics Department Head.
prerequisite_raw: High-school calculus and one of (a) a score of 95% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12; or (b) permission from the Mathematics Department Head.

subject: MATH
title: Honours Integral Calculus
description: Definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, techniques and applications of integration, infinite series. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [4-0-0] Prerequisite: Either(a) MATH 120 or (b) one of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 180, MATH 184. Prerequisite grade requirement: 80% in MATH184,MATH180,MATH104,MATH102,MATH100. 68% in MATH120. or (c) a score of 5 in AP Calculus AB.
prerequisite_raw: Either(a) MATH 120 or (b) one of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 180, MATH 184. Prerequisite grade requirement: 80% in MATH184,MATH180,MATH104,MATH102,MATH100. 68% in MATH120. or (c) a score of 5 in AP Calculus AB.

subject: MATH
title: Honours Linear Algebra
description: Matrices, eigenvectors, diagonalization, orthogonality, linear systems, applications. Students who obtain credit for MATH_V 131 cannot in the same or later terms obtain credit for MATH_V 111, MATH_V 152, or MATH_V 221. [3-0-0] Equivalency: MATH_V 223. Prerequisite: One of (a) one of MATH_V 120, MATH_V 121, SCIE_V 001, or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184, or (c) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 103, MATH_V 105, MATH_V 152, MATH_V 111, MATH_V 221, or (d) SCIE_V 001 as a corequisite.
prerequisite_raw: One of (a) one of MATH_V 120, MATH_V 121, SCIE_V 001, or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184, or (c) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 103, MATH_V 105, MATH_V 152, MATH_V 111, MATH_V 221, or (d) SCIE_V 001 as a corequisite.

subject: MATH
title: Linear Systems
description: 2D and 3D geometry, vectors and matrices, eigenvalues and vibration, physical applications. Laboratories demonstrate computer solutions of large systems. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-1*-0] Corequisite: [MATH101]
corequisite_raw: [MATH101]

subject: MATH
title: Differential Calculus with Applications
description: Topics as for Math 100; intended for students with no previous knowledge of Calculus. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . Not for credit for students with AP Calculus AB, AP Calculus BC, or a passing score on the UBC-SFU-UVIC-UNBC Calculus Challenge Examination. [3-0-1.5] Prerequisite: A grade of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.
prerequisite_raw: A grade of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.

subject: MATH
title: Differential Calculus for Social Science and Commerce
description: Topics as for Math 104; intended for students with no previous knowledge of Calculus. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . Not for credit for students with AP Calculus AB, AP Calculus BC, or a passing score on the UBC-SFU-UVIC-UNBC Calculus Challenge Examination. [3-0-1.5] Prerequisite: A grade of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.
prerequisite_raw: A grade of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.

subject: MATH
title: Calculus Survey
description: Functions, derivatives, integrals, curve sketching growth functions, volume calculations. Only for credit in the Faculty of Forestry. Students with credit for MATH 100, 102, 104, 120, 180, or 184 cannot in the same term or later terms obtain credit for MATH 190. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 and registration in the B.S.F. or B.Sc.N. programs.
prerequisite_raw: Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 and registration in the B.S.F. or B.Sc.N. programs.

subject: MATH
title: Calculus III
description: Analytic geometry in 2 and 3 dimensions, partial and directional derivatives, chain rule, maxima and minima, second derivative test, Lagrange multipliers, multiple integrals with applications. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Mathematical Computing
description: Introduction to mathematical software and numerical methods. Numbers, arrays, functions, vectorization and iteration. Sequences and series, root finding, numerical integration, numerical methods for differential equations, systems of linear equations, mathematical graphics. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001. Corequisite: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001. Corequisite: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

subject: MATH
title: Elementary Differential Equations I
description: First-order equations; linear equations; linear systems; Laplace transforms; numerical methods; trajectory analysis of plane nonlinear systems. Applications of these topics will be emphasized. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223. Corequisite: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223. Corequisite: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.

subject: MATH
title: Multivariable and Vector Calculus
description: Partial differentiation, extreme values, multiple integration, vector fields, line and surface integrals, the divergence theorem, Green's and Stokes' theorems. Intended for students in Honours Physics and Engineering Physics. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [4-0-0] Prerequisite: A score of 68% or higher in one of PHYS 102, PHYS 108, PHYS 118, PHYS 153, PHYS 158, SCIE 001 and a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001. Corequisite: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
prerequisite_raw: A score of 68% or higher in one of PHYS 102, PHYS 108, PHYS 118, PHYS 153, PHYS 158, SCIE 001 and a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001. Corequisite: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Proof
description: Sets and functions; induction; cardinality; properties of the real numbers; sequences, series, and limits. Logic, structure, style, and clarity of proofs emphasized throughout. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) a score of 64% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001 or (b) one of MATH 121, MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) a score of 64% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001 or (b) one of MATH 121, MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.

subject: MATH
title: Matrix Algebra
description: Systems of linear equations, operations on matrices, determinants, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, diagonalization of symmetric matrices. This course is intended for first and second year students. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Equivalency: MATH_V 111. Prerequisite: Either (a) one of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184, SCIE_V 001 or (b) advanced credit for MATH_V 100, or (c) SCIE_V 001 as a corequisite.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) one of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184, SCIE_V 001 or (b) advanced credit for MATH_V 100, or (c) SCIE_V 001 as a corequisite.

subject: MATH
title: Honours Linear Algebra
description: Matrices, eigenvectors, diagonalization, orthogonality, linear systems, applications. This course is intended for first and second year students. Students who obtain credit for MATH_V 223 cannot in the same or later terms obtain credit for MATH_V 111, MATH_V 152, or MATH_V 221. [3-0-0] Equivalency: MATH_V 131. Prerequisite: One of (a) one of MATH_V 120, MATH_V 121, SCIE_V 001, or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184, or (c) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 103, MATH_V 105, MATH_V 111, MATH_V 152, MATH_V 221, or (d) SCIE_V 001 as a corequisite.
prerequisite_raw: One of (a) one of MATH_V 120, MATH_V 121, SCIE_V 001, or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 110, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184, or (c) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 103, MATH_V 105, MATH_V 111, MATH_V 152, MATH_V 221, or (d) SCIE_V 001 as a corequisite.

subject: MATH
title: Advanced Calculus I
description: Functions of several variables: limits, continuity, differentiability; implicit functions; Taylor's theorem; extrema; Lagrange multipliers; multiple integration, Fubini's theorem; improper integrals. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 121 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001. Corequisite: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 121 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001. Corequisite: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

subject: MATH
title: Advanced Calculus II
description: Parametrization of curves and surfaces; line and surface integrals; theorems of Green, Gauss, Stokes; applications to physics and/or introduction to differential forms. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MATH 226. Prerequisite grade requirement: 68% in MATH226.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 226. Prerequisite grade requirement: 68% in MATH226.

subject: MATH
title: Marvels of Mathematics
description: A variety of topics in mathematics, showcasing its beauty and utility. Intended for a general audience of students whose degrees have no mathematics requirements, but who may be curious about practical and recreational mathematics. Not for credit in the Faculty of Science. Students who obtain UBC credit for any other mathematics course cannot in the same or later years obtain credit for MATH 230. [3-0-0]

subject: MATH
title: Multivariable Calculus
description: Partial and directional derivatives; maxima and minima; Lagrange multipliers and second derivative test; multiple integrals and applications. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.

subject: MATH
title: Multivariable and Vector Calculus for Mechanical Engineering
description: Partial differentiation, extreme values, multiple integration, vector fields, line and surface integrals, the divergence and Stokes' theorems; applications to fluid mechanics: buoyancy, hydrostatic force, pipe flow, drag; applications to thermodynamics: work, entropy, heat transfer; numerical methods. Emphasis on mechanical engineering applications. [3-0-1*] Prerequisite: MATH 101 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223. Corequisite: All of MECH 222, MECH 225.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 101 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223. Corequisite: All of MECH 222, MECH 225.
corequisite_raw: All of MECH 222, MECH 225.

subject: MATH
title: Ordinary Differential Equations
description: Review of linear systems; nonlinear equations and applications; phase plane analysis; Laplace transforms; numerical methods. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223. Corequisite: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223. Corequisite: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.

subject: MATH
title: Differential Equations
description: Linear ordinary differential equations, Laplace transforms, Fourier series and separation of variables for linear partial differential equations. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 103, MATH_V 105, MATH_V 121, SCIE_V 001 and one of MATH_V 152, MATH_V 221, MATH_V 223. Corequisite: One of MATH_V 200, MATH_V 217, MATH_V 226, MATH_V 253.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH_V 101, MATH_V 103, MATH_V 105, MATH_V 121, SCIE_V 001 and one of MATH_V 152, MATH_V 221, MATH_V 223. Corequisite: One of MATH_V 200, MATH_V 217, MATH_V 226, MATH_V 253.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH_V 200, MATH_V 217, MATH_V 226, MATH_V 253.

subject: MATH
title: Partial Differential Equations
description: Introduction to partial differential equations; Fourier series; the heat, wave and potential equations; boundary-value problems; numerical methods. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

subject: MATH
title: Differential Equations for Mechanical Engineering
description: First-order equations; linear equations; linear systems; Laplace transforms; trajectory analysis of plane nonlinear systems; translational and rotational vibrations; applications to RLC circuit analysis; numerical and graphical methods. Emphasis on mechanical engineering applications. [3-0-1*] Prerequisite: MATH 101 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223. Corequisite: All of MECH 221, MECH 224.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 101 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223. Corequisite: All of MECH 221, MECH 224.
corequisite_raw: All of MECH 221, MECH 224.

subject: MATH
title: Vector Calculus for Electrical Engineering
description: Divergence, gradient, curl, theorems of Gauss and Stokes. Applications to Electrostatics and Magnetostatics. MATH 264 content is strongly coupled to BMEG 220 and ELEC 211 with topics and student evaluations weighted accordingly. Prerequisite: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254. Corequisite: One of BMEG 220, ELEC 211. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254. Corequisite: One of BMEG 220, ELEC 211. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: One of BMEG 220, ELEC 211. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Complex Variables
description: Functions of a complex variable, Cauchy-Riemann equations, elementary functions, Cauchy's theorem and contour integration, Laurent series, poles and residues. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Corequisite: One of MATH 217, MATH 227, MATH 254, MATH 317.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 217, MATH 227, MATH 254, MATH 317.

subject: MATH
title: Applied Analysis
description: Integrals involving multi-valued functions, conformal mapping and applications, analytic continuation, Laplace and Fourier transforms. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 300, MATH 305. Corequisite: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 300, MATH 305. Corequisite: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Probability
description: Basic notions of probability, random variables, expectation and conditional expectation, limit theorems.  Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254. Equivalency: STAT302
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254. Equivalency: STAT302

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Stochastic Processes
description: Discrete-time Markov chains, Poisson processes, continuous time Markov chains, renewal theory. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 302, STAT 302.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 302, STAT 302.

subject: MATH
title: Applied Complex Analysis
description: Functions of a complex variable, Cauchy-Riemann equations, contour integration, Laurent series, residues, integrals of multi-valued functions, Fourier transforms. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254. Corequisite: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254. Corequisite: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.

subject: MATH
title: Applied Linear Algebra
description: Applications of linear algebra to problems in science and engineering; use of computer algebra systems for solving problems in linear algebra. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.

subject: MATH
title: Euclidean Geometry
description: Classical plane geometry, solid geometry, spherical trigonometry, polyhedra, linear and affine transformations. Linear algebra proofs are used. It is suggested that MATH 307 be taken concurrently. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121; or (b) MATH 223.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121; or (b) MATH 223.

subject: MATH
title: Topics in Geometry
description: Topics chosen by the instructor. These may include conic sections, projective configuration, convexity, non-Euclidean geometries, fractal geometry, combinatorial problems of points in the plane. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121; or (b) MATH 223.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121; or (b) MATH 223.

subject: MATH
title: Abstract Linear Algebra
description: Linear spaces, duality, linear mappings, matrices, determinant and trace, spectral theory, Euclidean structure. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Number Theory
description: Euclidean algorithm, congruences, Fermat's theorem, applications. Some diophantine equations. Distribution of the prime numbers. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… Prerequisite: One of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121. and 9 additional credits of mathematics courses.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121. and 9 additional credits of mathematics courses.

subject: MATH
title: Topics in Number Theory
description: Topics chosen by the instructor. These might include: division algorithms, group theory, continued fractions, primality testing, factoring. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . [3-0-0] Prerequisite: [MATH312]
prerequisite_raw: [MATH312]

subject: MATH
title: Elementary Differential Equations II
description: Power series methods (ordinary and regular singular points, Bessel's equation); boundary value problems and separation of variables (Fourier series and other orthogonal series), applications to the vibrating string, heat flow, potentials. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

subject: MATH
title: Calculus IV
description: Parametrizations, inverse and implicit functions, integrals with respect to length and area; grad, div, and curl, theorems of Green, Gauss, and Stokes. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 200, MATH 226, MATH 253. One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 is recommended.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 200, MATH 226, MATH 253. One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 is recommended.

subject: MATH
title: Probability with Physical Applications
description: Random variables, discrete and continuous distributions. Random walk, Markov chains, Monte Carlo methods. Characteristic functions, limit laws. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223. Corequisite: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223. Corequisite: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Real Analysis
description: Ideas and methods of real analysis and their application. Countability and topology of the reals; convergence, continuity and differentiability of functions; metric spaces. Please consult the Faculty of Science credit exclusion list: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 220 or (b) a score of 55% or higher in one of MATH 223, MATH 226.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 220 or (b) a score of 55% or higher in one of MATH 223, MATH 226.

subject: MATH
title: Real Variables I
description: The real number system; real Euclidean n-space; open, closed, compact, and connected sets; Bolzano-Weierstrass theorem; sequences and series. Continuity and uniform continuity. Differentiability and mean-value theorems. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 226 or (b) one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and a score of 80% or higher in MATH 220.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 226 or (b) one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and a score of 80% or higher in MATH 220.

subject: MATH
title: Real Variables II
description: The Riemann or Riemann-Stieltjes integrals. Sequences and series of functions, uniform convergence. Approximation of continuous functions by polynomials. Fourier series. Functions from Rm to Rn , inverse and implicit function theorems. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MATH 320.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 320.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Group Theory
description: Groups, cosets, homomorphisms, group actions, p-groups, Sylow theorems, composition series, finitely generated Abelian groups. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 223, MATH 310 or (b) one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and a score of 80% or higher in MATH 220.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 223, MATH 310 or (b) one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and a score of 80% or higher in MATH 220.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Rings and Modules
description: Rings, ideals, unique factorization, Euclidean rings, fields, polynomial rings, modules; structure theory of modules over a principal ideal domain. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MATH 322.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 322.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Abstract Algebra
description: Ideas and methods of group theory and their applications. Groups, subgroups, and cosets; homomorphisms, isomorphisms, and associated theorems. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) one of MATH_V 152, MATH_V 221, and one of MATH_V 220, MATH_V 226, CPSC_V 121, or (b) MATH_V 223
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) one of MATH_V 152, MATH_V 221, and one of MATH_V 220, MATH_V 226, CPSC_V 121, or (b) MATH_V 223

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Mathematics
description: Intensive course with required tutorial. Combinatorics, probability, geometry and elementary number theory. Not for credit in the Faculty of Science. Students who obtain credit at UBC for any other mathematics course cannot in the same or later years obtain credit for MATH 335. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-2]

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Linear Programming
description: Linear programming problems, dual problems, the simplex algorithm, solution of primal and dual problems, sensitivity analysis. Additional topics chosen from: Karmarkar's algorithm, non-linear programming, game theory, applications. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Discrete Mathematics
description: Introduction to ideas and methods of discrete mathematics and their application. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121.

subject: MATH
title: Algebra and Coding Theory
description: Error-correcting codes via abstract and linear algebra. Emphasis on proofs and computation. Finite fields, Hamming distance and error-correction, upper and lower bounds on the size of a code, linear codes, groups and cosets, encoding and decoding schemes. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121; or (b) MATH 223.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121; or (b) MATH 223.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Game Theory
description: Introduction to mathematical game theory and its applications. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121; or (b) MATH 223.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121; or (b) MATH 223.

subject: MATH
title: Applied Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos
description: Phase plane methods, bifurcation and stability theory, limit-cycle behavior and chaos for nonlinear differential equations with applications to the sciences. Assignments involve the use of computers. [3-1-0] Prerequisite: A score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
prerequisite_raw: A score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

subject: MATH
title: Engineering Analysis
description: Fourier series; auto- and cross-correlation; power spectra; discrete Fourier transform; boundary-value problems; numerical methods; partial differential equations; heat, wave, Laplace, Poisson, and wave equations. Applications to mechanical engineering and practical computing applications emphasized. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 358 or MATH 358. [3-2*-0] Prerequisite: All of MECH 224, MECH 225. Equivalency: MECH358
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH 224, MECH 225. Equivalency: MECH358
exclusion_raw: Fourier series; auto- and cross-correlation; power spectra; discrete Fourier transform; boundary-value problems; numerical methods; partial differential equations; heat, wave, Laplace, Poisson, and wave equations. Applications to mechanical engineering and practical computing applications emphasized. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 358 or MATH 358. [3-2*-0] Prerequisite: All of MECH 224, MECH 225. Equivalency: MECH358

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Mathematical Modelling
description: Construction and evaluation of deterministic, stochastic, and data-driven models. Software-assisted simulations and numerical solutions involving ordinary differential equations, stochastic processes, and basic machine learning algorithms. Examples from science, engineering, and economics. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and one of MATH 210, CPSC 203, CPSC 210 and one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and one of MATH 210, CPSC 203, CPSC 210 and one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Mathematical Biology
description: Mathematical modelling of basic biological processes in ecology, physiology, neuroscience and genetics. Dynamic behavior of difference equations, differential equations, and partial differential equations, explained with reference to concrete biological examples. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of BIOL 301, MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
prerequisite_raw: One of BIOL 301, MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

subject: MATH
title: Co-operative Work Placement I
description: Approved and supervised technical work experience involving mathematics in industry for a minimum of 3.5 months. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Mathematics Co-operative Education Program. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Co-operative Work Placement II
description: Approved and supervised technical work experience involving mathematics in industry for a minimum of 3.5 months. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Mathematics Co-operative Education Program. Prerequisite: [MATH398] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: [MATH398] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Applied Partial Differential Equations
description: Separation of variables, first order equations, Sturm-Liouville theory, integral transform methods. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 300, MATH 305 and one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 300, MATH 305 and one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.

subject: MATH
title: Green's Functions and Variational Methods
description: Green's functions for partial differential equations. Calculus of variations. Eigenfunction expansions. Rayleigh-Ritz and finite element methods. See Faculty of Science credit exclusion list: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312 or (b) MATH 400.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312 or (b) MATH 400.

subject: MATH
title: Calculus of Variations
description: Classical variational problems; necessary conditions of Euler, Weierstrass, Legendre, and Jacobi; Erdmann corner conditions, transversality, convex Lagrangians, fields of extremals, sufficient conditions for optimality, numerical methods; applications to classical mechanics, engineering and economics. Recommended pre-requisites: a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 301, MATH 320, or, a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319. [3-0-0]

subject: MATH
title: Stabilization and Optimal Control of Dynamical Systems
description: Dynamical systems; stability by Liapunov's direct method; controllability and eigenvalue assignment for autonomous linear systems; linear-quadratic regulator, time optimal control, Pontryagin maximum principle, dynamic programming; applications in engineering, economics and resource management. Recommended pre-requisites: MATH 402, and one of (a) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 301, MATH 320, or (b) a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319. [3-0-0]

subject: MATH
title: Harmonic Analysis I
description: Harmonic analysis on Euclidean spaces, with applications to number theory, partial differential equations and geometric measure theory. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MATH 300 and a score of 68% or higher in MATH 321. Corequisite: MATH 420.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 300 and a score of 68% or higher in MATH 321. Corequisite: MATH 420.
corequisite_raw: MATH 420.

subject: MATH
title: Numerical Methods for Differential Equations
description: Interpolation, numerical integration, numerical solution of ordinary and partial differential equations. Practical computational methods emphasized and basic theory developed through simple models. See Faculty of Science credit exclusion list: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.

subject: MATH
title: Variational and Approximate Methods in Applied Mathematics
description: Variational and Green's function methods for ordinary and partial differential equations, introduction to finite difference, finite element and boundary element methods. See Faculty of Science Credit exclusion list: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 307, CPSC 302 and either (a) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312 or (b) MATH 400.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 307, CPSC 302 and either (a) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312 or (b) MATH 400.

subject: MATH
title: Advanced Linear Algebra
description: Topics include decompositions of linear operators, multilinear algebra, bilinear forms, metric spaces. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: A score of 68% or higher in MATH 322 and either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 320 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319.
prerequisite_raw: A score of 68% or higher in MATH 322 and either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 320 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Demonstrations
description: Students will prepare material illustrating ideas and applications of mathematics and present it to audiences outside the University. Intended for third or fourth year Mathematics students and Math/Science Education students. [2-0-0; 1-0-0] or [3-0-0] Prerequisite: 24 credits in MATH.
prerequisite_raw: 24 credits in MATH.

subject: MATH
title: Probability
description: Probability spaces, random variables, distributions, expectation, conditional probabilities, convergence of random variables, generating and characteristic functions, weak and strong laws of large numbers, central limit theorem. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MATH 321. Prerequisite grade requirement: 68% in MATH321.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 321. Prerequisite grade requirement: 68% in MATH321.

subject: MATH
title: Stochastic Processes
description: Random walks, Markov chains, branching processes, Poisson processes, continuous time Markov chains, martingales, Brownian motion. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: [MATH418]
prerequisite_raw: [MATH418]

subject: MATH
title: Real Analysis I
description: Sigma-algebras, Lebesgue measure, Borel measures, measurable functions, integration, convergence theorems, Lp spaces, Holder and Minkowski inequalities, Lebesgue and/or Radon-Nikodym differentiation. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MATH 321. Prerequisite grade requirement: 68% in MATH321.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 321. Prerequisite grade requirement: 68% in MATH321.

subject: MATH
title: Real Analysis II
description: Banach spaces, linear operators, bounded and compact operators, strong, weak, and weak* topology. Hahn-Banach, open mapping, and closed graph theorems. Hilbert spaces, symmetric and self-adjoint operators, spectral theory for bounded operators. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: [MATH420]
prerequisite_raw: [MATH420]

subject: MATH
title: Fields and Galois Theory
description: Field extensions, the Galois correspondence, finite fields, insolvability in radicals, ruler and compass constructions, additional topics chosen by instructor. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MATH 323.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 323.

subject: MATH
title: Commutative Algebra
description: Commutative algebra; homological algebra or representation theory of finite groups. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MATH 323 and a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 412, MATH 422.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 323 and a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 412, MATH 422.

subject: MATH
title: Classical Differential Geometry
description: The differential geometry of curves and surfaces in three-dimensional Euclidean space. Mean curvature and Gaussian curvature. Geodesics. Gauss's Theorema Egregium. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 223 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 152, MATH 221; and either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 227 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 217, MATH 254, MATH 264, MATH 317.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 223 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 152, MATH 221; and either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 227 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 217, MATH 254, MATH 264, MATH 317.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Modern Differential Geometry
description: Smooth manifolds, smooth maps, immersions and submersions, vector fields, vector bundles, tangent and cotangent bundles, tensors and differential forms, orientation of manifolds, integration of forms, and selected topics. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 217, MATH 227, MATH 254, MATH 264, MATH 317 and one of MATH 319, MATH 320.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 217, MATH 227, MATH 254, MATH 264, MATH 317 and one of MATH 319, MATH 320.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Topology
description: General topology, combinatorial topology, fundamental group and covering spaces, topics chosen by the instructor. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: All of MATH 321, MATH 322. Prerequisite grade requirement: 68% in MATH322,MATH321.
prerequisite_raw: All of MATH 321, MATH 322. Prerequisite grade requirement: 68% in MATH322,MATH321.

subject: MATH
title: Topics in Topology
description: Homology theory, homotopy theory, manifolds, and other topics chosen by the instructor. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: [MATH426]
prerequisite_raw: [MATH426]

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Classical Mechanics I
description: Newton's equation, conservation laws, the Euler-Lagrange equation; Hamilton's principle of least action, Hamilton's equations, Lagrangian mechanics on manifolds. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258 and one of PHYS 216, PHYS 306, ENPH 270. Corequisite: MATH 320 (waived for students with a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319).
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258 and one of PHYS 216, PHYS 306, ENPH 270. Corequisite: MATH 320 (waived for students with a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319).
corequisite_raw: MATH 320 (waived for students with a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319).

subject: MATH
title: Number Theory
description: Divisibility, congruences, Diophantine equations, arithmetic functions, quadratic reciprocity, advanced topics. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . [3-0-0] Corequisite: One of MATH 320 (waived for students with a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319), MATH 322.
corequisite_raw: One of MATH 320 (waived for students with a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319), MATH 322.

subject: MATH
title: Complex Analysis
description: The residue theorem, the argument principle, conformal mapping, the maximum modulus principle, harmonic functions, representation of functions by integrals, series, and products. Other topics at the discretion of the instructor. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MATH 300 and either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 320 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319 and permission of the Department Head in Mathematics.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 300 and either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 320 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in MATH 319 and permission of the Department Head in Mathematics.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Modelling: Discrete Optimization Problems
description: Formulation of real-world optimization problems using techniques such as linear programming, network flows, integer programming, dynamic programming. Solution by appropriate software. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: [MATH340]
prerequisite_raw: [MATH340]

subject: MATH
title: Graphs and Networks
description: Graph theory, emphasizing trees, tree growing algorithms, and proof techniques. Other topics chosen from shortest paths, maximum flows, minimum cost flows, matchings, and graph colouring. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: 3rd year standing and one of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226 or CPSC 221.
prerequisite_raw: 3rd year standing and one of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226 or CPSC 221.

subject: MATH
title: Graph Theory
description: Introductory course in mostly non-algorithmic topics including: planarity and Kuratowski's theorem, graph colouring, graph minors, random graphs, cycles in graphs, Ramsey theory, extremal graph theory. Proofs emphasized. Intended for Honours students. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: A score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121. And 6 credits of MATH numbered 300 or above.
prerequisite_raw: A score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121. And 6 credits of MATH numbered 300 or above.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Research and Writing
description: Current research topics in pure and applied mathematics are explored at the undergraduate level. Technical communication and research skills are developed. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH_V 220, MATH_V 223, MATH_V 226, and 6 credits of MATH_V courses numbered 300 or higher.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH_V 220, MATH_V 223, MATH_V 226, and 6 credits of MATH_V courses numbered 300 or higher.

subject: MATH
title: Topics in the History of Mathematics I
description: Historical development of concepts and techniques in areas chosen from Geometry, Number Theory, Algebra, Calculus, Probability, Analysis. The focus is on historically significant writings of important contributors and on famous problems of Mathematics. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: 21 credits of MATH.
prerequisite_raw: 21 credits of MATH.

subject: MATH
title: Directed Studies in Mathematics
description: Introduction to the methods of mathematical research through an exploration of a mathematical topic under the supervision of a faculty member. Written report required. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Third- or fourth-year standing and permission of the Department Head.
prerequisite_raw: Third- or fourth-year standing and permission of the Department Head.

subject: MATH
title: Asymptotic and Perturbation Methods
description: Asymptotic expansions. Asymptotic evaluation of integrals; WKBJ methods. Regular and singular expansions. Boundary layer theory; matched asymptotic expansions. Multiple scale techniques. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: MATH 400.
prerequisite_raw: MATH 400.

subject: MATH
title: Projects in Mathematical Modelling
description: Computational methods for mathematical modelling. Numerical methods for partial differential equations, stochastic processes, and data-driven models. Includes student-directed projects on current research and applications. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) MATH 360 or (b) one of MATH 210, CPSC 203, CPSC 210 and one of MATH 345, MATH 361.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MATH 360 or (b) one of MATH 210, CPSC 203, CPSC 210 and one of MATH 345, MATH 361.

subject: MATH
title: Projects in Mathematical Biology
description: Development and analysis of mathematical models for complex systems in ecology, evolution, cell biology, neurophysiology, and other biological and medical disciplines. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of MATH 361, MATH 345.
prerequisite_raw: One of MATH 361, MATH 345.

subject: MATH
title: Co-operative Work Placement III
description: Approved and supervised technical work experience involving mathematics in industry for a minimum of 3 1/2 months. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Mathematics Co-operative Education Program. Prerequisite: [MATH399] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: [MATH399] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Co-operative Work Placement IV
description: Approved and supervised technical work experience involving mathematics in industry for a minimum of 3 1/2 months. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Mathematics Co-operative Education Program. Prerequisite: [MATH498] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: [MATH498] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
