subject: MATH
title: Continuous Time Stochastic Processes
description: Prerequisite: All of MATH 544, MATH 545. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MATH 544, MATH 545. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Optimal Control Theory
description: Optimal control of systems governed by ordinary differential equations. The control problem will be carefully stated, and existence results and necessary conditions will be established. Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman theory will be introduced. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Discrete Random Processes
description: Prerequisite: All of MATH 544, MATH 545. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MATH 544, MATH 545. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Methods of Asymptotic Analysis
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Perturbation Methods for Differential Equations
description: Prerequisite: [MATH550] Ordinary and partial differential equations (MATH 400 or equivalent). This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: [MATH550] Ordinary and partial differential equations (MATH 400 or equivalent). This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Dynamical Systems
description: Ideas, methods and applications of bifurcation theory and dynamical systems: differential and difference equations, local bifurcations, perturbation methods, chaos. Recommended pre-requisites: one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256 and one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Advanced Dynamical Systems
description: Topics from: hyperbolic invariant sets and symbolic dynamics, global bifurcations, local bifurcations for partial differential equations, multiple bifurcations, bifurcations and symmetry, applications. Prerequisite: [MATH552] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: [MATH552] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Symmetries and Differential Equations
description: Dimensional analysis, modelling, and invariance. Lie groups of transformations, infinitesimal transformations. Applications to ordinary and partial differential equations. No knowledge of group theory will be assumed. Recommended pre-requisite: elementary courses in differential equations and linear algebra. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Compressed Sensing
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Industrial Mathematical Modelling
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Linear and Nonlinear Waves
description: Classical and recent results in linear and nonlinear waves. Geometrical acoustics and kinematic waves; large amplitude waves in weakly stratified media; small amplitude waves in strongly stratified media. Dispersive waves; group velocity; applications. Recommended pre-requisites: MATH 400 and some knowledge of either fluid mechanics or elasticity. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Complex Fluids
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Biology
description: Mathematical methods in modelling biological processes, at levels from cell biochemistry to community ecology. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematics of Infectious Diseases and Immunology
description: Mathematical models for disease spread in populations. Within-host infectious disease dynamics. Models of the immune system and immune cells. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Electrophysiology
description: Formulation and analysis of models of excitable media. FitzHugh-Nagumo model, ionic models of membrane excitability (e.g., Hodgkin-Huxley), calcium excitability, bursting phenomena. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Modelling of Cell-Scale Biology
description: Concepts and techniques for modelling cellular and subcellular dynamics in biological systems. Topics may include complex biochemical systems, biopolymers in cell motility and division, continuum mechanics, and membrane dynamics. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Evolutionary Dynamics
description: Mathematical models of evolution and evolutionary game theory. Stochastic dynamics in finite populations, dynamics in spatially structured populations, and adaptive dynamics. Applications include the origin of species and the problem of cooperation. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Theory of Optimal Transportation
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Nonlinear Wave Equations
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: M.Sc. Major Essay
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Graduate Seminar in Applied Mathematics
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematics Teaching Techniques
description: [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MATH
title: Doctoral Dissertation
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MDIA
title: AI and Media Creation
description: Investigation of media objects shaped by algorithms, through a balance of foundational concepts and hands-on experimentation. Examines perspectives on aesthetics, the impact of technology on media, and ethics.

subject: MDIA
title: Media Communities
description: Media engagement with community partners through data, narrative and visual processes. Prerequisite: Restricted to BMS students with 1st year standing.
prerequisite_raw: Restricted to BMS students with 1st year standing.

subject: MDIA
title: Collaborative Methods
description: Development and practice of media group production processes. Restricted to BMS students with 2nd year standing or above.

subject: MDIA
title: Approaches to Writing for Media Studies
description: Interdisciplinary perspectives of thematic topics in contemporary media and related theory with focused attention on writing practices. Restricted to BMS students with 3rd year standing.

subject: MDIA
title: Media Environments
description: Collaborative planning and activation of media interfaces for stakeholders informed by multidisciplinary approaches. Prerequisite: MDIA_V 290. Restricted to BMS students with 3rd year standing or higher.
prerequisite_raw: MDIA_V 290. Restricted to BMS students with 3rd year standing or higher.

subject: MDIA
title: Capstone Media Projects
description: Advanced media works created in collaboration with community partners for public impact. Prerequisite: MDIA_V 350. Restricted to BMS students with 4th year standing.
prerequisite_raw: MDIA_V 350. Restricted to BMS students with 4th year standing.

subject: MDIA
title: Emerging Media Practitioners
description: The roles and responsibilities of media producers as agents of transformation, with a focus on the student's own media decisions and artefacts. Prerequisite: MDIA_V 350. Restricted to BMS students with 4th year standing.
prerequisite_raw: MDIA_V 350. Restricted to BMS students with 4th year standing.

subject: MDVL
title: Introduction to Medieval Studies
description: A survey of the study of the medieval period in Western Europe (400-1550), integrating history, literature, and the arts; topics vary from year to year; interested students should consult the Medieval Studies Advisor.

subject: MDVL
title: European Literature from the 5th to the 14th Century
description: Selected works from the 5th to the 14th centuries in their cultural and social contexts. Recommended pre-requisites: Third-year standing or above in the Faculty of Arts. Credit will be granted for only one of RMST_V 321 or MDVL_V 301. Equivalency: RMST_V 321.
exclusion_raw: Selected works from the 5th to the 14th centuries in their cultural and social contexts. Recommended pre-requisites: Third-year standing or above in the Faculty of Arts. Credit will be granted for only one of RMST_V 321 or MDVL_V 301. Equivalency: RMST_V 321.

subject: MDVL
title: European Literature from the 14th to the 16th Century
description: Selected works of the Late Middle Ages and Renaissance in their cultural and social contexts. Recommended pre-requisites: Third-year standing or above in the Faculty of Arts.

subject: MECH
title: Technical Skills Practicum
description: Engineering graphics, spatial visualization, CAD, equation solvers, machine shop practice, electronic circuit construction and troubleshooting, elements of engineering science. [1-3-3] Prerequisite: All of APSC 160, MATH 101, MATH 152, PHYS 158, PHYS 170 and one of BMEG 102, PHYS 159 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. Corequisite: MECH 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of APSC 160, MATH 101, MATH 152, PHYS 158, PHYS 170 and one of BMEG 102, PHYS 159 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. Corequisite: MECH 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MECH 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Engineering Science I
description: Rigid body kinetics and kinematics, basic electrical circuits, work and power, stress and strain, torsion, bending, engineering materials, probability and statistics. This course includes the content of ELEC 203. [11-2-1] Prerequisite: All of MATH 101, MATH 152, PHYS 158, PHYS 170 and one of BMEG 102, PHYS 159 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. Corequisite: All of MECH 220, MECH 224. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MATH 101, MATH 152, PHYS 158, PHYS 170 and one of BMEG 102, PHYS 159 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. Corequisite: All of MECH 220, MECH 224. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of MECH 220, MECH 224. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Engineering Science II
description: Fluid properties, equations of state. Pressure, buoyancy, hydrostatic forces. Conservation of mass, momentum, and energy. Work and heat; internal energy and enthalpy. Bernoulli's equation. Dimensional analysis, modelling. Turbulent flow in pipes; turbomachinery. Second law and the Carnot cycle; entropy; first and second law analysis of systems. [5-2-1] Prerequisite: MECH 220. Corequisite: MECH 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 220. Corequisite: MECH 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MECH 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Introduction to the Mechanical Design Process
description: Design methodology, synthesis and analysis. Design projects representing both mechanical mechanism design and thermofluid systems. [3-8-0] Prerequisite: MECH 220. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 220. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Integration of Engineering Concepts I
description: Integration of the theory and practice of Mechanical Engineering to illustrate the commonality and conceptual connectivity of seemingly different technical areas. Emphasis on dynamics, solid mechanics, materials, electronics, and mathematics. [1-0-1] Corequisite: MECH 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MECH 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Integration of Engineering Concepts II
description: Integration of the theory and practice of Mechanical Engineering to illustrate the commonality and conceptual connectivity of seemingly different technical areas. Emphasis on thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and mathematics. [1-0-1] Corequisite: MECH 222. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MECH 222. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Technical Communication for Mechanical Engineers
description: Written and oral communication. Preparation of design reports, business correspondence, verbal, online, and visual presentation of technical material. Restricted to students in the second year of Mechanical Engineering. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 226 or MECH_V 227. [1-0-1;1-0-1] Prerequisite: A score of 65% or higher in one of ENGL_V 112, WRDS_V 150, APSC_V 176. Corequisite: All of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 221, MECH_V 222, MECH_V 223, MECH_V 224, MECH_V 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: A score of 65% or higher in one of ENGL_V 112, WRDS_V 150, APSC_V 176. Corequisite: All of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 221, MECH_V 222, MECH_V 223, MECH_V 224, MECH_V 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 221, MECH_V 222, MECH_V 223, MECH_V 224, MECH_V 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Written and oral communication. Preparation of design reports, business correspondence, verbal, online, and visual presentation of technical material. Restricted to students in the second year of Mechanical Engineering. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 226 or MECH_V 227. [1-0-1;1-0-1] Prerequisite: A score of 65% or higher in one of ENGL_V 112, WRDS_V 150, APSC_V 176. Corequisite: All of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 221, MECH_V 222, MECH_V 223, MECH_V 224, MECH_V 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Approaches to Technical Communication for Mechanical Engineers
description: Written and oral communication. Preparation of design, business correspondence, verbal, online and visual presentation of technical material. Focus on the linguistic structure and style of technical communication. Restricted to students in Mechanical Engineering. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 226 or MECH 227. [3-0-4] Prerequisite: MECH 220 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 220 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Written and oral communication. Preparation of design, business correspondence, verbal, online and visual presentation of technical material. Focus on the linguistic structure and style of technical communication. Restricted to students in Mechanical Engineering. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 226 or MECH 227. [3-0-4] Prerequisite: MECH 220 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Technical Skills Practicum I
description: Engineering graphics, spatial visualization, CAD, equation solvers, elements of engineering science. [1-1-1] Prerequisite: All of APSC 160, MATH 101, MATH 152, PHYS 158, PHYS 170 and one of APSC 100, APSC 150, APSC 151 and one of BMEG 102, PHYS 159 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. Corequisite: MECH 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of APSC 160, MATH 101, MATH 152, PHYS 158, PHYS 170 and one of APSC 100, APSC 150, APSC 151 and one of BMEG 102, PHYS 159 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. Corequisite: MECH 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MECH 221. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Technical Skills Practicum II
description: Machine shop practice, electronic circuit construction and troubleshooting. [0-2-2] Prerequisite: MECH 230. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 230. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Introduction to the Mechanical Design Process I
description: Introduction to design methodology, synthesis and analysis. [2-0-0] Prerequisite: All of APSC 160, MATH 101, MATH 152, PHYS 158, PHYS 170 and one of APSC 100, APSC 150, APSC 151 and one of BMEG 102, PHYS 159 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. Corequisite: MECH 221.
prerequisite_raw: All of APSC 160, MATH 101, MATH 152, PHYS 158, PHYS 170 and one of APSC 100, APSC 150, APSC 151 and one of BMEG 102, PHYS 159 and one of APSC 176, ENGL 112, WRDS 150. Corequisite: MECH 221.
corequisite_raw: MECH 221.

subject: MECH
title: Introduction to the Mechanical Design Process II
description: Intermediate design methodology, synthesis and analysis. Design project representing mechanical mechanism design and thermofluid systems. [1-8-0] Prerequisite: MECH 232.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 232.

subject: MECH
title: Technical Skills Practicum IIA
description: Electronic circuit construction and troubleshooting. [0-1-1] Prerequisite: MECH 230. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 230. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Technical Skills Practicum IIB
description: Machine shop practice. [0-1-1] Prerequisite: MECH 234. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 234. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Introduction to Mechanics of Materials
description: Statically determinate frames and trusses; normal and shear stresses and strains; shear force and bending moment diagrams; theory of beam bending, torsion of circular rods; transformation of stress and strain in two and three dimensions, Mohr's circle; yield and ultimate failure criteria. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) all of MATH 101, PHYS 170 or (b) all of APSC 172, APSC 173, APSC 180. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) all of MATH 101, PHYS 170 or (b) all of APSC 172, APSC 173, APSC 180. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Introduction to Fluid Mechanics
description: Fluid properties; statics; kinematics, dynamics, energy, and momentum principles for control volumes; dimensional analysis and similarity; laminar and turbulent flow; pipe flow; principles of centrifugal pumps. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: All of MATH 152, PHYS 170 and one of MATH 217, MATH 253; and either (a) PHYS 131 and one of PHYS 108, PHYS 118; or (b) PHYS 153 or (c) all of PHYS 157, PHYS 158, PHYS 159. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MATH 152, PHYS 170 and one of MATH 217, MATH 253; and either (a) PHYS 131 and one of PHYS 108, PHYS 118; or (b) PHYS 153 or (c) all of PHYS 157, PHYS 158, PHYS 159. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Data Analysis and Mechanical Engineering Laboratories
description: The use of probability and statistical methods for engineering applications. Mechanics of materials, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics. Instrumentation, data acquisition, and data manipulation using modern computational tools. [3-5-1*] Prerequisite: All of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 223, MECH_V 224, MECH_ 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 223, MECH_V 224, MECH_ 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Data Analysis and Mechatronics Laboratories
description: The use of probability and statistical methods for engineering applications. Mechanics of materials and heat transfer. Instrumentation, data acquisition, and data manipulation using modern computational tools. Common mechanical devices. For students in the Mechatronics Option only. [3-3*-1*] Prerequisite: All of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 223, MECH_V 224, MECH_V 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 223, MECH_V 224, MECH_V 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Machine Design
description: Selection of flexible drives, bearings, fluid power system components, and couplings. Design of shafts, bolted joints and power screws. Design and selection of gears, gear trains, and mechanisms. Recommended co-requisite: MECH 360. [3-0-3] Prerequisite: One of MECH 223, MECH 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MECH 223, MECH 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Thermodynamics II
description: Air standard and vapor cycles; first and second law of cycles. Exergy. Gas mixtures. Energy conservation. Equilibrium. Reacting systems. Application to thermofluid systems such as power plants. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Mechanical Engineering Design Project
description: Applying the design process, making educated assumptions and decisions, and working in teams to provide a new mechanical design. Weekly lecture discussing product development and various factors affecting the design. [1-4-1] Prerequisite: MECH 223. (And third year standing in Mechanical Engineering) This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 223. (And third year standing in Mechanical Engineering) This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Materials for Mechanical Design
description: Selection of material properties for mechanical design. Metals and alloys, ceramics, polymers, composites and other hybrid materials. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 224 or (b) all of APSC 278, MECH 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MECH 224 or (b) all of APSC 278, MECH 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Engineering Analysis
description: Fourier series; auto- and cross-correlation; power spectra; discrete Fourier transform; boundary-value problems; numerical methods; partial differential equations; heat, wave, Laplace, Poisson, and wave equations. Applications to mechanical engineering and practical computing emphasized. [3-1-0] Prerequisite: All of MECH 224, MECH 225. Equivalency: MATH358 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH 224, MECH 225. Equivalency: MATH358 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Computational Methods for Mechanical Engineering
description: Computational methods for solving mechanical engineering problems. Numerical computation of linear and nonlinear algebraic equations; interpolation and extrapolation; numerical integration and differentiation; numerical solution of differential equations. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 358 or MECH 359. [3-1-1] Prerequisite: All of MECH 224, MECH 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH 224, MECH 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Computational methods for solving mechanical engineering problems. Numerical computation of linear and nonlinear algebraic equations; interpolation and extrapolation; numerical integration and differentiation; numerical solution of differential equations. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 358 or MECH 359. [3-1-1] Prerequisite: All of MECH 224, MECH 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Mechanics of Materials
description: Beam deflections, singularity functions; use of tabulated solutions; column buckling; Castigliano's theorem, statically indeterminate beams, bending of beams with asymmetric cross-sections, shear centre; principal stresses and stress invariants in three dimensions. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: One of MECH 224, MECH 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MECH 224, MECH 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Modelling of Mechatronic Systems
description: Modelling of mechanical, electrical, thermal, fluid elements and mixed mechatronic systems. Signal processing, signal conditioning. Sensors, data acquisition systems, actuators. [2-2-0] Prerequisite: All of MECH 220, MECH 223, MECH 224, MECH 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH 220, MECH 223, MECH 224, MECH 225. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Engineering Measurements and Instrumentation
description: Industrial measurement needs including: architecture of electronic instrumentation systems; electrical representation of physical quantities; sensors and actuators; analog signal processing using linear and non-linear circuits; computer-based readout including programming for user-interface and data acquisition. [2-3-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) two of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 224, ELEC_V 203 or (b) all of MANU_V 230, ELEC_V 203. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) two of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 224, ELEC_V 203 or (b) all of MANU_V 230, ELEC_V 203. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Heat Transfer
description: Steady and transient conduction. Radiation heat transfer. Convective heat and mass transfer in pipes and from external surfaces. Design of heat exchangers. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257, PHYS 203 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257, PHYS 203 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Fluid Dynamics
description: Review of principles, compressible flow, potential flow, simple laminar viscous flow, boundary layers, flow around bluff bodies. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH_V 225 or (b) one of MATH_V 255 or MATH_V 256 and one of CHBE_V 251, CIVL_V 215, MECH_V 280 and one of CHBE_V 241, ENPH_V 257, PHYS_V 203. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MECH_V 225 or (b) one of MATH_V 255 or MATH_V 256 and one of CHBE_V 251, CIVL_V 215, MECH_V 280 and one of CHBE_V 241, ENPH_V 257, PHYS_V 203. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Industrial Fluid Mechanics
description: Analysis of piping networks. Review of pumps, turbines and hydraulic motors. Flow measurement devices such as flow meters and transducers for measuring velocity and pressure. Multiphase flows. Introduction to turbulence, mixing and buoyancy driven flows. [3-1-0] Prerequisite: MECH 380. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 380. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Manufacturing Processes
description: Manufacturing characteristics of materials and their control. Metal forming processes, plastic deformations, rolling, forging, drawing, extrusion, sheet metal forming. Machining processes and machine tools, turning, milling, drilling, grinding. Metal fabrication, welding and casting. An introduction to process planning. [2-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Professionalism and Ethics in Engineering
description: Professionalism, ethical frameworks, decolonization, equity, diversity, inclusion, law. Obligations of the engineer. [2-0-3] Prerequisite: Fourth-year standing in B.A.Sc. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Fourth-year standing in B.A.Sc. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Air Pollution, Technology and Society
description: Causes and effects of air pollution in the context of technology and society. Topics include: impact of air pollutants on air quality and climate, atmospheric science, public policy, collective action, environmental justice, science communication, economic externalities, and ethical engineering design. Recommended pre-requisite: third-year standing. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Second-year standing. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Second-year standing. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Engineering in Society and Technological Stewardship
description: Societal influences that affect engineering activities, including interactions between engineering and the economic, health, safety, legal, and cultural aspects of society; uncertainties in the prediction of such interactions; industrial policy; sustainable development; entrepreneurship; and environmental and technological stewardship. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Sensors and Actuators
description: Measurement of motion, stress, force, torque, temperature, flow and pressure; principles of sensors and signal conditioning methods; selection and sizing of actuators. [ 2-2*- 1] Prerequisite: All of MECH_V 360, MECH_V 463, MECH_V 366, ELEC_V 343. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH_V 360, MECH_V 463, MECH_V 366, ELEC_V 343. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Mechatronics System Instrumentation
description: Architecture of mechatronics devices; integration of mechanical, electronics, sensors, actuators, computer and real time software systems; PLC and PC based systems; discrete and continuous automation system design. [2-2-2] Prerequisite: MECH 366. Corequisite: MECH 420. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 366. Corequisite: MECH 420. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MECH 420. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Introduction to Microelectromechanical Systems
description: Fundamentals of MEMS (MicroElectroMechanical Systems). Microfabrication of MEMS with solid-state technology. LIGA and micro injection molding. Physics of MEMS. Operational principles of various MEMS devices. [3-1-0] Prerequisite: One of MECH 224, ELEC 204 and all of MECH 360, MECH 368. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MECH 224, ELEC 204 and all of MECH 360, MECH 368. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Mechatronic Product Design
description: Design of mechatronic systems for industrial and human-centric applications compliant structures; electronic circuits to interface with sensors and actuators; embedded systems; precision timing and control; data acquisition and processing; user interfaces; and product innovation. [1-3-4] Prerequisite: All of MECH_V 366, ELEC_V 302, CPEN_V 312. and 4th year standing. Corequisite: CPEN_V 333, MECH_V 421. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH_V 366, ELEC_V 302, CPEN_V 312. and 4th year standing. Corequisite: CPEN_V 333, MECH_V 421. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: CPEN_V 333, MECH_V 421. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Mechanical Design
description: Design of shafts and welded joints. Fatigue and fracture considerations in design: failure types, failure under static and dynamic loading, fatigue failure, crack initiation, and propagation. Introduction to the FEM in mechanical design. Students can only receive credit for one of MECH 326 or MECH 426. [2-0-3] Prerequisite: One of MECH 223, MECH 260. Corequisite: MECH 360.
prerequisite_raw: One of MECH 223, MECH 260. Corequisite: MECH 360.
corequisite_raw: MECH 360.

subject: MECH
title: Engineering Data Analysis
description: The use of probability and statistical methods for engineering applications. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Engineering Economics
description: Discounted cash flows. Sources of funds, cost of capital. Effects of depreciation, taxes, inflation. Evaluation and comparison of economic models for engineering projects. Replacement decisions. Public project analysis. Risk analysis. Project control, inventory analysis, simulation. Recommended pre-requisite: third-year standing. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Biofluids
description: Review of principles, Navier-Stokes equations, biorheology, circulatory biofluid mechanics, synovial fluid in joints, biofluid dynamics of the human brain, respiratory biofluid mechanics, flow and pressure measurement techniques in human body. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 433 or MECH 533. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of MATH 255, MATH 256 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. Equivalency: MECH533 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of MATH 255, MATH 256 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. Equivalency: MECH533 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Review of principles, Navier-Stokes equations, biorheology, circulatory biofluid mechanics, synovial fluid in joints, biofluid dynamics of the human brain, respiratory biofluid mechanics, flow and pressure measurement techniques in human body. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 433 or MECH 533. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of MATH 255, MATH 256 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. Equivalency: MECH533 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Orthopaedic Biomechanics
description: Musculoskeletal anatomy. Muscle and joint loads. Muscle mechanics. Musculoskeletal dynamics. Gait. Tissue mechanics of tendon, ligament, articular cartilage, and bone. Biomaterials. Application examples in orthopaedics including joint replacement and fracture fixation. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 435 or MECH 535. Students who have received credit for BMEG 230 or 330 cannot also receive credit for MECH 435. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 221 or (b) all of APSC 278, MECH 260. Equivalency: MECH535 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MECH 221 or (b) all of APSC 278, MECH 260. Equivalency: MECH535 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Musculoskeletal anatomy. Muscle and joint loads. Muscle mechanics. Musculoskeletal dynamics. Gait. Tissue mechanics of tendon, ligament, articular cartilage, and bone. Biomaterials. Application examples in orthopaedics including joint replacement and fracture fixation. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 435 or MECH 535. Students who have received credit for BMEG 230 or 330 cannot also receive credit for MECH 435. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 221 or (b) all of APSC 278, MECH 260. Equivalency: MECH535 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Fundamentals of Injury Biomechanics
description: Introduction to injury biomechanics. Anatomy. Impact experiments. Multi-body dynamic simulation and finite element analysis. Skull, face, brain, spine, eye, pelvis, abdomen, and extremity injury. Anthropomorphic test devices, seat belts, airbags, child restraints, and helmets. Recommended pre-requisites: MECH 224, or all of MECH 260 and BMEG 330. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 436 or MECH 536. [3-0-1] Equivalency: MECH536 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Introduction to injury biomechanics. Anatomy. Impact experiments. Multi-body dynamic simulation and finite element analysis. Skull, face, brain, spine, eye, pelvis, abdomen, and extremity injury. Anthropomorphic test devices, seat belts, airbags, child restraints, and helmets. Recommended pre-requisites: MECH 224, or all of MECH 260 and BMEG 330. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 436 or MECH 536. [3-0-1] Equivalency: MECH536 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Biomechanics Research
description: Seminar in Biomechanics research. [1-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Fuel Cell Systems
description: Energy system architecture and electrochemical energy conversion: fuel cell thermodynamics and electrochemistry; Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cells (PMFCs) and Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCSs); hydrogen production, storage, and distribution. Recommended pre-requisites: MECH 327 and MECH 375. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 445 or MECH 577. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. Equivalency: MECH577 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. Equivalency: MECH577 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Energy system architecture and electrochemical energy conversion: fuel cell thermodynamics and electrochemistry; Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cells (PMFCs) and Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCSs); hydrogen production, storage, and distribution. Recommended pre-requisites: MECH 327 and MECH 375. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 445 or MECH 577. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. Equivalency: MECH577 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Aerospace Capstone Design Project
description: A capstone course to provide students experience in the design/development of practical mechanical and aerospace devices. Projects are provided by local industry and engineering research laboratories. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 453, MECH 454, MECH 455, MECH 456, MECH 457, MECH 458, MECH 459, MECH 490. [1-2-2; 1-2-2] Prerequisite: All of MECH 327, MECH 328, MECH 360, MECH 426. and fourth-year standing in the Aerospace Option. Equivalency: MECH 453, MECH 454, MECH 455, MECH 456, MECH 457, MECH 458, MECH 459. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH 327, MECH 328, MECH 360, MECH 426. and fourth-year standing in the Aerospace Option. Equivalency: MECH 453, MECH 454, MECH 455, MECH 456, MECH 457, MECH 458, MECH 459. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: A capstone course to provide students experience in the design/development of practical mechanical and aerospace devices. subject: MECH
title: Biomechanics and Medical Devices Capstone Design Project
description: A capstone design program designed to give students experience in the design and development of practical biomedical devices. Projects are provided by local industry and engineering research laboratories. For students in the Biomechanics and Medical Devices Option only. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 453, MECH_V 454, MECH_V 455, MECH_V 456, MECH_V 457, MECH_V 458, MECH_V 459, or MECH_V 490. [1-2-2; 1-2- 2-] Prerequisite: All of MECH_V 325, MECH_V 328, MECH_V 360 and fourth-year standing in the Biomechanics and Medical Devices Option. Equivalency: MECH_V 453, MECH_V 454, MECH_V 455, MECH_V 456, MECH_V 457, MECH_V 458, MECH_V 459. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH_V 325, MECH_V 328, MECH_V 360 and fourth-year standing in the Biomechanics and Medical Devices Option. Equivalency: MECH_V 453, MECH_V 454, MECH_V 455, MECH_V 456, MECH_V 457, MECH_V 458, MECH_V 459. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: A capstone design program designed to give students experience in the design and development of practical biomedical devices. Projects are provided by local industry and engineering research laboratories. For students in the Biomechanics and Medical Devices Option only. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 453, MECH_V 454, MECH_V 455, MECH_V 456, MECH_V 457, MECH_V 458, MECH_V 459, or MECH_V 490. [1-2-2; 1-2- 2-] Prerequisite: All of MECH_V 325, MECH_V 328, MECH_V 360 and fourth-year standing in the Biomechanics and Medical Devices Option. Equivalency: MECH_V 453, MECH_V 454, MECH_V 455, MECH_V 456, MECH_V 457, MECH_V 458, MECH_V 459. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Advanced Mechanics of Materials
description: Mechanics of rubber, tissue, and gels at large viscoelastic deformation; large plastic deformations and damage of materials; mechanical characterization of materials (property extraction from mechanical tests); selected problems in linear elasticity. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: MECH_V 360 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH_V 360 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Finite Element Analysis
description: Theory and element selection. Virtual work and weighted residual formulation. Linear elastic analysis. Heat transfer analysis. Isoparametric elements. Development of computer programs for simple problems. Utilization of existing computer packages. Application to mechanical engineering problems. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 462 or MECH_V 514. [2-3*-0] Prerequisite: MECH_V 360 Equivalency: MECH_V 514 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH_V 360 Equivalency: MECH_V 514 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Theory and element selection. Virtual work and weighted residual formulation. Linear elastic analysis. Heat transfer analysis. Isoparametric elements. Development of computer programs for simple problems. Utilization of existing computer packages. Application to mechanical engineering problems. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 462 or MECH_V 514. [2-3*-0] Prerequisite: MECH_V 360 Equivalency: MECH_V 514 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Mechanical Vibrations
description: Theory of vibration of mechanical systems. Undamped 1 degree of freedom vibration, forced vibrations and resonance, damping, multiple degree of freedom systems, mode shapes and orthogonality, continuous systems, vibration measuring instruments and frequency spectrum analysis. [3-2*-1] Prerequisite: One of MECH 224, MECH 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MECH 224, MECH 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Industrial Robotics
description: Definition and classification of industrial robotic devices. Selection and implementation issues. Workcell environments. Forward and inverse kinematics, dynamics, trajectory planning. Sensing and manipulation tasks. Control architectures. Recommended co-requisite: MECH 466 or MECH 467. Credit will be granted for only one of ELEC 442, EECE 571R, EECE 589, MECH 464 or MECH 563. [3-0-1] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Definition and classification of industrial robotic devices. Selection and implementation issues. Workcell environments. Forward and inverse kinematics, dynamics, trajectory planning. Sensing and manipulation tasks. Control architectures. Recommended co-requisite: MECH 466 or MECH 467. Credit will be granted for only one of ELEC 442, EECE 571R, EECE 589, MECH 464 or MECH 563. [3-0-1] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Automatic Control
description: Process and system characteristics; transient response; the closed loop; block diagrams and transfer functions; control actions; stability; Nyquist diagrams; Bode diagrams; root locus methods; frequency response; system compensation; nonlinear control systems; digital computer control. Laboratory experiments to support the lecture content. Recommended prerequisite: MECH_V 463. Credit cannot be obtained for both MECH_V 466 and MECH_V 467. [3-2*-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) all of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 221 or (b) MATH_V 255 and one of ELEC_V 201, ELEC_V 202, ELEC_V 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) all of MECH_V 220, MECH_V 221 or (b) MATH_V 255 and one of ELEC_V 201, ELEC_V 202, ELEC_V 204. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Computer Control of Mechatronics Systems
description: Block diagrams and transfer functions, continuous and discrete domain transformations, feedback control system characteristics, control design in both continuous and discrete domain, absolute and relative stability, laboratory examples of Mechatronic systems design. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 467 or MECH 541. Credit cannot be obtained for both MECH 466 and MECH 467. [3-2*-2] Prerequisite: One of MECH 366, MANU 386. Equivalency: MECH541 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MECH 366, MANU 386. Equivalency: MECH541 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Block diagrams and transfer functions, continuous and discrete domain transformations, feedback control system characteristics, control design in both continuous and discrete domain, absolute and relative stability, laboratory examples of Mechatronic systems design. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 467 or MECH 541. Credit cannot be obtained for both MECH 466 and MECH 467. [3-2*-2] Prerequisite: One of MECH 366, MANU 386. Equivalency: MECH541 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Modern Control Engineering
description: Introduction to state space control methods for linear systems including modal control, controllability, observability, linear quadratic regulators, optimal control. Recommended co-requisite: MECH 366 or MECH 466. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 468 or MECH 509. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Introduction to state space control methods for linear systems including modal control, controllability, observability, linear quadratic regulators, optimal control. Recommended co-requisite: MECH 366 or MECH 466. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 468 or MECH 509. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Dynamic System Modelling
description: Modelling of mechanical, electrical, fluid, and thermal systems; analytical models; model representations such as linear and bond graphs; response analysis; digital simulation. Recommended pre-requisite: third-year standing. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Energy Conversion Systems
description: Energy supply and demand. Energy conversion chain. Electrical power generation using thermal power plants, renewable energy, and fuel cells. Rankine cycle steam power. Brayton cycle gas turbine power plants, intercooling, reheat, and regeneration. Internal combustion engines. Exhaust gas after treatment. Combined and binary cycles. Nuclear power. Recommended pre-requisites: All of MECH 327, MECH 375. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: An Introduction to Pulp and Papermaking
description: Overview of pulp and paper operations. Conversion of wood to fibre through mechanical or chemical pulping, processing of recycled fibre, the papermaking process and paper converting operations. Contemporary developments. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Heating, Ventilating and Air Conditioning
description: Principles of air conditioning; psychometrics and refrigeration. Heat transfer through building materials. Estimation of heating and cooling loads including the use of current software. System design. Ground, air and water source heat pumps. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: MECH 375. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 375. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Aerospace Propulsion
description: Cycle analysis of jet engines, thermodynamic cycles, mechanics and thermodynamics of combustion, components and the performance characteristics of chemical rockets. The detailed analysis of operating characteristics of turbojet, turbofan, turboprop, afterburning, and ramjet propulsion systems. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: All of MECH 327, MECH 375, MECH 380. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH 327, MECH 375, MECH 380. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Internal Combustion Engines
description: Analysis of spark and compression ignition engines. Calculation of fuel economy, power, and emission. Practical and regulatory considerations in engine design. Engine emission and control systems. Recommended pre-requisite: MECH 327. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 478 or MECH 578. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. Equivalency: MECH578 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. Equivalency: MECH578 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Analysis of spark and compression ignition engines. Calculation of fuel economy, power, and emission. Practical and regulatory considerations in engine design. Engine emission and control systems. Recommended pre-requisite: MECH 327. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 478 or MECH 578. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280. Equivalency: MECH578 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Introduction to Computational Fluid Dynamics
description: Techniques for numerical solution of ordinary and partial differential equations, including an introduction to the finite difference, finite volume and finite element approaches. Simulation of laminar and turbulent flows, including common turbulent models. Validation techniques. Recommended pre-requisite: MECH 380. [3-1-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Aerodynamics of Aircraft
description: Analysis of airfoils and wings. Potential flow, thin airfoil theory, lifting line analysis of wings. Predicting viscous drag. Numerical methods for analysis and design of airfoils and wings. Subsonic, transonic, supersonic, and hypersonic flow. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 481 or MECH_V 581. [3-1*-0] Prerequisite: MECH_V 380 Equivalency: MECH_V 581 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH_V 380 Equivalency: MECH_V 581 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Analysis of airfoils and wings. Potential flow, thin airfoil theory, lifting line analysis of wings. Predicting viscous drag. Numerical methods for analysis and design of airfoils and wings. Subsonic, transonic, supersonic, and hypersonic flow. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 481 or MECH_V 581. [3-1*-0] Prerequisite: MECH_V 380 Equivalency: MECH_V 581 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Aircraft Stability and Control
description: Aircraft performance, stability and control, loading and air worthiness. Detailed example. [2-0-2] Corequisite: MECH_V 481. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MECH_V 481. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Aircraft Design: Structures
description: Structural components of aircraft, introduction to the finite element method, bending and buckling of thin plates. Design of aircraft wing and fuselage structures, moments of inertia for complex shapes. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: One of MECH 224, MECH 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MECH 224, MECH 260. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Introduction to Ship Design
description: This course introduces the ship design process from a Systems Engineering point of view. Topics include ship operational requirements, space and weight estimation, parametric design, optimization techniques, and the impacts of ship design on economics and the environment. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 486 or NAME_V 581. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH_V 380 or (b) CIVL_V 315. Corequisite: All of MECH_V 488, CIVL_V 435. Equivalency: NAME_V 581 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Either (a) MECH_V 380 or (b) CIVL_V 315. Corequisite: All of MECH_V 488, CIVL_V 435. Equivalency: NAME_V 581 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of MECH_V 488, CIVL_V 435. Equivalency: NAME_V 581 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: This course introduces the ship design process from a Systems Engineering point of view. Topics include ship operational requirements, space and weight estimation, parametric design, optimization techniques, and the impacts of ship design on economics and the environment. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 486 or NAME_V 581. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Either (a) MECH_V 380 or (b) CIVL_V 315. Corequisite: All of MECH_V 488, CIVL_V 435. Equivalency: NAME_V 581 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Introduction to Ship Hydrodynamics
description: Ship terminology, lines plans, ship hydrostatics, transverse and longitudinal stability of ships, dimensional analysis, ship resistance prediction; ship propulsion methods, propeller selection and design. Recommended prerequisites: One of MECH 380 or CIVL 315, or enrollment in the NAME MEng or NAME MEL program. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Experimental Thermofluids
description: Experimental uncertainty. Design of experiments. Test facilities. Temperature and pressure measurement techniques and instrumentation. Velocity and flow rate measurement techniques. Flow visualization. Case studies of industrial and research experimental practice. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 489 or MECH 582. [3-2-0] Prerequisite: All of MECH 375, MECH 380. Equivalency: MECH582 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of MECH 375, MECH 380. Equivalency: MECH582 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Experimental uncertainty. Design of experiments. Test facilities. Temperature and pressure measurement techniques and instrumentation. Velocity and flow rate measurement techniques. Flow visualization. Case studies of industrial and research experimental practice. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 489 or MECH 582. [3-2-0] Prerequisite: All of MECH 375, MECH 380. Equivalency: MECH582 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Interdisciplinary Capstone Design Project
description: An extension to projects in the New Venture Design Program that introduces additional technical design principles and requirements. Registration for this program is only permitted for Mechanical Engineering students who are in the New Venture Design Program. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 453, MECH_V 454, MECH_V 455, MECH_V 456, MECH_V 457, MECH_V 458, MECH_V 459, or MECH_V 490. [1-0-1]; [1-0-1] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: An extension to projects in the New Venture Design Program that introduces additional technical design principles and requirements. Registration for this program is only permitted for Mechanical Engineering students who are in the New Venture Design Program. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 453, MECH_V 454, MECH_V 455, MECH_V 456, MECH_V 457, MECH_V 458, MECH_V 459, or MECH_V 490. [1-0-1]; [1-0-1] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Computer-Aided Manufacturing
description: NC programming and machining with interactive CAD/CAM systems. Curve and surface geometry for tool-path generation. Tool-path generation methodologies. Geometric modelling techniques for simulation and verification of manufacturing processes. Introduction to Computer-Aided Process Planning. Supplementary tutorial laboratory experiments. Recommended co-requisites: MECH 392 or MANU 380. [2-2-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Introduction to Academic Research
description: Research project directed by a faculty member in Mechanical Engineering. [0-5-1] Prerequisite: Fourth-year standing and at least 80% average in third-year courses and permission of instructor. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Fourth-year standing and at least 80% average in third-year courses and permission of instructor. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Industrial Engineering
description: Organizational structure. Manufacturing systems and group technology. Classification and coding. Scheduling and sequencing of operations. Forecasting. Quality control for variables and attributes. Plant location. System reliability analysis. Advanced manufacturing automation concepts. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Engineering Management
description: Organization structures. Management styles. Cost systems and control. Financial statements; accounting procedures. Budgets and performance control. Project management. Human resources management. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Research Skills and Data Analysis
description: Research environment, funding and dissemination systems; literature reviews and critically evaluating papers; creating research questions; research ethics, data security and research records; equity, diversity, and inclusion in research. Recommended pre-requisite: Third-year standing. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Research Communication
description: Scholarly writing and communication in engineering. Standard research genres such as journal articles, conference posters, and grant proposals. Students will write on the topic of their CREATE-U research. [2-0-2] Prerequisite: MECH 497. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 497. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Thermodynamics
description: Thermodynamic principles, Maxwell relations, availability, irreversibility, and equilibrium. Introduction to statistical mechanics. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Fluid Mechanics
description: Governing equations; viscous incompressible flow, incompressible potential flow; incompressible boundary layers, stability and turbulence; compressible potential flow. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Linear Elasticity
description: Stress and strain in three dimensions, fundamental field equations of linear elasticity; equilibrium, compatibility, Hooke's law; Papkovitch-Neuber solution, plane stress and plane strain; torsion, torsion of thin-walled members with warping restraint; plate theory. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Linear Vibrations
description: Transient and steady state vibration analysis of continuous and discrete mechanical systems. Lagrange's equation and Hamilton's Principle. Measurement of vibration. Machinery health monitoring. Frequency domain analysis. Experimental modal analysis. Vibration of rotating machinery. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Analytical Dynamics
description: Newtonian mechanics; generalized co-ordinates and analytical mechanics; Lagrange equations; Hamilton's Principle; rotational motion and rigid body dynamics; Gyroscopic motion; phase space, equilibrium, and stability of motion; stability characteristics of autonomous systems; Hamilton-Jacobi method; applications. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Controls
description: State space model; stability; controlability; observability; Kalman decomposition; state feedback; observer; linear quadratic regulator; Kalman filter. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 468 or 509. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: State space model; stability; controlability; observability; Kalman decomposition; state feedback; observer; linear quadratic regulator; Kalman filter. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 468 or 509. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Experimental Methods in Mechanics
description: Operating principles of transducers for measuring typical quantities; the construction of transducers and factors controlling their measurement accuracy; electronic signal conditioning equipment and computerized data acquisition system. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Linear FEA in Solids and Heat Transfer
description: Theory and element selection. Virtual work and weighted residual formulation. Linear elastic analysis. Heat transfer analysis. Isoparametic elements. Computer program development. Utilization of existing computer packages. Credit will only be granted for one of MECH 514 or MECH 462. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Theory and element selection. Virtual work and weighted residual formulation. Linear elastic analysis. Heat transfer analysis. Isoparametic elements. Computer program development. Utilization of existing computer packages. Credit will only be granted for one of MECH 514 or MECH 462. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Control Sensors and Actuators
description: Review of control, instrumentation and design. Performance specification of control components, component matching, error analysis. Operating principles, analysis, modelling, design considerations of control sensors and actuators such as analog sensors for motion measurement, digital transducers, stepper motors, DC motors, induction motors, synchronous motors, and hydraulic actuators. Control techniques pertaining to actuators. Applications. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Fundamentals of Microelectromechanical Systems
description: Micro-fabrication of MEMS: solid-state technology and other micromachining techniques. Engineering principles of various MEMS devices. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Software Development for Mechatronic Systems
description: Equivalency: EECE524 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Instrumentation for Mechatronic Systems
description: Equivalency: EECE525 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Modelling of Dynamic Systems
description: Advanced modelling of mechanical, electrical, fluid, thermal and multi-domain systems; inter-domain analogies; analytical models in time and frequency domains; modelling tools; response analysis; digital simulation; practical project. Recommended pre-requisite: prior undergraduate coursework in dynamics, vibration, or electrical circuits. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Biofluids
description: Principles, biorheology, circulatory biofluid mechanics, synovial fluid in joints, biofluid dynamics of the human brain, respiratory biofluid mechanics, flow and pressure measurement techniques in the human body. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 433 or 533. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Principles, biorheology, circulatory biofluid mechanics, synovial fluid in joints, biofluid dynamics of the human brain, respiratory biofluid mechanics, flow and pressure measurement techniques in the human body. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 433 or 533. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Orthopaedic Biomechanics
description: Musculoskeletal anatomy. Static and dynamic analysis of the musculoskeletal system. Gait. Musculoskeletal tissue mechanics. Biomaterials. Advanced study of relevant problems in orthopaedics, including joint replacement, fracture fixation, and spinal disorders. Credit will only be granted for one of MECH 435 or MECH 535. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Musculoskeletal anatomy. Static and dynamic analysis of the musculoskeletal system. Gait. Musculoskeletal tissue mechanics. Biomaterials. Advanced study of relevant problems in orthopaedics, including joint replacement, fracture fixation, and spinal disorders. Credit will only be granted for one of MECH 435 or MECH 535. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Fundamentals of Injury Biomechanics
description: Introduction to injury biomechanics. Anatomy. Impact experiments. Multi-body dynamic simulation and finite element analysis. Skull, face, brain, eye, pelvis, abdomen, and extremity injury. Anthropomorphic test devices, seat belts, airbags, child restraints, and helmets. Credit will only be granted for one of MECH 436 or MECH 536. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Introduction to injury biomechanics. Anatomy. Impact experiments. Multi-body dynamic simulation and finite element analysis. Skull, face, brain, eye, pelvis, abdomen, and extremity injury. Anthropomorphic test devices, seat belts, airbags, child restraints, and helmets. Credit will only be granted for one of MECH 436 or MECH 536. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Computer Control of Multi-Axis Machines
description: Digital control laws for servo drives; state space and transfer function models of feed drives; tracking errors; trajectory generation of multi-axis machines; contouring analysis of multi-axes servo drives; real time linear and circular interpolation methods supported by laboratory applications. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 467 or MECH 541. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Digital control laws for servo drives; state space and transfer function models of feed drives; tracking errors; trajectory generation of multi-axis machines; contouring analysis of multi-axes servo drives; real time linear and circular interpolation methods supported by laboratory applications. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 467 or MECH 541. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: CAD/CAM Principles and Practice
description: 3D geometric modelling; parametric representation of curves and surfaces; CNC machine tool programming; milling operations and setup; tool path generation for three- and five-axis sculptured surface machining. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Machine Tool Structures and Vibrations
description: Review of metal cutting mechanics, milling, static deformations of machine tools. Machine tool vibrations, forced and self-excited vibrations in machining, chatter, stability. Sensors for machine tool monitoring and adaptive control. Sensor assisted intelligent machining techniques. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Research Writing
description: Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 498 or MECH 556. Equivalency: MECH 500X, MECH 500A, MECH 550U This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 498 or MECH 556. Equivalency: MECH 500X, MECH 500A, MECH 550U This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Research Skills for Engineers
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Professional Responsibility for Engineers
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Engineering Project Management
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Multivariable Feedback Control
description: Well-posedness and internal stability of feedback systems, performance limitations, uncertainty, LFT representations, robust stability and robust performance, model reduction, linear matrix inequalities, H- infinity control, multi-objective control, mu-analysis and synthesis, H-infinity gain- scheduling, control applications. Recommended prerequisite: MECH 466, MECH 468, ELEC 341 or equivalent. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 562, EECE 508, or ELEC 572. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Well-posedness and internal stability of feedback systems, performance limitations, uncertainty, LFT representations, robust stability and robust performance, model reduction, linear matrix inequalities, H- infinity control, multi-objective control, mu-analysis and synthesis, H-infinity gain- scheduling, control applications. Recommended prerequisite: MECH 466, MECH 468, ELEC 341 or equivalent. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 562, EECE 508, or ELEC 572. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Robotics: Kinematics, Dynamics and Control
description: Definitions and classification Kinematics: homogeneous transformations, manipulator kinematic equations, forward and inverse kinematic solution methods, differential kinematic equations, motion trajectories. Dynamics: Lagrange-Euler formulations, Newton-Euler formulation. Control: methods, robot control hierarchy, control of single joint and multiple link manipulators, advanced control methods. Credit will be granted for only one of ELEC 442, EECE 571R, EECE 589, MECH 464, or MECH 563. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Definitions and classification Kinematics: homogeneous transformations, manipulator kinematic equations, forward and inverse kinematic solution methods, differential kinematic equations, motion trajectories. Dynamics: Lagrange-Euler formulations, Newton-Euler formulation. Control: methods, robot control hierarchy, control of single joint and multiple link manipulators, advanced control methods. Credit will be granted for only one of ELEC 442, EECE 571R, EECE 589, MECH 464, or MECH 563. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Convection Heat Transfer
description: Governing equations for laminar and turbulent flow. Forced convection in internal and external flow. Free, and combined free and forced convection. Heat transfer at high velocities, in rarefied gases and in two-phase flow. Mass transfer. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Combustion
description: Thermodynamics of combustion, stoichiometry, heat of formation and reaction. Equilibrium composition and adiabatic flame temperature. Chemical kinetics of combustion. Flames in premixed gases; laminar and turbulent flame propagation. Diffusion flames, pollutant emissions and combustion in IC engines. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Fuel Cell Systems
description: Energy system architecture and electrochemical energy conversion; fuel cell thermodynamics and electrochemistry; Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cells (PMFCs) and Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCSs); hydrogen production, storage, and distribution. Credit will only be granted for one of MECH 445 or MECH 577. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Energy system architecture and electrochemical energy conversion; fuel cell thermodynamics and electrochemistry; Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cells (PMFCs) and Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCSs); hydrogen production, storage, and distribution. Credit will only be granted for one of MECH 445 or MECH 577. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Internal Combustion Engines
description: Analysis of spark and compression ignition engines. Calculation of fuel economy, power and emission. Practical and regulatory considerations in engine design. Numerical engine modelling and analysis. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 478 or MECH 578. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Analysis of spark and compression ignition engines. Calculation of fuel economy, power and emission. Practical and regulatory considerations in engine design. Numerical engine modelling and analysis. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 478 or MECH 578. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Aerodynamics of Aircraft
description: Analysis of airfoils and wings. Potential flow, thin airfoil theory, lifting line analysis of wings. Predicting viscous drag. Numerical methods for analysis and design of airfoils and wings. Subsonic, transonic, supersonic, and hypersonic flow. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 581 or MECH_V 481. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Analysis of airfoils and wings. Potential flow, thin airfoil theory, lifting line analysis of wings. Predicting viscous drag. Numerical methods for analysis and design of airfoils and wings. Subsonic, transonic, supersonic, and hypersonic flow. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH_V 581 or MECH_V 481. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Experimental Fluid Mechanics
description: Modelling Test facilities. Wind tunnel force measurement. Theory of conventional and modern manometry. Classical velocimetry. Hotwire anemometry. Theory and application of laser Doppler velocimetry. Particle image velocimetry. Flow visualization techniques. Thermometry. Credit will only be granted for one of MECH 489 or MECH 582. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Modelling Test facilities. Wind tunnel force measurement. Theory of conventional and modern manometry. Classical velocimetry. Hotwire anemometry. Theory and application of laser Doppler velocimetry. Particle image velocimetry. Flow visualization techniques. Thermometry. Credit will only be granted for one of MECH 489 or MECH 582. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Turbulent Shear Flow
description: The basic equations of fluid motion; introduction to hydro-dynamic stability; Reynolds' equations; energy equations for turbulent motion; intermittency; similarity near a solid boundary and in free turbulence; approximate methods for predicting the growth of turbulent boundary layers and free symmetrical shear flows. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Computational Fluid Dynamics
description: Analytical, computational, and experimental methods in fluid mechanics. Overview of CFD program development. Finite volume methods, spacial discretization and spatial accuracy analysis. Boundary conditions. Time advance methods, time accuracy, and stability. Application to model problems and to the incompressible laminar Navier-Stokes equations. Validation techniques for CFD codes. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Advanced Topics in Computational Fluid Dynamics
description: Selected advanced topics in CFD, typically chosen from: Finite volume methods on curvilinear meshes and structured mesh generation. Finite volume methods on unstructured meshes. Multigrid methods for elliptic PDE's. Reynolds-averaged form of the Navier-Stokes equations and turbulence modelling. Three-dimensional flows. Compressible flows. Prerequisite: One of MECH 510, MECH 587. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MECH 510, MECH 587. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Seminar
description: Current topics in mechanical engineering for doctoral students. Pass/Fail. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MECH
title: Doctoral Dissertation
description: Pass/Fail This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MEDD
title: Foundations of Medical Practice I
description: Integrating foundational and clinical sciences and clinical practice themes. Case-based approach fostering the development of evidence-based clinical reasoning and clinical skills. Organized on the basis of clinical presentations. Pass/fail. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MEDD
title: Foundations of Medical Practice II
description: Increasingly complex clinical presentations through integration of foundational and clinical sciences and clinical practice themes. Developmental, case-based approach fostering the development of evidence-based clinical reasoning and clinical skills. Pass/fail. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MEDD
title: Foundations of Scholarship and Flexible Enhanced Learning I
description: Various medically-related learning experiences and scholarly activities. Emphasizes social accountability, introduces scholarly methods, and fosters innovation, creativity, and critical thought to prepare graduates for roles as scholars, lifelong learners, and leaders. Pass/fail. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MEDD
title: Foundations of Medical Practice III
description: Increasingly complex clinical presentations integrating foundational sciences and clinical practice themes. Developmental, case-based approach fostering the development of evidence-based clinical reasoning and clinical skills. Pass/Fail. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MEDD
title: Foundations of Medical Practice IV and Transition into Clinical Education
description: Prepares students to transition from classroom-based to clinical learning environments. Increasingly complex clinical presentations integrating foundational sciences and clinical practice themes. Prepares students for clinical practice in Year 3 Clerkship. Pass/Fail. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MEDD
title: Flexible Enhanced Learning II
description: Opportunity to build on scholarly activities initiated in MEDD_V 419, or start new ones. Emphasizes social accountability and fosters innovation, creativity, and critical thought to prepare graduates for roles as scholars, lifelong learners, and leaders. Pass/Fail.
