prerequisite_raw: Completion of second year in a biology program.

subject: MRNE
title: Biology of Marine Birds
description: Study of interrelationship of birds and the marine environment. Census techniques and observation of birds in the field will be emphasized. Prerequisite: Completion of a course in vertebrate zoology or permission of the instructor.
prerequisite_raw: Completion of a course in vertebrate zoology or permission of the instructor.

subject: MRNE
title: Biology of Marine Mammals
description: Survey course covering systematics and distribution of marine mammals, their sensory capabilities and physiology, with special emphasis on the Cetacea. The course will involve an independent field study. Prerequisite: Introductory vertebrate zoology.
prerequisite_raw: Introductory vertebrate zoology.

subject: MRNE
title: Seminars and Papers in Marine Science
description: Instruction in the critical analysis of published research papers and of oral seminars. [2-2-0] Prerequisite: Completion of second year in a biology program.
prerequisite_raw: Completion of second year in a biology program.

subject: MRNE
title: Special Topics
description: 6 weeks. Offered, as opportunities arise, by distinguished scientists who are visiting at the Bamfield Marine Sciences Centre. The course will be of a specialized nature. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MRNE
title: Special Topics
description: 3 weeks. Offered, as opportunities arise, by distinguished scientists who are visiting at the Bamfield Marine Sciences Centre. The course will be of a specialized nature. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Technical Communication
description: Written and oral communication in business correspondence, engineering design methods, report preparation, and oral presentations of technical material. Restricted to students in second year of the Materials Engineering Program. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of APSC_V 176, ENGL_V 110, ENGL_V 111, ENGL_V 112, ENGL_V 120, ENGL_V 121, WRDS_V 150. Equivalency: APSC_V 201. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of APSC_V 176, ENGL_V 110, ENGL_V 111, ENGL_V 112, ENGL_V 120, ENGL_V 121, WRDS_V 150. Equivalency: APSC_V 201. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Thermodynamics of Materials I
description: Heat and mass balances applied to materials engineering; thermodynamic principles applied to materials processing: heat of reaction, free energy, activity, phase equilibrium, reactions involving gases, Ellingham diagrams. [3-0-2]

subject: MTRL
title: Thermodynamics of Materials II
description: Behaviour of solutions, phase diagrams, electrochemistry, chemical potential and free energy diagrams applied to materials processing and thermodynamic modelling. [3-0-2] Prerequisite: MTRL 250.
prerequisite_raw: MTRL 250.

subject: MTRL
title: Transport Phenomena I - Fluid Mechanics
description: Fluid statics; fluid mechanics; laminar and turbulent flow; equations of continuity and motion; boundary layers; flow in conduits and packed and fluidized beds; flow measurements. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Transport Phenomena II - Heat Transport
description: Conduction, forced and natural convection, and radiation. Heat transfer with fluid flow, applications of heat exchange, and solidification of castings. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Materials in Design
description: The process of materials selection for different design criteria; the importance of shape and processing variables; the use of computer software in the selection process. [2-0-3] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Management of Engineering Design
description: Fundamental communication and inter- personal skills, as well as operational processes, that engineers require to effectively work in design teams. Concepts and best practices around project management tools and techniques, team dynamics, planning, and organization. [1-0-2] Prerequisite: MTRL_V 201. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MTRL_V 201. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Manufacturing in Materials Engineering
description: Manufacturing processes from a materials perspective; metal casting, heat treating processes, forming processes, machining, and joining. Role of manufacturing in microstructure and material properties development and on component performance. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Hydrometallurgy I
description: Aqueous extraction of metals from ores and concentrates. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Hydrometallurgy I Laboratory
description: Laboratory exercises on aqueous extraction of metals from ores and concentrates. [0-3*-0] Corequisite: MTRL 358. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: MTRL 358. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Modelling of Materials Processes
description: Mathematical and physical modelling of processes employed in the production of materials. The application of models to analyze, design and improve materials production. [3-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Transport Phenomena III - Mass Transport
description: Mass transfer fundamentals, gas interdiffusivity, Sievert's law, Fick's laws, solid-state diffusion, steady and non-steady state diffusion, mass transfer in quiescence fluids. The application examples are related to metallurgical processes, green technologies, and the semiconductor industry. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Mechanical Behaviour of Materials
description: Polycrystalline and single crystal deformation; dislocation theory; strengthening mechanisms; fracture mechanics; fatigue; high temperature deformation mechanisms. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Phase Transformations
description: Solidification and solid state transformations; nucleation and growth processes; segregation and structure in castings; phase changes in steel; transformation diagrams; diffusion equations. [3-0-2*]

subject: MTRL
title: Structure and Properties Laboratory
description: Structure and properties of ferrous and non-ferrous metals; heat treatment; hardenability; metallography; age hardening. [0-3*-0] Corequisite: All of MTRL 365, MTRL 378. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of MTRL 365, MTRL 378. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Polymers
description: The structure and properties of polymeric materials and reinforced polymers with emphasis on their engineering properties and applications. [3-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Aerospace Materials and Manufacturing
description: Advanced materials and manufacturing in the framework of aerospace requirements and regulations, with a focus on processing of materials, including advanced metals and polymer composites, to produce aerospace structures and engine components. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Microstructural Analysis Laboratory
description: Basic principles and techniques of microstructural analysis with particular reference to engineered materials including x-ray, SEM microprobe TEM and high energy electron analysis. [1-3*-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Economic Aspects of Materials Engineering
description: Time value of money, cash flows, capital and operating cost estimation, financial decision making and relevant case studies. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Environmental Degradation of Materials
description: Fundamental aspects of environmental degradation of metals (corrosion), ceramics, and polymers, with an emphasis on aqueous environments. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Hydrometallurgy II
description: Leaching, purification, precipitation, regeneration; thermodynamics and kinetics of separation steps; electrochemical applications. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Monitoring and Optimization of Materials Processing
description: Measurement systems for materials processing and evaluation, methods of data collection and analysis in materials engineering, materials processing monitoring and control, design of experiments for materials processing and optimization. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Engineering Project I
description: Design projects to illustrate the full spectrum of design encountered in Metals and Materials Engineering including the design of components, structures and processes used to manufacture materials. [1-0-5] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Engineering Project II
description: Design projects to illustrate the full spectrum of design encountered in Metals and Materials Engineering including the design of components, structures and processes used to manufacture materials. [1-0-5] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Casting Technology
description: Various casting technologies related to the automotive and aerospace sectors will be covered, including upstream liquid metal processing. [2-0-2]

subject: MTRL
title: Welding and Joining of Materials
description: Case studies addressing temperature modelling in welding and joining, material selection for welds and joints, calculation of properties for welds and joints, mechanical analysis of joints, and design of welding and joining procedures. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Microstructure Engineering
description: Follows the production of metallurgical products, focusing on process design models used to describe solidification, recrystallization, and precipitation. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Electronic Materials
description: Semiconductor materials, MOSFET structure, operation and applications in digital circuits, fabrication techniques, basic mask and fabrication flow design and semiconductor fabrication process theories at an entry level. [3-0-0]

subject: MTRL
title: Materials for Aerostructures and Engines
description: Engineering theory of aerospace structural material mix: metal alloys, ceramics, and polymer composites. Material requirements for weight-, damage tolerant-, cost efficient-design. Overview of material characterization, including fracture and fatigue. Statistical variability, material allowables, structural certification. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Failure of Materials
description: Failure by excess deformation, fracture, fatigue, and environmental effects. Failure theories and case studies of engineering failures. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Nondestructive Evaluation
description: Principles of test methods; inspection techniques and equipment; quantitative flaw evaluation; reliability analysis. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Composite Materials
description: Understanding the properties and the mechanical behaviour of composite materials with emphasis on analysis, design, and manufacturing. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Biomaterials
description: Engineered materials in medical applications with an emphasis on material properties, functionality, design, and material response in the biological environment. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Materials Sustainability
description: Concepts of life cycle analysis, circular economy and critical materials. Project-based introduction to key concepts, calculations, and design. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Materials Engineering Undergraduate Thesis
description: Materials-related academic research. Projects will be defined within materials engineering, involving design, experimental, and/or simulation work, as selected from topics provided by faculty members. Restricted to students with fourth year class standing. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Material Optimization for the Manufacture of Structural Metallic Components
description: Phase transformations and strengthening of advanced engineering alloys (e.g. steels, aluminum, magnesium and titanium alloys) with particular emphasis on structure-property development relevant to the latest materials manufacturing technologies. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Advanced Simulation and Modelling Tools for Materials Manufacturing
description: Mathematical modelling of manufacturing processes; Computer Aided Engineering tools; application examples will be drawn from a range of manufacturing operations. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Case Studies in Advanced Materials Manufacturing
description: The full spectrum of design encountered including the design of components, structures and processes used to manufacture materials. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Separation Science in Aqueous Metal Processing
description: The theory of solvent extraction and ion exchange, membrane separations, chemical precipitation, electrochemical separations and other techniques for aqueous metal processing, applications from the metal processing literature. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Corrosion
description: Modern theories relating to corrosion and corrosion protection of metals. Thermodynamic and kinetic phenomena, corrosion measurements, inhibition and passivation, design for corrosive environments, stress corrosion cracking theory. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Advanced Hydrometallurgy
description: Advanced thermochemical modelling of hydrometallurgical unit operations to include extraction, separation, and recovery of base metals. Application to flow-sheet analysis. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Finite Elements in Heat Transfer
description: Application of the finite element method to heat transfer and solidification; steady state and transient heat conduction; latent heat evolution and radiation. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Hydrometallurgical Reactor Design and Analysis
description: Batch leaching kinetics, leaching mechanisms; statistical methods for design of multiparticle continuous leaching reactors; coupled heat and mass balances, mixing phenomena, redox and precipitation reactions, complex mineralogical feeds; heap and dump leaching. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Deformation of Crystalline Materials
description: Nature and properties of lattice imperfections; dislocation theory and its use to describe work hardening, creep, structure of grain boundaries and other phenomena. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Advanced Phase Transformations
description: Thermodynamic and kinetic bases for the theory of phase transformations in the condensed state. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Microstructural Evolution of Deformed Materials
description: Physical mechanisms of microstructure evolution; structure, energy and mobilities of grain boundaries, grain boundary segregation, precipitation, recovery, recrystallization, grain growth; microstructure engineering of steels. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Physics of Microfabrication: Front End Processing
description: Practical aspects, physical models, and simulations of Si-based nanofabrication processes such as oxidation, diffusion, ion implantation, chemical vapor deposition, etching, stress techniques. Semiconductor device physic basics will also be discussed. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Topics in Fracture Mechanics
description: The equations and concepts of linear elastic fracture mechanics. Fracture toughness testing, statistical theories of fracture and proof testing, stress corrosion cracking and static fatigue. Acoustic emission and other nondestructive testing methods. Case studies of large scale fractures of pressure vessels and structures. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Electrochemical Science, Engineering and Technology
description: Electrochemical interfaces; electrode reactions; thermodynamics; kinetics and transport processes in electrochemical systems; experimental techniques. Electrochemical reactors and processes; modelling, design and economics. Electrochemical technologies; electrosynthesis, batteries and fuel cells. Electro-metallurgy; electrowinning and refining of metals, corrosion, leaching and cementation. Equivalency: CHBE577, MMAT588 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Advanced Composite Materials
description: Processing and properties of advanced polymer based composite materials with emphasis on analysis, design, and manufacturing. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Advanced Biomaterials
description: Formation and structure-function relations of biological materials, the interaction of tissue-synthetic biomaterials, advanced biomaterials design, biomimetic processing, and current progress in drug delivery systems and biomedical devices. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: M.Sc. Thesis
description: For M.Sc. Degree. Research studies in materials engineering. Honours/Pass/Fail. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: M.Eng. Project
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Seminar
description: Presentation and discussion of current topics in metals and materials research. A required course for graduate students in metals and materials which carries no academic credit. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: M.A.Sc. Thesis
description: For M.A.Sc. Degree. Research studies in materials engineering. Honours/Pass/Fail. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MTRL
title: Doctoral Dissertation
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Principles of Musical Form
description: Explain rhythmic, melodic, textural, and harmonic materials and processes of music, and how they create small-scale structures. Fluency with music notation advised. B.Mus. and B.A. Music students with a strong background in music theory may test into MUSC_V 101.

subject: MUSC
title: Diatonic Harmony and Voice Leading
description: Harmonic and linear functions of diatonic chords; common progressions and sequences; introduction to tonal hierarchy and prolongation; simple modulation. Compositional and analytical exercises. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 100, MUSC 110.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 100, MUSC 110.

subject: MUSC
title: Introduction to the Theory of Music
description: Concepts of rhythm, pitch, timbre, and texture. Notation and aural recognition of rhythmic and pitch patterns. Basic principles of melody and form. Background in Western music theory or notation unnecessary. This course is inapplicable to the B.Mus. or B.A. Music.

subject: MUSC
title: Introduction to Diatonic Harmony
description: Triads, key and elementary harmony in Western music. Elements of musical form. Aural training and exercises in composition, modeled on historical styles. Not for credit in the B.Mus. Prerequisite: [MUSC103] or permission of the instructor.
prerequisite_raw: [MUSC103] or permission of the instructor.

subject: MUSC
title: Aural Skills I
description: Sight singing; melodic and harmonic dictation; rhythm production; error detection; tuning; perception of harmony, form, and tonality; improvisation in set idioms. Restricted to B.Mus. students. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Aural Skills II
description: Continuation of MUSC_V 105. Restricted to B.Mus. students. Prerequisite: a score of 68% or higher in MUSC_V 105. Students may register for MUSC_V 106 prior to meeting the pre-requisite but will be required to withdraw if the pre-requisite is not met by the first day of class. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: a score of 68% or higher in MUSC_V 105. Students may register for MUSC_V 106 prior to meeting the pre-requisite but will be required to withdraw if the pre-requisite is not met by the first day of class. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Introduction to Contemporary Art Music
description: Contemporary music repertoire, emphasizing music from the past fifty years. Required of undergraduate Composition majors; open to other Bachelor of Music students by permission of instructor. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Class Brasses and Percussion
description: Group instruction in music performance. Restricted to B.Mus. students.

subject: MUSC
title: Introduction to Music Technology
description: Practical and theoretical training in technologies that support current artistic and academic practice, such as MIDI, podcasts/videocasts, websites, social media, and software for score notation, music education, and basic audio/video editing. [2-0-1]

subject: MUSC
title: History of Music I
description: An overview of Western music from antiquity through the Middle Ages and Renaissance, providing a framework for understanding musical styles and practices, and examining selected compositions in greater analytical and historical depth.

subject: MUSC
title: History of Music II
description: The development of Western music from circa 1600 to circa 1800. Prerequisite: MUSC 120. Or permission of the instructor
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 120. Or permission of the instructor

subject: MUSC
title: Class Woodwinds
description: Group instruction in music performance. Restricted to B.Mus. students.

subject: MUSC
title: Music and Human Experience
description: A multi-disciplinary survey of music in selected world traditions and genres, connecting it to ideas of time, evolution, history, anthropology, philosophy, and contemporary globalised culture.

subject: MUSC
title: Class Voice
description: Group instruction in music performance. Required of all first-time secondary voice students. Restricted to B.Mus. students.

subject: MUSC
title: Opera Repertoire I
description: A musico-dramatic study and analysis of representative works in the international operatic theatre from 1600 to the present, through musical, literary and graphic sources. Each sequential year of study, the student is expected to show increased facility in musical and dramatic analysis as well as a greater understanding of the works under examination. Open to students outside the B.Mus. program by permission of the instructor.

subject: MUSC
title: Class Piano I
description: Required of all first-time secondary piano students.

subject: MUSC
title: Collaborative Piano I
description: Skills and performance practice with primary emphasis on voice/piano partnership principles and repertoire. Strong sight-reading skills essential. For Piano majors; open to others by audition.

subject: MUSC
title: Piano Chamber Ensembles (Lower Years)
description: Open to students by audition, with credit, as stipulated by their faculties. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Introduction to Piano Chamber Music
description: A survey of repertoire and performance issues.

subject: MUSC
title: Lyric Diction
description: A study of the basic phonetics and accepted principles of lyric diction of the four languages most commonly used in concert and operatic repertoire: French, German, Italian, and English.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Secondary)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Secondary)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Concentration)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Concentration)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

title: Music Performance (Concentration)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Major)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Major)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Major)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

subject: MUSC
title: Chromatic Harmony and Voice Leading
description: Harmonic and linear functions of common chromatic chords; mixture; chords and progressions of linear origin; tonal plans. Compositional and analytical exercises. Prerequisite: [MUSC101]
prerequisite_raw: [MUSC101]

subject: MUSC
title: Musical Forms
description: Study of various forms in tonal music and the rhythmic, melodic, textural, and harmonic processes that create them on small and large scales. Compositional and analytical exercises. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 111, MUSC 200.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 111, MUSC 200.

subject: MUSC
title: History of Music III
description: The development of Western music from circa 1800 to circa 1900. Prerequisite: All of MUSC 121, MUSC 100.
prerequisite_raw: All of MUSC 121, MUSC 100.

subject: MUSC
title: History of Music IV
description: The development of Western music from circa 1900; an introduction to jazz and popular music and to music of selected non-Western societies. Prerequisite: All of MUSC 220, MUSC 100.
prerequisite_raw: All of MUSC 220, MUSC 100.

subject: MUSC
title: Opera Repertoire II
description: See MUSC 135.

subject: MUSC
title: Class Piano II
description: Continuation of MUSC_V 141.

subject: MUSC
title: Collaborative Piano II
description: Further development of skills and performance practice with primary emphasis on voice/piano partnership principles and repertoire. Strong sight-reading skills essential. For Piano majors; open to others by audition. Prerequisite: [MUSC149]
prerequisite_raw: [MUSC149]

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Secondary)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Secondary)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Concentration)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Concentration)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Concentration)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Major)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Major)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Major)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 171, MUSC 172, MUSC 181, MUSC 182, MUSC 183, MUSC 191, MUSC 192, MUSC 193.

subject: MUSC
title: Compositional and Analytical Approaches to Post-Tonal Music
description: Concepts essential to understanding and performing art music, since 1900, in which functional triadic harmony is absent or subsidiary to other musical processes. Detailed consideration of works of major composers up to the present, through analysis, composition, and musicianship exercises. Prerequisite: MUSC 200.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 200.

subject: MUSC
title: Instrumentation
description: The study of string, woodwind, brass and percussion instruments; orchestral sections and scoring for various small ensembles. Activities include demonstrations of instruments, scoring projects, analysis and listening. For credit towards the B.Mus. and the B.A. in Music; not open to other students. Prerequisite: MUSC 200. and completion of the second-year piano requirement.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 200. and completion of the second-year piano requirement.

subject: MUSC
title: Orchestration
description: The study of orchestration through the analysis of orchestral works, listening and scoring projects. Activities also include choral arranging and scoring for stage band and wind ensemble. Prerequisite: [MUSC309]
prerequisite_raw: [MUSC309]

subject: MUSC
title: Fundamentals of Conducting
description: Basic conducting techniques: patterns, cueing, dynamic shading, and physical presentation. Prerequisite: MUSC_V 200 and completion of the second-year piano requirement.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC_V 200 and completion of the second-year piano requirement.

subject: MUSC
title: Instrumental Conducting
description: The relation of conducting gestures to instrumental sound; development of practical skills in directing ensembles and reading scores, considering instruments' special characteristics. Prerequisite: MUSC_V 311.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC_V 311.

subject: MUSC
title: Choral Conducting
description: The relation of conducting gestures to choral sound; development of practical skills in directing ensembles and reading scores; attendant issues of vocal technique and pedagogy. Prerequisite: MUSC_V 311.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC_V 311.

subject: MUSC
title: Computer Music
description: The study of computer applications to music, focusing on digital synthesis techniques and languages, methods of algorithmic composition, and the design of music editors. Prerequisite: [MUSC319] or permission of instructor.
prerequisite_raw: [MUSC319] or permission of instructor.

subject: MUSC
title: Topics in Western Music
description: Study in one major genre of Western music (e.g., The Symphony, Women in Opera, History of the Song Cycle). No musical knowledge is required. Not for credit toward the B.Mus. or B.A. in Music.

subject: MUSC
title: History of Popular Music
description: Genres of popular music from 1950 to the present and their changing aesthetic, social, cultural, and historical dimensions. Prior experience with music notation and terminology is not required. This course is not acceptable for credit toward the B.Mus., or toward the B.A. major, honours, or minor in Music.

subject: MUSC
title: Cantonese Music
description: A history of musical genres with Cantonese lyrics from the nineteenth century to the present. Topics include music and text relationships, major singers, major genres (narrative songs, Cantonese opera, Cantopop). Credit will be granted for only one of MUSC_V 327 or ASIA_V 335. Equivalency: ASIA_V 335.
exclusion_raw: A history of musical genres with Cantonese lyrics from the nineteenth century to the present. Topics include music and text relationships, major singers, major genres (narrative songs, Cantonese opera, Cantopop). Credit will be granted for only one of MUSC_V 327 or ASIA_V 335. Equivalency: ASIA_V 335.

subject: MUSC
title: Music in Vancouver's Ethnic Communities
description: Examination of music within the ethnic context as found in the urban environment of Vancouver. The musics of several traditions (e.g., Chinese, Jewish, English folk) will be studied together with the social issues surrounding their preservation. For credit toward the B.Mus. and the B.A. in Music, but open to students not majoring in music.

subject: MUSC
title: Workshop in World Rhythm
description: Theory and practice of selected rhythmic systems of world music cultures, focusing on West African drumming, and including other systems such as Indian Tala and Peking opera percussion. Prerequisite: MUSC 200.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 200.

subject: MUSC
title: Accompanying on the Harpsichord I
description: Basic techniques and styles of continuo playing. Open to keyboard players with no previous harpsichord experience.

subject: MUSC
title: Opera Theatre Techniques I
description: Performance techniques associated with the musical theatre of various historical periods. Basic dance. Most operatic excerpts will be in English.

subject: MUSC
title: Piano Pedagogy I: Theory and Studio Management
description: Basic principles of teaching piano. Business aspects of establishing and maintaining a music studio. For Piano Performance majors; open to other Bachelor of Music students by permission of the instructor.

subject: MUSC
title: Aesthetics and Practice of Film Music

subject: MUSC
title: Keyboard Harmony and Transposition
description: Designed for the keyboard performance major and keyboard concentrator in General Studies.

subject: MUSC
title: History of Medieval Music
description: Sacred and secular music, vocal and instrumental. Prerequisite: All of MUSC 120, MUSC 121.
prerequisite_raw: All of MUSC 120, MUSC 121.

subject: MUSC
title: History of Renaissance Music
description: Sacred and secular music, vocal and instrumental. Prerequisite: MUSC 120.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 120.

subject: MUSC
title: Baroque Music
description: Prerequisite: MUSC 121.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 121.

subject: MUSC
title: Classical Music
description: Prerequisite: MUSC 121.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 121.

subject: MUSC
title: Romantic Music
description: Prerequisite: MUSC 220.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 220.

subject: MUSC
title: History of Music Since 1900
description: Prerequisite: [MUSC221]
prerequisite_raw: [MUSC221]

subject: MUSC
title: History of Jazz
description: Jazz styles and their cultural contexts; the relationship of performers and audiences; issues of race and gender; non-Western influences. Prerequisite: MUSC 221.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 221.

subject: MUSC
title: History and Repertoire of the Guitar and Related Instruments
description: A chronological survey, from the Renaissance to the present day, of music for the guitar and related instruments and of the development of the instruments themselves. Instruments considered include Renaissance and Baroque lutes, the vihuela, and early types of guitar as well as the modern six-string guitar. Musical forms and genres, national schools and the works of principal composers of every period are explored and attention is given to national systems, continuo realization, historical ornamentation and pedagogical systems. Prerequisite: [MUSC221]
prerequisite_raw: [MUSC221]

subject: MUSC
title: Song Repertoire I
description: An exploration of the solo art song repertoire from 1600 to the Romantic period. Repertoire essential to the performer and teacher will be studied through live and recorded performance with special attention given to poetic content and musical style. Prerequisite: [MUSC221] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: [MUSC221] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Secondary)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Secondary)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.

prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.

prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.

prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.

description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Major)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Major)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Major)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 271, MUSC 272, MUSC 281, MUSC 283, MUSC 291, MUSC 292, MUSC 293. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Introduction to Schenkerian Analysis
description: The key concepts of Schenker's theory of tonality. Applications to the analysis of short pieces in various tonal styles, emphasizing clear and correct graphing. Issues of interpretive scope. Prerequisite: MUSC 200.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 200.

subject: MUSC
title: Analysis of Tonal Music
description: Analytical approaches that complement Schenkerian analysis, including motivic construction, harmonic rhythm and phrase rhythm, chromaticism and enharmonicism, features of musical form, aspects of structure and hierarchy at the small and large scale. Prerequisite: MUSC 200.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 200.

subject: MUSC
title: Analytical Studies in the Development of Musical Modernism (1860 - 1940)
description: Analysis of late- and post-romantic works within a theoretical framework that bridges earlier to later works. Assignments in various formats, emphasizing analysis but possibly including composition. Prerequisite: MUSC 200.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 200.

subject: MUSC
title: Contemporary Art Music: Theory and Analysis
description: A technical approach to the diverse concert-music repertoire since 1950, including orchestral, chamber, solo, and electro-acoustic genres. Applicable theories of pitch and rhythm, with reference to composers' own writings. Prerequisite: MUSC 300.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 300.

subject: MUSC
title: Counterpoint
description: Analysis and composition of pieces that rely on the control and development of imitative, polyphonic textures. Models to be taken from one or more European historical repertoires. Prerequisite: MUSC 200.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 200.

subject: MUSC
title: Imagining Musical Performances
description: How performance and analysis engage the musical imagination, as complementary activities; how analytical observations can stimulate performance, and vice versa. Selected topics, with special emphasis on temporal factors. Prerequisite: MUSC 200.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 200.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Technology Capstone Project
description: Supervised individual music technology project on an approved topic. Restricted to students in the Minor in Applied Music Technology Prerequisite: MUSC 419. And permission of the Instructor.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC 419. And permission of the Instructor.

subject: MUSC
title: Accompanying on the Harpsichord II
description: Continuation of MUSC_V 333 with emphasis on more advanced continuo and obbligato techniques. Prerequisite: MUSC_V 333.
prerequisite_raw: MUSC_V 333.

subject: MUSC
title: Opera Theatre Techniques II
description: Advanced studies in acting, movement, gesture, dance and stage combat. Emphasis on communication and the art of singing and acting recitative in foreign languages.

subject: MUSC
title: Piano Pedagogy II: Applications
description: Teaching musical concepts and keyboard skills; observation of group and private lessons; supervised practicum. For Piano Performance majors; open to other Bachelor of Music students by permission of the instructor. Recommended pre-requisite: MUSC 340.

subject: MUSC
title: Vocal Techniques
description: A study of the scientific principles related to vocal performance: acoustical, physiological and psychological. Restricted to B.Mus. students.

subject: MUSC
title: Establishing a Career in Music
description: Best practices of the contemporary business of music, focusing on understanding present market conditions, and on targeting specific opportunities through grant-writing, resumes, press kits, publicity, recordings, and marketing. Restricted to fourth-year B.Mus. students.

subject: MUSC
title: Historical Performance Practice
description: Principles and practical application of the historically-informed performance of music. Philosophy, aesthetics, and key performance conventions of Western music before ca. 1800. Recommended: concurrent registration in MUSC 157 (Early Music Ensemble).

subject: MUSC
title: History of Opera I
description: The development of opera between 1600 and 1800. Prerequisite: All of MUSC 121, MUSC 220.
prerequisite_raw: All of MUSC 121, MUSC 220.

subject: MUSC
title: History of Opera II
description: The development of opera between 1800 and the present. Prerequisite: All of MUSC 220, MUSC 221.
prerequisite_raw: All of MUSC 220, MUSC 221.

subject: MUSC
title: Song Repertoire II
description: A sequel to MUSC 365, exploring the solo art song repertoire from the Romantic era to the present. Prerequisite: [MUSC221]
prerequisite_raw: [MUSC221]

subject: MUSC
title: Chamber Music Master Class
description: Enrolment by audition only.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Secondary)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 371, MUSC 372, MUSC 381, MUSC 382, MUSC 383, MUSC 391, MUSC 392, MUSC 393, MUSC 394.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 371, MUSC 372, MUSC 381, MUSC 382, MUSC 383, MUSC 391, MUSC 392, MUSC 393, MUSC 394.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Secondary)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 371, MUSC 372, MUSC 381, MUSC 382, MUSC 383, MUSC 391, MUSC 392, MUSC 393, MUSC 394.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 371, MUSC 372, MUSC 381, MUSC 382, MUSC 383, MUSC 391, MUSC 392, MUSC 393, MUSC 394.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Concentration)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 371, MUSC 372, MUSC 381, MUSC 382, MUSC 383, MUSC 391, MUSC 392, MUSC 393, MUSC 394.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 371, MUSC 372, MUSC 381, MUSC 382, MUSC 383, MUSC 391, MUSC 392, MUSC 393, MUSC 394.

subject: MUSC
title: Music Performance (Concentration)
description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. Prerequisite: One of MUSC 371, MUSC 372, MUSC 381, MUSC 382, MUSC 383, MUSC 391, MUSC 392, MUSC 393, MUSC 394.
prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 371, MUSC 372, MUSC 381, MUSC 382, MUSC 383, MUSC 391, MUSC 392, MUSC 393, MUSC 394.

title: Music Performance (Major)

prerequisite_raw: One of MUSC 371, MUSC 372, MUSC 381, MUSC 382, MUSC 383, MUSC 391, MUSC 392, MUSC 393, MUSC 394. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Readings in Schenkerian Theory
description: Recommended pre-requisite: MUSC 410. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: The Structure and Function of Music Theories
description: Recommended pre-requisites: one of MUSC 410, MUSC 411, MUSC 412, or permission of the instructor. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Topics in Musical Aesthetics
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Topics in Ethnomusicology
description: Topics involving methodology and fieldwork in non-Western traditions. Topics will vary and students should consult the School as to areas of focus in any given term. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Art Song: Interpretation, Collaboration, and Performance
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: MUSC
title: Historical Performance Practice
description: Principles and practical application of the historically-informed performance of music. The philosophy, aesthetics, and key performance conventions of Western music before ca. 1800. Concurrent registration in MUSC 557 is required for students in the Historical Performance Practice MMUS specialization and is recommended for other students. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

title: University Chamber Orchestra
description: Open only to graduate students. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

title: University Chamber Singers

subject: MUSC
title: Intensive Chamber Ensemble
description: Intensive coaching. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
