subject: NAME
title: Advanced Ship Structures
description: Pressure hull design; finite element analysis applications; classification rules; ice and ice loads; dynamic loads including slamming, risk and reliability. Prerequisite: CIVL 435. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: CIVL 435. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NAME
title: Advanced Ship Hydrodynamics
description: Advanced ship resistance; boundary layers; propeller design; numerical methods in hydrodynamics; advanced marine vehicles; ocean waves; cavitation; ship vibration. Includes a laboratory component involving a wave/towing tank and computational fluid dynamics project. Prerequisite: MECH 488. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: MECH 488. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NAME
title: Ship Production and Industrial Engineering
description: Build strategy; shipyard layout and equipment; manufacturing techniques; outfitting and painting techniques; material properties; corrosion; welding; fatigue; composite materials. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NAME
title: Shipbuilding Project Management
description: Terminology; planning; scheduling; budgeting and cost accounting; risk management; quality control; shipbuilding applications. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NAME
title: Ship Dynamics and Control
description: Equations of motion; ocean wave spectrums, response amplitude operators; seakeeping; maneuvering; stability; dynamic positioning. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NAME
title: Marine Engineering
description: Marine propulsion systems; ship engines; shafting; ship vibrations; on-board systems (piping, HVAC, electrical); advanced propulsion systems. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NAME
title: Introduction to Ship Design
description: Corequisite: All of MECH 488, CIVL 435, NAME 524. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of MECH 488, CIVL 435, NAME 524. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NAME
title: Computer-Aided Ship Design Project
description: A capstone design project designed to give students experience in the preliminary design of a special purpose ship. Students work individually and in teams, using advanced design software and databases, to design a vessel according to specified criteria. Recommended pre-requisites: All of NAME 581, NAME 578. Recommended co-requisites: All of NAME 502, NAME 522, NAME 501, NAME 566. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NEPL
title: Nepali Language in a Community Context
description: Beginner to conversational level Nepali combined with experiential learning and cultural activities at local Nepali community sites. Interactive practice with everyday phrases, grammar structure, and vocabulary with Nepali community members.

subject: NEST
title: Introduction to Near Eastern and Egyptian Archaeology
description: An overview of the past two centuries of archaeological investigations of the civilizations of the ancient Near East and Egypt.

subject: NEST
title: History of Women in Early to Late Medieval Muslim Societies
description: Realities of Muslim Women's lives are reconstructed through a critical examination of a variety of literary and material sources.

subject: NEUR
title: Advanced Neurosurgery I
description: Selected topics in neurosurgery and the related basic sciences. Given in alternate years. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NEUR
title: Advanced Neurosurgery II
description: The second year of the above program. Given in alternate years. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NEUR
title: Correlative Clinical Neurosurgery Rounds
description: Residents meet with radiology, neuropathology, and active staff members for discussion of problem cases. One and one-half hours weekly. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NEUR
title: Neurosurgery Professors Conference
description: One one-hour session weekly with a member of the active staff, conducted at the bedside or in conference room. Cases reviewed with emphasis on the proper application of diagnostic methods and the indications for operative management. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NEUR
title: Neuroradiology
description: Sessions conducted by members of the Department of Radiology in which case histories are reviewed and related to radiological investigation and interpretation. One hour weekly. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NEUR
title: Anatomy and Neuropathology in the Brain
description: Sessions conducted by a neuropathologist, Department of Pathology. Attended weekly by neurosurgical resident staff. Two hours weekly. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NEUR
title: Operative Neurosurgery
description: Technique of neurosurgical procedures. Anatomy, surgical judgement, pre- and post-operative care. From a general selection of neurosurgical procedures, approximately 950 major neurosurgical procedures per year are carried out under supervision. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NORD
title: Nordic Literary Cultures
description: Contemporary and historical Nordic literatures that reflect the major societal, political and cultural aspects of the circumpolar North. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 333 or NORD_V 333. Equivalency: SCAN_V 333.
exclusion_raw: Contemporary and historical Nordic literatures that reflect the major societal, political and cultural aspects of the circumpolar North. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 333 or NORD_V 333. Equivalency: SCAN_V 333.

subject: NORD
title: Nordic Contemporary Fiction
description: Explore Nordic societies through recent literature translated from Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Sámi languages, Icelandic, and other Nordic languages. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 334 or NORD_V 334. Equivalency: SCAN_V 334.
exclusion_raw: Explore Nordic societies through recent literature translated from Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Sámi languages, Icelandic, and other Nordic languages. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 334 or NORD_V 334. Equivalency: SCAN_V 334.

subject: NORD
title: Nordic Crime Fiction, Film and Television
description: Explore Nordic crime stories as a mirror and critique of their societies. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 336 or NORD_V 336. Equivalency: SCAN_V 336.
exclusion_raw: Explore Nordic crime stories as a mirror and critique of their societies. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 336 or NORD_V 336. Equivalency: SCAN_V 336.

subject: NORD
title: Nordic Cinema
description: Examine the technical, narrative, and aesthetic features of Northern European films. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 337 or NORD_V 337. Equivalency: SCAN_V 337.
exclusion_raw: Examine the technical, narrative, and aesthetic features of Northern European films. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 337 or NORD_V 337. Equivalency: SCAN_V 337.

subject: NORD
title: The Viking World
description: Wars, migrations and settlements of the Viking Age (800-1100) as seen through the Icelandic sagas, and the afterlife of the Viking world in modern culture.

subject: NORD
title: Norse Mythology
description: The pagan mythology of pre-Christian Scandinavia and its later appropriations and recycling.

subject: NORD
title: Sámi Histories and Cultures
description: Cultural history of the Sámi peoples, the Indigenous peoples of northern Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia's Kola Peninsula. Focus on traditional culture, colonization, and decolonization.

subject: NORD
title: Indigenous Activism
description: Examination of contemporary political and social conflicts in the circumpolar north, focusing on ways Indigenous people have used art, performance and activism as a tool for resistance and decolonization. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NORD
title: Nordic Drama and Film
description: Examine the origins of Nordic drama and film and their influences on these art forms worldwide. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 411 or NORD_V 411. Equivalency: SCAN_V 411.
exclusion_raw: Examine the origins of Nordic drama and film and their influences on these art forms worldwide. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 411 or NORD_V 411. Equivalency: SCAN_V 411.

subject: NORD
title: Epics of Northern Europe
description: Explore epics of Northern Europe, their connections to nationalism, and their re-imaginings in contemporary Nordic literature. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 412 or NORD_V 412. Equivalency: SCAN_V 412.
exclusion_raw: Explore epics of Northern Europe, their connections to nationalism, and their re-imaginings in contemporary Nordic literature. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 412 or NORD_V 412. Equivalency: SCAN_V 412.

subject: NORD
title: Baltic Cultures and Literatures
description: Examination through literature of the historical, cultural, and ethnic elements that have made the Baltic area (Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania) the crossroads of northeastern Europe. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 413 or NORD_V 413. Equivalency: SCAN_V 413.
exclusion_raw: Examination through literature of the historical, cultural, and ethnic elements that have made the Baltic area (Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania) the crossroads of northeastern Europe. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 413 or NORD_V 413. Equivalency: SCAN_V 413.

subject: NORD
title: Topics in Northern European Cultural Studies
description: Selected topics for advanced study, such as activism, ethnicity, gender, identity, migration, sexuality, and justice across Northern Europe. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 414 or NORD_V 414. Equivalency: SCAN_V 414.
exclusion_raw: Selected topics for advanced study, such as activism, ethnicity, gender, identity, migration, sexuality, and justice across Northern Europe. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 414 or NORD_V 414. Equivalency: SCAN_V 414.

subject: NORD
title: The World of the Sagas
description: Explore the medieval and early modern world of the Nordic region through the Icelandic sagas and their literary, cultural, and historical context. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 415 or NORD_V 415. Equivalency: SCAN_V 415.
exclusion_raw: Explore the medieval and early modern world of the Nordic region through the Icelandic sagas and their literary, cultural, and historical context. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN_V 415 or NORD_V 415. Equivalency: SCAN_V 415.

subject: NRES
title: Pursuing Innovative Solutions to Big Questions
description: Multidisciplinary approaches to solving pressing challenges in natural resources. Diversifying perspectives of natural resources and land stewardship. Skill-building in written and verbal communication, collaboration, and critical thinking.

subject: NRES
title: Pathways in Natural Resources
description: Exploration of disciplines within natural resources, including majors in the B.Sc. in Natural Resources degree, potential career pathways, and post-graduate education options.

subject: NRES
title: Land One: First-year Integrative Seminar
description: Current issues and cases in Forestry and Land and Food Systems are examined with a focus on integration of first-year subjects and exposure to both First Nations and Western perspectives. [2-0-1;2-0-1] Equivalency: LFS_V 110, FRST_V 110. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NRES
title: Scholarly Writing and Argumentation in Natural Resources
description: Communicating concepts of forestry and links to human and environmental activities through writing, elements of argumentation, evaluating evidence, and searching for and citing references to back up claims; small-class experience. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES 150 or FRST 150 or LFS 150. [3-0-0] Equivalency: FRST 150, LFS 150 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Communicating concepts of forestry and links to human and environmental activities through writing, elements of argumentation, evaluating evidence, and searching for and citing references to back up claims; small-class experience. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES 150 or FRST 150 or LFS 150. [3-0-0] Equivalency: FRST 150, LFS 150 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NRES
title: Forest Plant Biology I
description: The structure, diversity and development of trees and other plants, with emphasis on the angiosperms. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 200 or FRST_V 200. [3-2-0] Prerequisite: BIOL_V 121. Equivalency: FRST_V 200
prerequisite_raw: BIOL_V 121. Equivalency: FRST_V 200
exclusion_raw: The structure, diversity and development of trees and other plants, with emphasis on the angiosperms. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 200 or FRST_V 200. [3-2-0] Prerequisite: BIOL_V 121. Equivalency: FRST_V 200

subject: NRES
title: Forest Ecology
description: The structure and function of forest ecosystems, including: energetics; productivity; nutrient, carbon and water cycling; soils; the physical environment; population and community ecology; disturbance ecology; ecological succession; biological diversity and ecological resilience. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 201 or FRST_V 201. [3-2-0] Corequisite: One of NRES_V 200, FRST_V 200. Equivalency: FRST_V 201
corequisite_raw: One of NRES_V 200, FRST_V 200. Equivalency: FRST_V 201
exclusion_raw: The structure and function of forest ecosystems, including: energetics; productivity; nutrient, carbon and water cycling; soils; the physical environment; population and community ecology; disturbance ecology; ecological succession; biological diversity and ecological resilience. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 201 or FRST_V 201. [3-2-0] Corequisite: One of NRES_V 200, FRST_V 200. Equivalency: FRST_V 201

subject: NRES
title: Forest Plant Biology II
description: The functional biology of trees and other forest plants in their environment, with an emphasis on gymnosperms. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 210 or FRST_V 210. [3-2-0] Prerequisite: One of NRES_V 200, FRST_V 200. Equivalency: FRST_V 210
prerequisite_raw: One of NRES_V 200, FRST_V 200. Equivalency: FRST_V 210
exclusion_raw: The functional biology of trees and other forest plants in their environment, with an emphasis on gymnosperms. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 210 or FRST_V 210. [3-2-0] Prerequisite: One of NRES_V 200, FRST_V 200. Equivalency: FRST_V 210

subject: NRES
title: Forest Classification and Silvics
description: Forest classification and the application of silvics in forest management, including world forest classification systems, the Biogeoclimactic Ecosystem Classification system, and ecosystem diagnosis in the field. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 211 or FRST_V 211. [3-2-0] Prerequisite: One of NRES_V 201, FRST_V 201. Equivalency: FRST_V 211
prerequisite_raw: One of NRES_V 201, FRST_V 201. Equivalency: FRST_V 211
exclusion_raw: Forest classification and the application of silvics in forest management, including world forest classification systems, the Biogeoclimactic Ecosystem Classification system, and ecosystem diagnosis in the field. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 211 or FRST_V 211. [3-2-0] Prerequisite: One of NRES_V 201, FRST_V 201. Equivalency: FRST_V 211

subject: NRES
title: Communications Strategies
description: Strategies for thinking critically and writing effectively about topics that engage practitioners in Forestry. Planning, drafting and editing of professional-quality documents for specialists and other stakeholders. Developing oral presentation skills. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES 225 or WOOD 225. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Three credits of first-year English. Equivalency: WOOD 225 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Three credits of first-year English. Equivalency: WOOD 225 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Strategies for thinking critically and writing effectively about topics that engage practitioners in Forestry. Planning, drafting and editing of professional-quality documents for specialists and other stakeholders. Developing oral presentation skills. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES 225 or WOOD 225. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Three credits of first-year English. Equivalency: WOOD 225 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NRES
title: Introduction to Biometrics
description: Basic theories of probability and statistics. Sampling distribution, methods of estimation and hypothesis testing; goodness of fit and tests for independence; analysis of variance, regression and correlation. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion Lists: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 231 or FRST_V 231. [3-2-0] Corequisite: One of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184, MATH_V 190. Equivalency: FRST_V 231
corequisite_raw: One of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184, MATH_V 190. Equivalency: FRST_V 231
exclusion_raw: Basic theories of probability and statistics. Sampling distribution, methods of estimation and hypothesis testing; goodness of fit and tests for independence; analysis of variance, regression and correlation. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion Lists: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/facult… . Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 231 or FRST_V 231. [3-2-0] Corequisite: One of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184, MATH_V 190. Equivalency: FRST_V 231

subject: NRES
title: Computer Applications in Natural Resources
description: Techniques involved in solving forestry problems with microcomputers using word processing, spreadsheet, procedural language, and database management tools. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 232 or FRST_V 232. [3-2] Equivalency: FRST_V 232
exclusion_raw: Techniques involved in solving forestry problems with microcomputers using word processing, spreadsheet, procedural language, and database management tools. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 232 or FRST_V 232. [3-2] Equivalency: FRST_V 232

subject: NRES
title: Introduction to Geomatics for Natural Resource Management
description: Introduction to spatial thinking and principles of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and remote sensing for natural resource management. Priority enrolment to students in the Faculty of Forestry. Prerequisite: Second-year standing.
prerequisite_raw: Second-year standing.

subject: NRES
title: Introduction to Geographic Information Systems for Forestry and Conservation
description: Introduction to principles, practice and context of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) applied to forest management and natural resource conservation issues. Priority enrolment to students in the Faculty of Forestry. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 340 or CONS_V 340. [2-2-0] Prerequisite: Third- or fourth-year standing. Equivalency: CONS_V 340
prerequisite_raw: Third- or fourth-year standing. Equivalency: CONS_V 340
exclusion_raw: Introduction to principles, practice and context of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) applied to forest management and natural resource conservation issues. Priority enrolment to students in the Faculty of Forestry. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 340 or CONS_V 340. [2-2-0] Prerequisite: Third- or fourth-year standing. Equivalency: CONS_V 340

subject: NRES
title: Intermediate Geomatics for Natural Resource Management
description: Applications of remote sensing, image analysis, advanced spatial analysis and geoprocessing for natural resource management. Priority enrolment to students in the Faculty of Forestry. Students may receive credit for only one of NRES_V 341, NRES_V 340, CONS_V 340. Prerequisite: NRES_V 241. Third-year standing. Equivalency: NRES_V 340, CONS_V 340
prerequisite_raw: NRES_V 241. Third-year standing. Equivalency: NRES_V 340, CONS_V 340

subject: NRES
title: Advanced Geomatics for Natural Resource Management
description: Advanced applications of remote sensing, image analysis, spatial analysis and geoprocessing for natural resource management. Priority enrolment to students in the Faculty of Forestry. Students may receive credit for only one of FRST_V 443, NRES_V 443, NRES_V 441. Prerequisite: One of NRES_V 340, NRES_V 341. Fourth-year standing. Equivalency: FRST_V 443, NRES_V 443
prerequisite_raw: One of NRES_V 340, NRES_V 341. Fourth-year standing. Equivalency: FRST_V 443, NRES_V 443

subject: NRES
title: Remote Sensing for Ecosystem Management
description: Basic biological concepts related to interpretation of remote sensing data for land management, including the use of films and filters, and interpretation of air photographs, and other imagery. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 443 or FRST_V 443. [2-2-0] Equivalency: FRST_V 443, GEOS_V 375
exclusion_raw: Basic biological concepts related to interpretation of remote sensing data for land management, including the use of films and filters, and interpretation of air photographs, and other imagery. Credit will be granted for only one of NRES_V 443 or FRST_V 443. [2-2-0] Equivalency: FRST_V 443, GEOS_V 375

subject: NRSC
title: Advanced Research Skills in Neuroscience
description: Fundamental skills in planning, conducting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting neuroscience research. Restricted to students in MSc and PhD in Neuroscience, or MSc and PhD in Psychology. Credit will be granted for only one of NRSC_V 530 or PSYC_V 596. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
exclusion_raw: Fundamental skills in planning, conducting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting neuroscience research. Restricted to students in MSc and PhD in Neuroscience, or MSc and PhD in Psychology. Credit will be granted for only one of NRSC_V 530 or PSYC_V 596. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NRSC
title: Master's Thesis
description: Pass/Fail. Restricted to students in the MSc in Neuroscience. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NRSC
title: Action Potential and Synaptic Neuroscience
description: Basic mechanisms controlling the resting membrane potential, excitability, and synaptic transmission of cells within the brain. Restricted to students in the MSc or PhD in Neuroscience. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NRSC
title: Molecular and Developmental Neuroscience
description: Introduction to concepts and applications of molecular/cell biology and genomics in neuroscience, with an emphasis on the development of the nervous system. Restricted to students in the MSc or PhD in Neuroscience. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NRSC
title: Sensorimotor Systems
description: Basic systems-level mechanisms underlying sensory transduction, perception and movement. Restricted to students in the MSc or PhD in Neuroscience. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NRSC
title: Cognition and Emotion
description: Systems-level mechanisms underlying cognitive and affective behaviours in health and disease. Restricted to students in the MSc or PhD in Neuroscience. [3-0-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NRSC
title: Doctoral Dissertation
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: The Learning Brain
description: Applications and implications of neuroscience for society and the individual, with a focus on neuroplasticity and neuroeducation. Not for credit for students who have credit for, or are currently taking, NSCI_V 200. [3-0-0]

subject: NSCI
title: Fundamentals of Cellular and Molecular Neuroscience
description: Introduction to the field of neuroscience in general, and the fields of cellular and molecular neuroscience in particular, with emphasis on neuroanatomy, neurophysiology, and neuropharmacology. [2-2-0] Prerequisite: One of: a) 2nd-year class standing or higher in the Neuroscience specialization, or b) 8 credits of CHEM_V 1st and 6 credits of BIOL_V 1st. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of: a) 2nd-year class standing or higher in the Neuroscience specialization, or b) 8 credits of CHEM_V 1st and 6 credits of BIOL_V 1st. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Fundamentals of Behavioural and Cognitive Neuroscience
description: Emphasis on the relationship between behaviour or cognition and nervous system function. [2-2-0] Prerequisite: NSCI 200. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NSCI 200. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Research Design for the Neurosciences
description: A focus on research design relevant to the neurosciences, with an emphasis on engagement with the scientific process, from question formulation to knowledge translation. [3-0-1] Prerequisite: NSCI_V 200 and one of STAT_V 200, STAT_V 201, BIOL_V 300, PSYC_V 218. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NSCI_V 200 and one of STAT_V 200, STAT_V 201, BIOL_V 300, PSYC_V 218. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Laboratory Techniques for the Neurosciences
description: Laboratory techniques for investigating nervous system function, and for establishing relationships between nervous system function, behaviour, and cognition. Restricted to students in the Neuroscience specialization. [1-3-0] Prerequisite: NSCI_V 201. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NSCI_V 201. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Neuroscience, Ethics, and Society
description: Ethical issues associated with neuroscience, and the impact of neuroscience on society. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of NSCI_V 201, PSYC_V 304, PSYC_V 370, BIOL_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of NSCI_V 201, PSYC_V 304, PSYC_V 370, BIOL_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Neurodiversity, Brain Injury, and Brain Illness
description: Conceptual frameworks, defining features, and neurobiological mechanisms of the diverse, injured, or diseased brain. [2-2-0] Prerequisite: One of NSCI_V 201, PSYC_V 304, PSYC_V 371, BIOL_V 372. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of NSCI_V 201, PSYC_V 304, PSYC_V 371, BIOL_V 372. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Foundations of Computational Neuroscience
description: Foundations of computational neuroscience: neural modelling, simple neural networks, models of Hebbian learning, models of learning, clustering and classification. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of NSCI_V 201, PSYC_V 371, BIOL_V 371 and one of DSCI_V 100, CPSC_V 103, CPSC_V 110 and one of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184.
prerequisite_raw: One of NSCI_V 201, PSYC_V 371, BIOL_V 371 and one of DSCI_V 100, CPSC_V 103, CPSC_V 110 and one of MATH_V 100, MATH_V 102, MATH_V 104, MATH_V 120, MATH_V 180, MATH_V 184.

subject: NSCI
title: Advanced Neuroanatomy
description: Detailed coverage of neuroanatomy, with applications [3-0-0] Prerequisite: One of NSCI_V 200, PSYC_V 371, BIOL_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of NSCI_V 200, PSYC_V 371, BIOL_V 371. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Cooperative Work Placement I
description: Approved and supervised relevant work experience in an industrial, academic, or government setting for a minimum of 13 weeks, full-time. Normally taken in Summer Session after third year. Work term report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-op Program in Neuroscience. Prerequisite: Co-op workshops, and third-year standing in the neuroscience specialization. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Co-op workshops, and third-year standing in the neuroscience specialization. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Cooperative Work Placement II
description: Approved and supervised relevant work experience in an industrial, academic, or government setting for a minimum of 13 weeks, full-time. Normally taken in Term 1 of the 4th Year Winter Session. Work term report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-op Program in Neuroscience. Prerequisite: NSCI 398. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NSCI 398. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Neuroscience Capstone
description: A capstone course to provide students with a rigorous neuroscience research experience under the supervision of one or more faculty members. Integrated support and feedback is provided by peers and faculty. [3-0-0; 3-0-0] Prerequisite: Restricted to students in the neuroscience specialization. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Restricted to students in the neuroscience specialization. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Your Position in the Neurosciences
description: Practices to promote equity, diversity, inclusion, and decolonization in the neurosciences, and exploration of one's positionality through historical and present-day neuroscience. [3-0-0] Prerequisites: One of BIOL_V 372, NSCI_V 201, PSYC_V 301, PSYC_V 304, PSYC_V 371.

subject: NSCI
title: Cooperative Work Placement III
description: Approved and supervised relevant work experience in an industrial, academic, or government setting for a minimum of 13 weeks, full-time. Normally taken in Term 2 of the 4th Year Winter Session. Work term report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-op Program in Neuroscience. Prerequisite: NSCI 399. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NSCI 399. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NSCI
title: Cooperative Work Placement IV
description: Approved and supervised relevant work experience in an industrial, academic, or government setting for a minimum of 13 weeks, full-time. Normally taken in the Summer Session after 4th year. Work term report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-op Program in Neuroscience. Prerequisite: NSCI 498. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NSCI 498. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Stress and Strategies to Promote Well Being
description: Introduction to foundational knowledge related to stress, stressors, resilience, social support, and strategies to foster physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual health. Open to all students interested in learning about managing and navigating the stressors of student life.

subject: NURS
title: Diverse Perspectives on Aging
description: Examines aging experience from interdisciplinary, equity, diversity, inclusion and Indigeneity (EDI-I) (race, sex, gender, disability), and systems perspectives. Topics include older adult health and illness, age friendly communities, ageism and stigma, and end of life issues.

subject: NURS
title: Human Sexual Health
description: Beliefs, behaviours, and expressions of human sexuality and the link to health for students from any program. How sexuality is discussed and practiced from various perspectives, and strategies to promote healthy sexual expression and sexual health.

subject: NURS
title: Health Impacts of Climate Change
description: Human health impacts of the current and projected environmental crisis; study of key concepts and ideas to prepare for the future to promote wellbeing of individuals, communities and populations.

subject: NURS
title: Theoretical and Professional Foundations for Nursing Practice
description: Introduction to knowledge fundamental to the discipline and practice of nursing. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Theoretical Perspectives in Nursing: Primary Health Care
description: Analysis and application of theories, concepts, evidence and competencies guiding professional nursing practice in the context of primary health care. Prerequisite: Five of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 362 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Five of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 362 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 362 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Theoretical Perspectives in Nursing: People Living with Mental Health Challenges and Their Families
description: Theory informing a life course perspective on nursing practice with people living with mental health challenges and their families is introduced. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 363 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 363 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 363 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Basic Principles of Pharmacology for Nursing Practice
description: Basic principles of pharmacology and the basic structure and function of each body system will be explored to demonstrate how drug interactions occur within systems. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Foundational Skills and Competencies for Clinical Practice I
description: Skills and competencies for clinical practice using a variety of modalities and learning activities. Corequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Foundational Skills and Competencies for Clinical Practice II
description: Clinical practice through a variety of modalities and learning activities in the laboratory environment. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: All of NURS 331, NURS 361. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: All of NURS 331, NURS 361. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of NURS 331, NURS 361. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Foundational Skills and Competencies for Clinical Practice III
description: Skills and competencies for clinical practice across the lifespan and health care continuum through a variety of modalities and learning activities. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: Either (a) all of NURS 345, NURS 365 or (b) all of NURS 346, NURS 366 or (c) all of NURS 303, NURS 363 or (d) all of NURS 301, NURS 362. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: Either (a) all of NURS 345, NURS 365 or (b) all of NURS 346, NURS 366 or (c) all of NURS 303, NURS 363 or (d) all of NURS 301, NURS 362. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: Either (a) all of NURS 345, NURS 365 or (b) all of NURS 346, NURS 366 or (c) all of NURS 303, NURS 363 or (d) all of NURS 301, NURS 362. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Theoretical Perspectives in Nursing: Adults/Older Adults and their Families
description: Fundamental theories, concepts, evidence, and competencies pertaining to nursing practice with adults/older adults and their families. Corequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 352, NURS 360.
corequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 352, NURS 360.

subject: NURS
title: Theoretical Perspectives in Nursing: Adults/Older Adults Experiencing Acute Health Challenges and Their Families
description: Consolidation of fundamental theories, concepts, evidence, and competencies pertaining to acute care nursing practice with adults/older adults and their families. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: All of NURS 322, NURS 361. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: All of NURS 322, NURS 361. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of NURS 322, NURS 361. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Critical Inquiry and Leadership Synthesis
description: Evidence is examined and synthesized to understand and identify theoretical insights to address a leadership challenge in professional practice. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 350, NURS 351, NURS 352, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 350, NURS 351, NURS 352, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Theoretical Perspectives in Nursing: Childbearing Individuals and their Families
description: Analysis and application of theories, concepts, evidence and competencies guiding professional nursing practice with childbearing individuals and families during the transition to parenthood in a variety of practice settings and contexts. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 365 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 365 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 365 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Theoretical Perspectives in Nursing: Infants, Children, Youth and their Families
description: Analysis and application of theories, concepts, evidence and competencies guiding professional nursing practice with infants, children, youth and their families in a variety of practice settings and contexts. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 366 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 366 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 366 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Critical Inquiry and Research in Health Care Practice
description: The significance of critical inquiry and research in nursing and health care, and the fundamental concepts and processes pertaining to scientific inquiry, evidence-based practice, and research utilization in nursing. Students who take NURS 350 cannot earn credit for NURS 305, NURS 339 or NURS 342. This course is eligible for Cr/F for 19W2 only. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Leadership, Policy, and Informatics
description: The enactment of nursing leadership and policy within different health sectors and jurisdictions and the relevance and application of informatics competencies to the delivery of nursing care. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Relational and Ethical Nursing Practice
description: Relational theoretical underpinnings of nursing practice and healthcare ethics are critically examined. Corequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Promoting the Health of Indigenous People
description: Foundations to contribute to supporting and providing high quality, ethical, respectful and culturally safe health care in partnership with Indigenous people in Canada and around the globe. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360.

subject: NURS
title: Theoretical Perspectives in Nursing: Complexities in Seniors Care
description: Research and clinical practice innovations in the care of Seniors and their families (e.g., philosophies of care; age-friendly initiatives) and provide strategies for improving their health through the purposeful integration of such practices in clinical settings. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Nursing Practice with Adults/Older Adults and their Families
description: Nursing practice to integrate and consolidate professional nursing knowledge, skills, and competencies in care of adults/older adults with stable/expected health care challenges and their families. Practice learning may occur in settings like community, home, inpatient, clinics and/or simulated learning. Corequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Nursing Practice with Adults/Older Adults Experiencing Acute Health Challenges and their Families
description: Clinical practice to integrate and consolidate professional nursing knowledge, skills and competencies in the care of adults/older adults experiencing acute health challenges and their families. Practice learning may occur in settings like community, home, inpatient, clinics and/or simulated learning. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: All of NURS 331, NURS 322. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: All of NURS 331, NURS 322. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: All of NURS 331, NURS 322. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Nursing Practice in Primary Health Care Contexts
description: Clinical practice to integrate and consolidate professional nursing knowledge, skills and competencies in the context of primary health care. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 301 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 301 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 301 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Nursing Practice with People Living with Mental Health Challenges and Their Families
description: Students will apply theory and concepts from a life course perspective in provision of nursing care to persons living with mental health challenges and their families. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 303 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 303 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 303 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Nursing Practice with Childbearing Individuals and Families
description: Clinical practice to integrate and consolidate professional nursing knowledge, skills and competencies in the care of childbearing individuals, infants, and their families. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 345 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: NURS 345 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 345 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Nursing Practice with Infants, Children, Youth and their Families: Practicum
description: Nursing practice to integrate and consolidate professional nursing knowledge, skills and competencies in the care of infants, children, youth and their families. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352. Corequisite: NURS 346 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 310, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 330, NURS 352. Corequisite: NURS 346 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 346 and one of NURS 323, NURS 401. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

title: Foundational Skills and Competencies for Clinical Practice IV
description: Students are prepared with the skills and competencies for clinical practice in simulated acute and community settings through a variety of modalities and learning activities. Prerequisite: All of NURS 300, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 323, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: Either (a) all of NURS 345, NURS 365, NURS 346, NURS 366 or (b) all of NURS 303, NURS 363, NURS 301, NURS 362. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 300, NURS 321, NURS 322, NURS 323, NURS 330, NURS 352, NURS 360. Corequisite: Either (a) all of NURS 345, NURS 365, NURS 346, NURS 366 or (b) all of NURS 303, NURS 363, NURS 301, NURS 362. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

title: Foundational Skills and Competencies for Clinical Practice V

title: Consolidated Practice Experience
description: Nursing practice to consolidate nursing knowledge, theory, evidence, and practice, and facilitate the transition to professional practice. Prerequisite: All of NURS 344, NURS 402, NURS 430. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 344, NURS 402, NURS 430. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Theoretical Foundations of Nursing Practice
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Leadership in Nursing and Health
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Administrative Leadership in Nursing
description: Study of organizational behaviour, management methods and administrative processes in health care. Prerequisite: NURS 512. Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NURS 512. Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Advanced Practice in Nursing
description: Study of advanced practice nursing models, their development and implementation with a changing health care system. Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Theoretical Foundations of Clinical Education
description: Theories of learning and their implications for the design of clinical learning experiences. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Design of Clinical Informatics Solutions
description: Fundamental theories, concepts, and processes in the fields of software design in healthcare. Restricted to students in the Graduate Certificate in Clinical Informatics program. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Planning and Implementation in Clinical Informatics
description: Introduction to and application of organisational considerations for planning and implementing clinical informatics solutions. Restricted to students in the Graduate Certificate in Clinical Informatics program. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Data and Databases for Clinical Informatics
description: Database design, interoperability and terminology standards, knowledge representation and management, computerized clinical decision support including artificial intelligence, artificial intelligence bias, machine learning, and information visualization. Introduction to and application of knowledge management strategies in clinical informatics. Restricted to students in the Graduate Certificate in Clinical Informatics program. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Educational Processes in Nursing
description: Study of the historical development, theoretical basis, practical knowledge, accountability of, and issues regarding curriculum process and teaching in nursing education or practice. Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Clinical Nursing Education
description: Study of the theory and practice of clinical nursing education. Prerequisite: One of NURS 540, NURS 531. Or be enrolled in the MHLP program. Corequisite: NURS 511. Or be enrolled in the MHLP program. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: One of NURS 540, NURS 531. Or be enrolled in the MHLP program. Corequisite: NURS 511. Or be enrolled in the MHLP program. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 511. Or be enrolled in the MHLP program. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Social Epidemiology: Special Populations
description: Trends and social and institutional policies and practices that influence the health and illness profiles of particular population groups; trends in the social organization of service delivery for their impact on health. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Qualitative Methods and Analysis
description: Prerequisite: NURS 552. Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NURS 552. Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Quantitative Research Methods and Analytic Strategies in Nursing and Health Sciences
description: Prerequisite: NURS 552. Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NURS 552. Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Methods in Nursing Science.
description: Prerequisite: NURS 504. Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NURS 504. Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Advanced Research Methods
description: Prerequisite: All of NURS 580, NURS 548, NURS 549. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: All of NURS 580, NURS 548, NURS 549. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: The Politics of Health Policy
description: Corequisite: NURS 511. Or be enrolled in the MHLP program. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 511. Or be enrolled in the MHLP program. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Primary Care I
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Primary Care II
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: PRIMARY CARE III
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Topics in Social and Environmental Planning to Foster Health of Populations
description: Characteristics of social and built environments for their impact on the health of populations. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Family Nurse Practitioner Consolidated Practicum
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: The Philosophy of Evidence
description: Students not enrolled in the doctoral program require permission of instructor. Prerequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Leadership in Knowledge Application and Translation
description: Prerequisite: NURS 580. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: NURS 580. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Specialized Domains of Nursing Practice
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Ethical and Professional Issues in NP Practice
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Scholarly Practice Advancement Research Project (SPAR)
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Culminating Project
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Master's Thesis
description: Corequisite: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: NURS 511. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS
title: Doctoral Seminar
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: NURS

subject: OBMS
title: Endodontics
description: Application of the basic principles of endodontics. [0-1.5-0; 1-1.5-0]

subject: OBMS
title: Introduction to Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery

subject: OBMS
title: Oral Radiology
description: Radiographic techniques and radiological interpretation with emphasis on extraoral techniques. [0.5-1.5]

subject: OBMS
title: Oral Medicine and Oral Diagnosis
description: Oral diagnosis, including orofacial pain and temporomandibular disorders. [1-3-0; 1-3-0]

subject: OBMS
title: Oral Medicine, Oral Diagnosis and Therapeutics
description: Assessment and treatment of advanced periodontal diseases. [1-2-2]

subject: OBMS
title: Advanced Oral Radiology and Oral Radiography

subject: OBMS
title: Advanced Periodontics
description: Assessment and treatment of advanced periodontal diseases. [1-3-0]

subject: OBST
title: Reproductive Endocrinology I
description: Neuroendocrine regulation of reproduction, regulation of the ovarian and testicular function. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OBST
title: Physiology of the Mother, Fetus and Newborn
description: Functional development of the placenta and major organ systems in the fetal and newborn period in man and animals. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OBST
title: Fetal and Perinatal Metabolism
description: Prerequisite: Knowledge of fetal growth and development, physiology, pathology of labour. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Knowledge of fetal growth and development, physiology, pathology of labour. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OBST
title: Reproductive Endocrinology II
description: Lectures and seminars on cellular processes in hormone secretion, steroid biosynthesis, steroid transport and metabolism, mechanism of hormone action, prostaglandins in reproduction. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OBST
title: Experimental Techniques in Reproductive Biology
description: Laboratory course on: cell and organ cultures, radioimmunoassay of steroid and protein hormones and prostaglandins, in vitro fertilization, neuroendocrine techniques, techniques to study fetuses, techniques for metabolic studies in newborn animals. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OBST
title: Seminars in Reproductive Biology
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OBST
title: Perinatal Epidemiology
description: Indicators of maternal/newborn well-being across population subgroups, changing trends in obstetrical intervention, perinatal morbidity, and the analysis of perinatal data. Corequisite: One of OBST 502, OBST 504. Equivalency: SPPH537 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
corequisite_raw: One of OBST 502, OBST 504. Equivalency: SPPH537 This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OBST
title: M.Sc. Thesis
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OBST
title: Doctoral Dissertation
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OHS
title: Operative Dentistry
description: The art and science of diagnosing and treating single tooth defects. [0-4.5-0]

subject: OHS
title: Orthodontics
description: Differential diagnosis, treatment planning, biomechanical principles and clinical treatment. [1-2-0]

subject: OHS
title: Prosthodontics I
description: The art and science of restoring and replacing teeth and surrounding tissues. [2-5-0; 1-9-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OHS
title: Advanced Operative Dentistry
description: The art and science of diagnosing and treating single tooth defects. [0-3-0] Prerequisite: [OHS 430]

subject: OHS
title: Practice Management
description: Ethics, jurisprudence, practice management, intra- and interprofessional relationships. [2-0-0]

subject: OHS
title: Prosthodontics II
description: The art and science of restoring and replacing teeth and surrounding tissues. [1-9-0; 0-12-0] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ONCO
title: Interdisciplinary Research in Oncology
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ONCO
title: Concepts in Oncology
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ONCO
title: Seminars in Oncology
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ONCO
title: Master of Science Thesis
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ONCO
title: Doctoral Dissertation
description: This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Advanced Orthopaedics I
description: Selected topics in orthopaedic surgery and related basic sciences. Given in alternate years. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Advanced Orthopaedics II
description: The second year of the above program which will be given in alternate years. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Orthopaedic Clinic
description: Evaluation of new patients and diagnosis and treatment of appropriate diseases. Basic signs and clinical features are both stressed in the total management of the patient. Two hours per week in the Outpatient Department under supervision of an orthopaedics faculty member. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Orthopaedic Bedside Clinic
description: Evaluation of orthopaedic diseases and injuries in patients at bedside. A review of clinical features is correlated with relevant physiology and pathology. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Orthopaedic Grand Rounds
description: Formal presentations by the orthopaedic residents, fellows, faculty and guests. Subject matter includes the whole spectrum of orthopaedics. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Rheumatology Conference
description: Patients with a variety of rheumatological disorders are presented for discussion and evaluation in this combined conference, which rheumatologists and orthopaedic surgeons who have a special interest in reconstructive surgery attend. During each weekly two hour session, patients with difficult management problems are presented for clinical evaluation and discussion of medical and orthopaedic treatment. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Orthopaedic Surgical Anatomy
description: A course in clinical anatomy as applied to orthopaedics. A regional approach involving surgical dissections in cadavers. Each session lasts two hours. Emphasis is on surgical anatomical approach. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Orthopaedic Basic Science Course
description: Weekly lectures by orthopaedic faculty and guest faculty from other departments. Lecture topics include applied physiology, anatomy, and pathology as they relate to orthopaedic diseases. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Orthopaedic Seminars
description: A series of seminars is given weekly, and during each 2-hour session a topic in clinical orthopaedics is reviewed. The subject matter includes the whole spectrum of orthopaedics. One or more faculty members are in attendance at each seminar. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Paediatric Orthopaedics
description: Case presentation in paediatric orthopaedics, stressing history, physical findings and total management of the patient, including a review of paediatric fractures with x-rays. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Orthopaedic Surgery
description: The practical application of orthopaedics in the operating room with discussion of techniques of surgery, anatomy, pathology, pathophysiology and complications of diseases. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Trauma Rounds
description: Orthopaedic traumatology is reviewed, with emphasis being placed on applied basic science, surgical anatomy, diagnosis and definitive management. These sessions are supervised by a faculty member and are held weekly, each session lasting one hour. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Bone Tumour Registry
description: A review of musculoskeletal oncology and related problems with presentation of clinical and laboratory information, radiographs and pathological materials. One and one-half hours monthly. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: ORPA
title: Seminar in Orthopaedics
description: A series of 60 seminars in orthopaedics and traumatic surgery given over a two-year period: thirty sessions in each of the two years. One evening per week throughout the Winter Session. For post-graduate students proceeding to Certification and Fellowship of the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Introduction to Human Occupation
description: Explores human occupation, conceptualized as all activities people do based on need, obligation, or preference. As the core construct of the discipline of occupational science and practice of occupational therapy, human occupation is examined for its relation to personal and social determinants of health. [3-0-0]

subject: OSOT
title: Fundamentals of Occupational Therapy: Theory, Conceptual Models and the Practice Process
description: Fundamentals of occupational therapy, including values and beliefs, conceptual models, client-centred principles, and practice process frameworks are introduced. Professional reasoning is demonstrated through resolution of case-based client occupational issues. Critical appraisal of theory fosters nuanced understandings of occupation and health. [1-2-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Health, Illness & Occupation
description: Concepts and models of occupation, health, and illness are introduced and appraised. Narratives from persons with lived experience and interactive assignments are used for acquiring biopsychosocial information on health conditions that impact occupational performance across lifespan and diverse life experiences. [1-0-1.5] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Occupation in Practice I: Foundation of Occupational Therapy Assessment and Intervention
description: Labs, simulations and tutorials provide opportunities to practice evidenced based foundational skills, techniques and approaches in preparation for occupational therapy practice in the local and regional context. [0-3-3] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Professional Development of the Occupational Therapist I
description: Concepts of professionalism, reflexivity, cultural humility and collaboration are introduced to develop the skills of a self-directed, culturally safe, lifelong learner, who consciously uses theory, evidence and critical thinking skills to maintain, evaluate and improve their practice of occupational therapy. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Occupation in Practice II: Advancing Theory, Assessment & Intervention
description: Building on OSOT 511 and OSOT 515, complex skills and approaches to enable client occupational engagement are applied through workshops and labs. Biomechanical, psychosocial, neuro-rehabilitative and developmental frames of reference will inform professional reasoning as students work through the occupational therapy practice process. [2-3-3] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Becoming an Evidence-Informed Occupational Therapy Practitioner
description: Assumptions and principles of qualitative and quantitative research designs; elements of basic research designs for investigating and evaluating occupational performance and diverse issues relevant to occupational science and occupational therapy are introduced, emphasizing critical appraisal of occupational therapy research literature. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Occupational Therapy Practice: Fieldwork I
description: Preparation for practice concepts to facilitate integration of knowledge and skills introduced in term 1 of the MOT program. Demonstration of emerging Occupational Therapy competencies for a total of 5 weeks of supervised fieldwork experience in affiliated agencies is required. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Occupational Therapy Practice: Fieldwork II
description: Advanced integration of knowledge and skills introduced in terms 1, 2, 3 & 4 of the MOT program to demonstrate Occupational Therapy intermediate competencies for a total of 12 weeks of supervised fieldwork experience in affiliated health agencies. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Occupation in Practice III: Occupational Therapy Assessment and Intervention
description: A 3-term course, builds upon year 1 to further develop professional reasoning skills, synthesize theory and practice approaches in occupational therapy, and provide opportunities to acquire assessment and intervention skills according to the competencies required to enter occupational therapy practice. [0-2-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Developing Evidence for Occupational Therapy Practice
description: Enhances knowledge of research (or program evaluation) process and provides hands-on experience to create, inform, and disseminate evidence relevant to occupational science or occupational therapy. [2-0-8] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Professional Development of the Occupational Therapist II
description: Professional identity, professionalism, and cultural humility are further explored. Knowledge is applied to develop self-directed, culturally safe, lifelong learners. Conscious use of theory, evidence and critical thinking will be utilized to maintain, evaluate and improve occupational therapy practice. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Societal and Environmental Influences on Occupation and Occupational Therapy Practice
description: Current legislative, socio-political, economic, cultural, and service delivery issues influencing occupational therapy practice are addressed. The structural, systemic, and contextual influences upon clients' health and occupations are also examined. [2-0-2] This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Innovations in Occupation: Developing and Evaluating Occupational Therapy Programs
description: To address inequities and meet the occupational needs of diverse communities, students will learn, critique and apply program development principles. Program development principles include needs assessment, program design, budgeting and resource planning, marketing, program evaluation, and proposal writing and presentation. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: OSOT
title: Occupational Therapy Practice: Fieldwork III
description: Evidence of integration and synthesis of complex knowledge and skills provided throughout the MOT program to demonstrate Occupational Therapy advanced competencies for a total of 14 weeks of supervised fieldwork experience in affiliated health agencies. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: PATH
title: Modern Microscopy
description: Theoretical and practical application of widely used microscopy techniques.

subject: PATH
title: Safety for Medical Laboratory Scientists
description: Workplace hazards of chemical, biological and ergonomic origin.

subject: PATH
title: Introduction to Medical Laboratory Science - Histochemistry and Hematology
description: Fundamentals and applications of Histochemistry. Introduction to Hematology. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 300 or PATH_V 307 and PATH_V 308.

subject: PATH
title: Introduction to Medical Laboratory Science - Clinical Chemistry
description: Selected areas of clinical chemistry and relevant fundamentals of human physiology. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 300 or PATH_V 307 and PATH_V 308.

subject: PATH
title: Biomolecular Foundations: Nucleic Acids, Carbohydrates and Physical Biochemistry
description: Basic and physical biochemical sciences relevant to medical laboratory science with application to clinical and translational research. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 301 or PATH_V 309 and PATH_V 310.

subject: PATH
title: Biomolecular Foundations: Proteins, Lipids and Bioenergetics
description: Basic and physical biochemical sciences relevant to medical laboratory science with application to clinical and translational research. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 301 or PATH_V 309 and PATH_V 310.

subject: PATH
title: Cytogenetics and Molecular Genetics
description: Fundamentals of human genetics and molecular techniques as they relate to detecting genetic abnormalities in research and clinical settings. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 303 or PATH_V 311 and PATH_V 312.

subject: PATH
title: Tissue Culture and Cytology
description: Fundamentals as they relate to the study of cells in controlled environments and their role in cancer development within research and clinical applications. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 303 or PATH_V 311 and PATH_V 312.

subject: PATH
title: Normal Histology – Cells and Tissues
description: Description and identification of human anatomy at the microscopic level and how this relates to function. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 304 or PATH_V 313 and PATH_V 314.

subject: PATH
title: Normal Histology – Organ Systems
description: Description and identification of human anatomy at the microscopic level and how this relates to function. Prerequisite: PATH_V 313. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 304 or PATH_V 313 and PATH_V 314.
prerequisite_raw: PATH_V 313. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 304 or PATH_V 313 and PATH_V 314.

subject: PATH
title: Bacteriology, Mycology and Parasitology
description: Biological attributes, clinical features, pathogenesis and pathology, epidemiology, immunological reactions, laboratory diagnosis, and preventative measures of human microbial pathogens. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 327 or PATH_V 315 and PATH_V 316.

subject: PATH
title: Virology and Public Health Fundamentals
description: Mechanisms of viral replication, transmission, disease progression, and laboratory diagnosis. Broader public health impact and basic strategies for prevention and control of pathogens in a larger community context. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 327 or PATH_V 315 and PATH_V 316.

subject: PATH
title: Introduction to Human Pathology
description: Causes, natural history and pathophysiology of common disease processes. Prerequisite: 6 credits each first year BIOL and CHEM
prerequisite_raw: 6 credits each first year BIOL and CHEM

subject: PATH
title: Co-operative Work Placement I
description: Approved and supervised technical work experience in either industrial, public, or academic laboratory for a minimum of 14 weeks. Normally taken in Winter Session of third year or Summer Session after third year. Technical report required. Restricted to students in the BMLSc Co-op Program. Prerequisite: Two terms in BMLSc. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: Two terms in BMLSc. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: PATH
title: Co-operative Work Placement II
description: Approved and supervised technical work experience in either industrial, public, or academic laboratory for a minimum of 14 weeks. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Coop Program in BMLSc. Prerequisite: PATH 398. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
prerequisite_raw: PATH 398. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

subject: PATH
title: Seminars in Current Topics
description: Oral and written presentation and critical appraisal of scientific papers.

subject: PATH
title: Research and Career Skills
description: Overall operation of research laboratories including roles of personnel and funding; communication of scientific research; career skills and pathways; communication, collaboration, presentations and peer-assessment skills.

subject: PATH
title: Advanced Hematology
description: Theoretical and practical examination of modern concepts which relate to the practice of medical laboratory science. Prerequisite: PATH_V 307. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 402 or PATH_V 409 and PATH_V 410.
prerequisite_raw: PATH_V 307. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 402 or PATH_V 409 and PATH_V 410.

subject: PATH
title: Hematological Malignancies
description: A comprehensive overview that includes pathogenesis, clinical presentation, and treatment. Prerequisite: PATH_V 307. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 402 or PATH_V 409 and PATH_V 410.
prerequisite_raw: PATH_V 307. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 402 or PATH_V 409 and PATH_V 410.

subject: PATH
title: Diagnostic Histochemistry
description: Theoretical and practical application of histochemical techniques. Prerequisite: PATH_V 307. Credit will be granted for only one of PATH_V 404 or PATH_V 411.
prerequisite_raw: PATH_V 307. Credit will be granted for only one of PATH_V 404 or PATH_V 411.
exclusion_raw: Theoretical and practical application of histochemical techniques. Prerequisite: PATH_V 307. Credit will be granted for only one of PATH_V 404 or PATH_V 411.

subject: PATH
title: Introduction to Advanced Techniques in Pathology and Laboratory Medicine
description: Theoretical foundations and practical applications of advanced pathology and laboratory medicine techniques in both research and clinical settings.

subject: PATH
title: Analytical Techniques and Basic Tests in Clinical Chemistry
description: Biochemistry tests in clinical medicine and the analytical chemistry techniques used to produce the results; pathophysiology of common clinical conditions. Prerequisites: PATH_V 308. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 406 or PATH_V 413 and PATH_V 414.

subject: PATH
title: Specialized Tests in Clinical Chemistry
description: Biochemistry tests in clinical medicine; pathophysiology of common clinical conditions. Prerequisites: PATH_V 413. Credit will be granted for either PATH_V 406 or PATH_V 413 and PATH_V 414.

subject: PATH
title: Immunopathology
description: Innate and adaptive immunity and how these host defense mechanisms are involved in both health and illness.

subject: PATH
title: Basic Principles of Infection Prevention and Control
description: This course provides the basic principles to prevent the spread of microorganisms pathogenic to humans. It may be taken towards a Certificate in Infection Control.

subject: PATH
title: Viral Infections in Humans
